loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: Ofelia, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y tiene dos hijos, reside en el sector San Manuel, Cortes. Hace 6 años decidió por vender mercadería, vende zapatos, lociones, ropa nueva y usada y artículos para el hogar y también vende productos de la canasta básica familiar en su pulpería como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, churros, pan, dulces, etc. Las ventas las realiza en su casa, de manera ambulante y por encargos. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado de 12,000 lempiras va comprar ropa nueva y usada para vender y poder hacer más clientes. Su meta es mantener productos que los clientes le piden y poner a sus hijos al colegio a estudiar.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 33 years old, in a common-law relationship with her partner, and has two children. She resides in a section of San Manuel, Cortes.

Six years ago she decided to sell merchandise such as shoes, lotions, new and used clothes, and household goods. Ofelia also has a store where she sells basic necessities such as rice, beans, sugar, snack foods, bread, sweets, and other items. Her sales are conducted at her house, as a street vendor, and by taking orders.

The loan she is requesting is in the amount of 12,000 HNL and will be used to buy new and used clothing to sell so that she can attract more customers. Her goals include maintaining an inventory of products that her customers request and sending her children to school so that they can study.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Patricia Concepción

texts.es:
Patricia es una pequeña productora de café en Jinotega, Nicaragua. Tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad donde viven, y a los cuales ha mantenido y provisto todo lo que han necesitado según su condición económica. Esta pequeña emprendedora, genera en promedio 2 empleos durante el año para las diferentes labores de su finca. Está integrada en los procesos de certificación de Fairtrade, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices, lo cual  muestra el buen trabajo que Dña. Patricia ha realizado en su finca. 
Ha tenido 4 financiamientos de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), y actualmente está solicitando un financiamiento para asegurar la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que le permitan darle un manejo adecuado a sus plantaciones y obtener mejores rendimientos y calidad en el próximo ciclo de café. Ella menciona, que el amor a sus hijos y al trabajo, le ha ayudado a ser más fuerte cada día y a enfrentar los desafíos que se le presentan. Confía que con la gestión de este préstamo, podrá mejorar los rendimientos de su café y por tanto sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Patricia has a small coffee farm in Jinotega, Nicaragua.  She has 3 children, all in the local school, and she provides for them in the best way she can with the limited resources she has.  Patricia employs, on average, 2 people during the year to help her with farm work.  She has fulfilled the requirements for certification of Fairtrade, UTZ and C.A.F.E. Practices, all of which recognize the quality of the products she produces.  

Patricia has borrowed from Pueblos en Accion Comunitaria (PAC) 4 times in the past and now she is applying for a new loan that she will use to buy the fertilizer and other supplies that she needs for her next planting.  The investment will ensure that she gets the most from her work at the next harvest.  She says that the love she feels for her children helps her to overcome the day-to-day challenges that farming throws at her.  She is confident that the loan will improve her yields and, in turn, increase the income she can make to support her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: José Felipe

texts.es:
José de 59 años de edad, es un hombre dedicado, responsable y trabajador, que junto a su esposa han podido lograr que sus hijos sean unas personas de bien y laboriosas. Solo pudo estudiar hasta 3° grado, para lograr cursar este nivel tuvo que estudiar en la noche, ya que en el día le ayudaba a su padre en trabajos de carpintería. Sus cuatros hijos ya formaron su propia familia, solamente viven con él, tres nietos que están estudiando.

Se dedica a la carpintería, tiene 25 años de experiencia y es bien conocido por los trabajos realizados a los clientes, aprendió esta actividad de su padre, este oficio viene de familia, tanto su padre como los demás hermanos son carpinteros. Anteriormente trabajaba también en la albañilería. Trabaja de lunes a sábado.

El préstamo lo utilizara en la compra de material para la elaboración de muebles que tiene encargados y necesita tenerlos lo más pronto posible, además, invertirá en el arreglo de algún equipo que tiene en mal estado. Con esta ayuda, aprovechara la oportunidad de generar mejores ingresos.

Su sueño es lograr establecer un gran taller de carpintería, donde sus nietos mantengan este negocio y que se puedan valerse por sí mismos de este trabajo. Dejarles de herencia el haberles enseñado un oficio, para que se ganen el pan de cada día de una manera honrada.
texts.en:
José is 59 years old. He is a dedicated, responsible, and hard-working man. Together with his wife, he has been able to raise his children to be good, hard-working people. José could only study through the third grade. To achieve this level of education he had to study at night, since he helped his father during the day with the carpentry work. His four children already have their own families. Only three of his grandchildren who are studying live with him.

José works in carpentry. He has 25 years of experience and is well known for the work he does for his clients. He learned the activity from his father, and it is a family business. Both his father and his other brothers are carpenters. José also previously worked in masonry. He works Monday through Saturday.

José will use the loan to buy materials to make furniture that has been ordered and that he needs to have as soon as possible. He is also going to invest in fixing some equipment that is in poor condition. With this help, José will have the opportunity to generate greater income.

José's dream is to be able to open up a carpentry workshop where his grandchildren can maintain the business and fend for themselves in this work. He is leaving them an inheritance by having taught them a trade so that they can earn their daily bread in an honorable way.

loans.use: to buy material to make furniture that has been ordered and that he needs to have as soon as possible. He will also invest in fixing some equipment that is in poor condition.

loans.name: Quirina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Quirina works hard to support her family. She has a bread vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Quirina is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more bread to sell to her customers.

Quirina has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
Ria lives in West Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Ria manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Ria is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Ria joined Ruma recently because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Ria sees improvements in her shop.  For the last  month, she earned an average of $30/day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  Her goal for her business is to gain more new business in the future

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credits sales and bill payments

loans.name: Vardkes

texts.en:
Vardkes is 40 years old and he lives in the village of Khashtarak in the Tavush region. Vardkes’ son is just back from the army and he is looking for a job even though the family’s main occupation is farming and agriculture. Vardkes also has a daughter who studies at the medical college. All of his family members greatly help him in farming. 

Vardkes is engaged in swine breeding and aviculture. His farm is not small and there is an unbelievable amount of work. Vardkes  works night and day to keep his farm  in order: caring for so many pigs and piglets, making sure to have enough fodder for them, taking great care of 40 chickens that need as much time and effort as any other farm animal.  Vardkes also does cargo transfers with his own car to earn some more money. All together, it hardly covers his family’s requirements, the farm’s needs and his daughter’s tuition costs.

Vardkes is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of animal fodder for his farm piglets and chickens, to keep them fed and to prepare some of them for sale.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for his piglets and chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Usep

texts.en:
Usep lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling food (noodles) and mobile phone airtime credits. Usep is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Usep joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Usep sees improvements in his shop. For the last month, he has earned an average of $15 in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

His goal for his business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: María Rosenda

texts.es:
María de 65  años de edad, es madre de dos hijos ya mayores de edad, tienen 40 y 39 años de edad, viven ya con sus propias familias, de los cuales solo su hija siempre esta pendiente de la familia, su hijo hace años que se fue del hogar y no ha vuelto a saber de él.
En su casa solo vive su esposo quien trabaja en la agricultura (siembra de granos básicos maíz y frijoles), y también de jornalero. Además,  vive en su casa una nieta, ya mayor de edad que esta estudiando el nivel básico en la ciudad mas cercana.	|
María se dedica a la venta de antojitos (enchiladas y tostadas de platano) desde los 15 años de edad, ya que se vio en la necesidad de luchar en la vida ya que su madre murió y su padre la abandono a ella y a su hermano, quien hace ya varios años murió en un accidente de transito.
Ella prepara sus antojitos y vende tres días a la semana, su nieta le ayuda, vendiendo por toda la comunidad por las tardes.
Solicita un crédito en credicampo, para invertir $300 en la compra de materia prima, como maíz, repollo, condimentos, sal, papas, etc, para hacer mas antojitos y vender en la comunidad.
También necesita el resto para ayudar a su nieta hacer un viaje para panamá, donde se ira a trabajar en un centro comercial, de donde tiene esperanzas que le ayude a salir adelante a la familia.
María sueña con ir creciendo poco a poco con su negocio, ya que tiene un perfecto conocimiento de la actividad y le es rentable. Ademas, en el futuro pretende hacer unas mejoras al hogar, pintarla y poner ladrillo en el piso en el corredor de la vivienda.
Además, planea hacer en el futuro una habitación mas en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, 65, is the mother of two adult children, ages 40 and 39, who live with their own families.  Her daughter is the only one who in touch with the family since her son left home several years ago and she has not heard from him since.  María lives with her husband who is a farmer (growing basic grains such as corn and beans) and also works as a hired wage earner.  An adult granddaughter also lives with them.  She attends school in the nearest city.

María sells snack foods (enchiladas and banana toast) and has been in business for 15 years.  She had to earn a living when her mother died and her father left her with her brother, who died in a traffic accident several years ago.  She makes the food she sells three days a week with the help of her granddaughter, and sells the products in the community in the afternoons.

She is requesting a loan through Cedicampo for $300 to buy ingredients such as corn, cabbage, condiments, salt, potatoes, etc. to make her food products.

She also needs the rest of the loan to help her granddaughter travel to Panama where she will work in a shopping center.  She hopes to be able to help the family.

María wants to increase her business little by little since she has expertise in the field and it is profitable.  In the future she would like to renovate and paint the house and install a brick floor in the hall.  She also wants to add a new room at some point.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as corn, cabbage, condiments, salt, potatoes, etc. to make the food she sells in the community.  She also needs the rest to help her granddaughter travel to Panama.

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en: Grigor is a young, skilled, and clever person. He is 29 years old and lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. He is the son of a very famous cabinetmaker in the city. He continues his father’s work, as accurately and as good as his father used to do. He works in a small workshop near their house. Grigor works with several furniture stores, which constantly give him orders. He also has loyal customers who used to buy furniture from his father; now they buy from him. Grigor works with great pleasure, and he makes each item as an individual design. As he says, he is skilled but he needs his father’s advice and knowledge about this craft. Recently he has been primarily making tables of different shapes and chairs. He still has several orders waiting to be made. Grigor asks for a loan of 500,000 AMD to buy tools and timber in order to fulfill several orders simultaneously and on time.

loans.use: to buy tools and timber for making furniture

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es:
María de 31 años de edad,  es una señora muy trabajadora y valiente, ya que le ha tocado muy duro en la vida,  realizar el doble rol de madre y padre a la vez, ya que por motivos económicos su compañero de vida emigro hacia los Estados Unidos, y sin recibir ninguna ayuda le ha tocado salir adelante con sus 3 hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela del caserío.


María tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos como azúcar, aceite, arroz entre otros. Ademas de vender, realiza labores de lavado de ropa a una vecina de donde recibe un pago semanal de $30, y es de esos pequeños ingresos que va sacando poco a poco a sus hijos para que estudien y sean en un futuro profesionales. 


Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando al cliente, para que pueda invertir mas en la compra productos para la venta, y ademas otra parte la invertirá en 100 pollos de engorde, ya que ha descubierto una oportunidad y con la ayuda de su hermana que tiene experiencia sacaran adelante la camada de pollos.

 María quiere que sus hijos salgan adelante con sus estudios y espera verlos a todos unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria, 31, is a courageous woman who has had to overcome many hard knocks.  Her husband is in the United States, forced there by a lack of work here, and she has to be both father and mother to her 3 children.  The children are studying in the local school and she is raising them alone.

Maria has a small corner shop where she sells sugar, cooking oil, rice and other merchandise.  She also takes in laundry for $30 a week.  Her meager earnings from the business are all she has to help her children continue in school and, she hopes, work at paid careers one day.  

Your loan will help Maria stock her store and buy 100 chickens that she will fatten for sale.  Maria's sister has experience raising chickens and Maria thinks she can make a success of the business with her sister's help.  

For the future, Maria wants her children to continue on in school and work at paid careers one day.

loans.use: to buy products for resale.

loans.name: Iwan

texts.en:
Iwan lives in West Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Iwan manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  Iwan is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Iwan joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Iwan sees improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he earned an average of $10/day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand and gain more new business in the future

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credits transactions on weekends

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali is 26 years old and her husband is 40 years old. Both of them earn a living by cultivating different crops in the field. Dipali and her husband are both illiterate (able to sign their names only). They have two children, who are both receiving primary education. 

From the very beginning, Dipali has had many problems running her family. Due to lack of capital, it was not possible for them to buy good quality seeds for the cultivation of tomatoes. For this reason, they have taken out a loan from Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) so that they can buy tomato seeds and fertilizers. They dream of giving a bright future to their children so that their children can become established in their life. They hope that the loan they have taken out will help them in the future and they will have high profits.

Dipali is grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for tomato cultivation.

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Sri lives in West Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Sri manages a small shop selling stationery and mobile phone airtime credit.  Sri is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Sri joined Ruma two months ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Sri sees improvements in her shop.  For the last two months, she earned an average of $13-14 in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. Her goal for her business is to expand and gain more new business in the future

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales

loans.name: Sumardi

texts.en:
Sumardi lives in West Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Sumardi manages a small shop selling fertilizer and mobile phone airtime credit.  Sumardi is married and lives with two persons in the family home.

Sumardi joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Sumardi sees improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he earned an average of $10/day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
María es una mujer emprendedora, trabaja arduamente para llevar ingresos a su hogar, ella pudo estudiar 6° grado teniendo que dejar el estudio para ayudar a sus padres en los trabajos agrícolas, pero eso no fue un obstáculo para no prepararse para la vida, ha recibido capacitaciones sobre costura y panadería. Está casada y su esposo trabaja en una granja agrícola de la zona. Sus tres hijos están estudiando.

Está trabajando en sastrería desde hace 5 años, aprendió al aprovechar capacitaciones que impartían algunas instituciones en el cantón, ahora también realiza los quehaceres del hogar y cuida a sus hijos, se le facilita todo esto porque en su misma casa tiene el negocio. 

Necesita el dinero para comprar material de construcción: arena, ladrillo, hierro y pago de mano de obra, quiere aprovechar la época seca (verano) para mejorar su vivienda que se encuentra en mal estado, María y su esposo tienen una parte de dinero para la obra, pero les hace falta una cantidad, por ello se han decidido a solicitar el préstamo que poco a poco irán cancelando.

Su sueño es poder tener un taller de costura, con equipo adecuado para el trabajo, que sus hijos se puedan involucrarse el negocio. Teniendo de este el sustento para sus futuras familias.
texts.en:
María is an enterprising woman who works hard to earn an income for the household.  She has a sixth grade education but had to quit school to help her parents with their farming activity.  But that was never an obstacle for her in her preparation for life since she has studied sewing and baking.  She is married and her husband works on a farm in the area.  Her three children attend school.

She has been working for five years as a seamstress.  She took advantage of the training offered at institutions in the canton.  She also does domestic work and takes care of her children since she runs her business from home.

María needs the loan to buy construction material: sand, bricks and iron and to hrie workers to renovate her dilapidated house.  She wants to take advantage of the dry season (summer) to carry out the project.  María and her husband have part of the money for the renovation but they need more, so decided to request a loan that they will pay back little by little.

Her dream is to open a sewing workshop with the proper equipment for the job and have her children get involved in the business.  This would give them an income for their future families.

loans.use: To buy sand, bricks and iron and to hire workers.  She wants to take advantage of the dry season (summer) to renovate her dilapidated house.

loans.name: Daulat

texts.en:
Daulat lives in West Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Daulat manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Daulat is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Daulat joined Ruma three months ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Daulat sees improvements in his shop. For the last three months, he earns an average of $8-9 in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand and gain more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 38-year-old married woman with one son. Her husband is 43 years old. Anita is a housewife, and her husband is a farmer. 

They live in a small town of Maynaguri. They have a small plot of land on which her husband cultivates different crops. Anita has taken the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation so that they can enhance their business and earn more. They dream to give a good and bright future to their child. 

They are thankful to BJS and Kiva for extending the helping hand.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie, 48 years old, is married and has four children. She has been in the pig fattening business in the Philippines for one year. Rosemarie has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Rosemarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario de 33 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, ya está acompañado, mientras él realiza trabajos lejos de su casa, su señora se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y de la educación de sus hijos, de sus tres hijos, dos estudian, el mayor le ayuda en los trabajos que realiza a diario.


Desde hace doce años se ha dedicado a la albañilería, aprendió este oficio gracias a que un amigo le enseño. Ha realizado trabajos, donde ha tenido que viajar grandes distancias, pero reconoce que vale la pena esforzarse trabajando para que nada les falte a los suyos. Trabaja de lunes a sábado y actualmente el lugar de trabajo está a un kilómetro de distancia, le acompaña su hijo mayor, a quien le está transmitiendo el conocimiento en esta actividad.


Utilizará el préstamo para la compra de material de construcción (arena, cemento, hierro, entre otros, con esto quiere ir construyendo poco a poco una vivienda en buenas condiciones, ya que la que tiene es de adobe y sus hijos frecuentemente padecen de enfermedades respiratorias por el polvo del material que está construida (tierra).

Su principal sueño es construir una vivienda digna, donde pueda vivir su familia sin ningún problema de salud o inseguridad, sabe que con trabajo arduo y ahorrando, podrá cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Mario, 33, is a hard-working man who has a common-law wife.  While he is away at work she takes care of the home and educates their three children.  Two of them attend school and the eldest helps his father at work.

For 12 years Mario has worked in bricklaying which he learned from a friend of his.  Some of his jobs have involved traveling great distances but he says it has always been worth it so his family did not have to go without anything.  He works Monday through Saturday and currently works a kilometer away from home.  His eldest son goes to work with him and is learning the trade.

He will use the loan to buy construction materials (sand, cement, iron and other items) to build a solid house little by little.  The one he has now is made of adobe and his children suffer from frequent respiratory illnesses because of the dust and dirt from the building.

His main goal is to build a decent dwelling where his family can live without health or safety problems.  He knows that through hard work and by saving his money he will be able to meet his goal.

loans.use: To buy sand, cement, iron and other materials to build a solid house, little by little.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour and oil for her business.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo es un productor de café de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en su pequeña finca de  7 hectáreas, de las cuales 6 son de café los cuales produce bajo los criterios de certificación Fairtrade. En los últimos años, este productor ha logrado una cosecha de aproximadamente 140 quintales de café pergamino, lo cual para este año ha tomado como un reto, proponiéndose incrementar este rendimiento productivo y alcanzar una cosecha de al menos 200 quintales. Para esto, Gustavo está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita la compra de insumos y fertilizantes, lo cual contribuirá a asegurar la demanda nutricional de su plantación. Esta inversión se sumará al esfuerzo y trabajo que él y su familia vienen realizando en su finca para alcanzar mayores resultados y de esa forma mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a coffee producer from the northern part of Nicaragua.  He lives with his wife and his three children on their small farm.  

Their farm is seven hectares, six of which are planted with coffee and produce less than the Fairtrade criteria for certification.  In recent years, this producer has reached a harvest of about 140 quintals of “in parchment” coffee.  

For this year, he has taken this on as a goal, setting out to increase his productive yield and reach a harvest of at least 200 quintals.  To do this, Gustavo is asking for a loan that will allow him to purchase supplies and fertilizers which will contribute to guaranteeing the nutritional needs of his field.  This investment will join with the effort and hard work that Gustavo and his family give to his farm to achieve greater results, and in this way to improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 6 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 25 juin 2002, il regroupe des membres qui habitent le même village et ceux des alentours. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations et font comme activité le commerce et l'embouche. Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Fatou est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu l'embouche bovine.
Avec le prêt elle compte acheter un bœuf et prendre en charge les dépenses nécessaires pour un bon engraissement.
Les bénéfices lui permettent de soutenir ses enfants dans leurs besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
This group of 6 women belongs to the Banc Villageois created on June 25, 2002. Its members all live in a small cluster of villages. They all get along, and they practice commercial activities and livestock fattening. 

Fatou, age 42, is the group member seen in the photo standing on the right and raising her hand. She is married with children, and she practices cattle fattening. She will use this loan to buy an ox and to cover the necessary costs for proper fattening. 

Her profits will allow her to support her children’s day-to-day needs.

loans.use: to buy an ox.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie, 33 years old, is married and has four children. For the past 5 years, Rosie has been farming bananas in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Rosie is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Blanca Leticia

texts.es:
Blanca, a sus 40 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una mujer pujante y luchadora; al ser esposa y madre de dos hijos, siempre busca alternativas que le permitan velar por el bienestar de su familia. Es por ello que, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la cría, engorde y comercialización de cerdos y pollos, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y surgió de la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. Sus principales clientes son vecinos, familiares y algunos supermercados y tiendas del sector.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar una cerda de cría, con la que podrá aumentar su producción y así mejorar las ventas e ingresos para seguir reinvirtiendo en el negocio y aportar a la economía familiar.
Blanca manifiesta que su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio, acreditarlo y fortalecerlo cada día más para que sea auto sostenible y le garantice una rentabilidad económica con la que pueda seguir educando a sus hijos y luchar para que toda la familia tenga mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Blanca, aged 40, is a strong woman with a fighting spirit. As wife and mother to two children, she is always on the lookout for different ways that will allow her to safeguard the welfare of her family.

It is for this reason that for the last 10 years she has been involved in breeding and fattening pigs and chickens for sale, a trade she learnt on the job and which arose from the need to generate income to support her husband with their household's finances. Her main clients are neighbours, relatives and some local shops and supermarkets.

She is currently requesting this loan in order to purchase a breeding sow, with which she will be able to increase her productivity and thereby improve sales and revenues, which will allow her to continue reinvesting in the business and contributing to the family economy. 

Blanca states that her greatest desire is to expand her business, accredit it and build it up day by day until it is self-sustaining and guarantees an economic return with which she can continue educating her children and striving for better living conditions and well-being for the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase a breeding sow

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en: Rosana, 38 years old, is married and has eight children. With three children currently in school, Rosana works very hard to provide for them. For the past 5 years, Rosana has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as detergent soap, sugar, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store. In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Endang

texts.en:
Endang lives in West Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Endang manages a small workshop and sells mobile phone airtime credit.  Endang is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Endang joined Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Endang sees improvements in her shop.  For the last month, she earns an average of $24 in mobile phone airtime credit sales. She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. Her goal for her business is to expand and gain more new business in the future

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales

loans.name: Mario Isabel

texts.es: Mario Isabel es un pequeño productor de café de la zona Norte de Nicaragua. Vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su finca de 6.3 hectáreas, de las cuales 3.5 son de café. En el último año su producción de café fue de 100 quintales pergamino. Su visión es incrementar los rendimientos productivos de su plantación de café, mediante procesos de renovación y un adecuado mantenimiento. Para este ciclo su meta es enfrentar los problemas de plagas y enfermedades que afectan el café mediante la aplicación de insumos y fertilizantes que requiere su plantación, para lo cual está solicitando un financiamiento. Él está seguro que con la disposición de recursos, su trabajo y el acompañamiento técnico que le brinda la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), podrá alcanzar sus metas, que le permitirán tener mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Mario Isabel is a small coffee producer in the northern part of Nicaragua.  He lives with his wife and three children on a 6.3 acre farm, 3.5 of which are coffee plantations.  Over the last year he produced 100 quintals of dry coffee.  His goal is to increase coffee production through renovation and adequate maintenance.  

For this season, his goal is to control coffee plant disease by applying the necessary supplies and fertilizers.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan which he is sure will help, along with his work and technical support from the Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) association in order to meet his goals.  This will allow him to earn more income for his family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jorge William

texts.es: Jorge, es un joven productor de café en una comunidad de Jinotega, departamento de Nicaragua. Cuenta con una pequeña parcela de café de 0.7 hectárea la cual está certificada por Faitrade, y ha venido estableciendo y mejorando desde hace 4 años, junto a su esposa con quien tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años. Para mantener a su familia, este joven además de cultivar su pequeña parcela, también es conductor de vehículo. Para garantizar las actividades de mantenimiento de su café este ciclo, él está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita asegurar la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que se requieren para asegurar una buena cosecha, la cual proyecta sea de unos 35 quintales de café pergamino. Jorge dice que este rubro es rentable y que la inestabilidad del mercado se puede enfrentar con los precios mínimos que ofrece el mercado Fairtrade, por lo que su objetivo es incrementar su producción y con ellos sus ingresos a fin de ir aumentando el área de su pequeña finca, y con ello mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is a young coffee producer in the community of Jinotega, a department in Nicaragua.  He has a small 0.7 acre coffee plantation which is certified by Fairtrade, which he has been maintaining and improving for four years together with his wife.  They have two children, ages four and two.

In order to support his family, this young man cultivates his small plantation and also drives a vehicle.  To guarantee maintenance of his coffee crop this seson he is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers which are required for a good harvest.  He hopes to produce 35 quintals of dry coffee.  

Jorge says this business is profitable and that the market instability can be offset through minimum prices offered by the Fairtrade market.  So his goal is to increase production and income in order to expand his small farm and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 49-year-old man. He has a lovely family with two daughters and a son, who is to help Ali on his business. His wife is a housewife. Ali’s elder daughter is 20 years old and his younger daughter is 18 years old and goes to tenth class. His family is an IDP (Internally displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city and now live in Kurmahmudlu village of the Fuzuli region. 

Ali is in the animal breeding business. He buys calves, raises them and then sells them at the bazaar to earn money. Today he wants to increase his business and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy little calves. Ali is thankful to the Kiva organization for help.

loans.use: to buy little calves

loans.name: Oscar Benjamin

texts.es:
Oscar, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y crianza de cerdos, tiene 31 años de edad, es casado, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos, todos depende económicamente de él, trabajar en el campo es algo que realiza desde muy joven lo aprendió con su papá, y actualmente es el medio que posee para tener los recursos económicos y así sustentar a su familia.
La solicitud de un crédito es para tener la facilidad de comprar cerdos, los cuales ciara y engordara, para venderlos, con las ganancias pagara sus deudas y contribuirá al cambio de vida familiar.
Sus aspiraciones son tener un negocio más grande que le de mayores ingresos para que su familia cuente con mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
Oscar raises basic grains and pigs. He is 31 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children.  They depend on him financially and he has been working in the fields since he was a boy.  He learned from his father and he earns a living this way.

He is asking for this loan to buy pigs to raise and sell.  He will use the earnings to pay his debts and contribute to the improvement of his family life.

His aspirations are to have a bigger business and better income to clothe, feed and provide health care for his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, coal, fish, meat, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 5 years, Virginia has operated a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell. Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
María de 40 años de edad,  es una persona muy trabajadora ya que le ayuda a su esposo a trabajar vendiendo Hot-Dog. actualmente vive con su esposo y sus seis hijos de los cuales dos ya culminaron el bachillerato, dos estan estudiando y otro que estudia primer grado.

María ya cuenta con 14 años de experiencia en su negocio de hot-dog. El préstamo lo ocupara para mejorar el techo de su casa ya que con ese dinero comprara 100 tejas para repararlo antes de que sea la epoca de invierno y es muy dificil vivir sin un techo digno.
su sueño es sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles estudio, para velos convertidos en unos profecionales.
texts.en:
María, 40, is a very hardworking person who helps her husband at work selling hotdogs. She currently lives with her husband and six children, two of whom completed high school. Two others are in school and one is in the first grade. 

María has 14 years of experience in the hotdog business. The loan will be used to improve the roof of her house. She will buy 100 tiles to repair the roof before the winter season because it is very difficult to live without a decent roof. 

Her dream is to raise her children and give them an education so that they may become professionals.

loans.use: to repair her roof.

loans.name: Bharari

texts.en:
Bharari is 32 years old and has two children. Her husband is 41 years old. Bharari and her husband are illiterate and can sign only their names. Her husband is a cycle van puller and she is a housewife. 

Due to the inconsistent income of her husband, Bharari decided to cultivate green vegetables on her own farmland and sells them in the market. She came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and has taken a loan to buy seeds, seedlings and fertilizers to cultivate green vegetables. She hopes now she can run her family smoothly with the business profit.

She is thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy seeds, seedlings and fertilizers for green vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr: Henriette est une jeune femme mère célibataire de 45 ans. Elle a 3 enfants et gère un magasin de cosmétique dans un marché de la capital depuis 11 ans. Son activité fonctionne a merveille car les demandes de sa clientèle se font grandissante c'est pour cela qu'elle a besoin de votre aide pour pouvoir satisfaire leurs demandes. Ce crédit permettra a Henriette d'augmenter son stock de marchandise et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Henriette, age 45, is a single mother to 3 children. For the past 11 years, she has been running a beauty products shop at a market of the capital. Her business is highly successful as customer demand is steadily increasing. She needs a loan to help her achieve customer satisfaction. This credit will allow Henriette to bolster her stock of beauty products, which will help her to support her family.

loans.use: to bolster her stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Bimala is a housewife from Maynaguri. She lives with her husband and two children. Her children go to school. She looks after her family all day long but her husband is busy in his business.

Now they want to grow their business, so she took a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She took the loan to invest in her husband’s business so that he could purchase more cemented rings for making wells and sell those in the local village market. She hopes this will improve her financial condition and enhance the business. She hopes that she will fulfill all the basic needs of her family with the profit from her business.

Bimala and her husband are very much thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more cemented rings

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Juan Pablo es un pequeño productor de café de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es 24.5 hectáreas, de éstas 2.1 son de café. Tiene 4 hijos todos dedicados a la agricultura. El promedio de su producción de café en los últimos tres años ha sido de 50 quintales pergamino, lo cual se ha propuesto mejorar en un 20%, con un adecuado manejo de sus plantaciones. El está enfocado en mejorar los rendimientos y la calidad de su café. Para esto, Juan Pablo menciona que requiere un financiamiento que le permita adquirir los insumos y fertilizantes que demanda su plantación, y aplicarlos de manera oportuna para hacer frente a uno de los principales problemas que enfrenta el café, que son las plagas y enfermedades. Señala que, además estará trabajando en las labores culturales que demanda este cultivo para lograr resultados positivos.
texts.en: Juan Pablo is a small-scale coffee producer from northern Nicaragua. His farm covers an area of 24.5 hectares, and of these 2.1 are for coffee. He has 4 children, who are all involved in agriculture. His average production over the last three years has been 50 hundredweight of certified coffee, which has meant a 20% improvement through proper management of his plantations. He is focussed on improving the yield and quality of his coffee. In order to achieve this, Juan Pablo states that he needs a loan that will allow him to buy the supplies and fertilisers that his plantation needs, and to apply them in the best way to cope with one of the main problems facing coffee plants: blight and disease. He says that, in addition, he will be working on the cultivation that his crops need to achieve positive results.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilisers for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 21 years old and married.  

Virginia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Virginia has been in pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson works hard to support his family. Wilson is single and has a buy-and-sell root-crops and bananas business in the Philippines.

Wilson requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more root-crops and bananas to resell.

Wilson has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Wilson would like to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more root-crops and bananas to resell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 54 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Emma is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Emma has been in pig fattening for 10 years, and earns additional income from bakery.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 54 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Luisa is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Luisa has been in pig fattening for five years, and earns additional income from general store, fishing, and nipa roofing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.fr: Angeline est une femme de 44 ans fianiée, mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 6 et 12 ans, tous vont encore à l'école. Elle aussi deux personnes à sa charge. Elle exerce une activité d'élévage depuis 3 ans déjà (elle achète les poussins, les élève ensuite revend) elle fonctionne à merveille mais son capital n'est pas élévé alors, elle est obligé à chaque fois d'attendre que le stock acheté pour élever grandisse, qu'elle le vende avant de racheter de nouveaux poussins d'où la rupture de stock quotienne qui cause l'insatisfaction de sa clientèle tout le temps. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter en grande quantité des poussins et aussi la provende ce qui lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante mais aussi de réaliser un plus gros profit. Le benéfice que lui apportera ce crédit l'aidera à agrandir son activité( augmenter le nombre de poussins) et aussi à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille
texts.en:
Angeline is a 44-year-old woman who is engaged to be married, and a mother to four children aged 6 to 12 years old who all go to school. She also has two other dependents.

She has been raising animals for three years; she buys chicks, raises them, and resells them. Her business is doing very well, but she doesn't have much capital so when she buys chicks, she has to wait for them to grow so they can be sold, and only then can she go and buy more chicks. As a result, she often faces a shortage of stock, which leaves her customers dissatisfied.  

She is seeking this loan to buy a large quantity of chicks and some chicken feed, which will not only allow her to satisfy her growing customer base, but also to bolster her profits. The extra earnings that this loan will help bring in will help her to expand her business (increase her stock of chicks) and to provide for her family's day-to-day needs.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of chicks and some chicken feed.

loans.name: Blanca Miriam

texts.es:
Blanca de 48 años de edad, vive con una hija y una nieta de un mes de edad. La Señora Blanca se dedica al trabajo artesanal junto con su hija desde hace 8 años tal oficio lo aprendio de su madre, ya que le enseño a todos el gran valor artesanal para ella es su pan de cada dia, ya que le gusta hacer esculturas religiosas como los tres reyes magos,virgen del carmen entre otros.
con el prestamo se le estara ayudando para que compre materiales como barro y pinturas.
Doña Blanca se sueña con que su pequeña nieta se dedique a la escultura de barro igual que ella.
texts.en:
Blanca, 48, lives with a daughter and one-month-old granddaughter. Blanca earns her living as an artisan along with her daughter. They began this work 8 years ago, learning from Blanca's mother who taught them the value of craftwork. For Blanca, it provides her daily bread. She likes to make religious sculptures such as the Three Wise Men, the Virgin de Carmen, and others.

The loan will help her buy materials such as clay and paints. Blanca dreams that her little granddaughter will someday make clay sculptures like her.

loans.use: to purchase clay and paints to make clay sculptures.

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
Baby is a 27-year-old married rural woman who lives with her husband and daughter in the small village in the Maynaguri region in Jalpaiguri district. They are less educated due to poverty but they send their daughter to school for a proper education. She is now in grade 5.

Due to ignorance and having no capital, they are unable to enhance their business. There is a great demand for cosmetics in Maynaguri so Baby wants to purchase more cosmetics from the wholesale market to increase her cosmetics stock. For that reason, she took a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase cosmetics to enhance her cosmetics business. She hopes that if she increases her stock, she can fulfill the customers' demands. Then it will be possible for her to enhance the business and with the profit, she can do her level best to educate her daughter properly.

Baby is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elisa works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Elisa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Sara Isilma

texts.es:
Saira de 24 años de edad. Madre de una pequeña de 9 meses, esta acompañada. Juntos luchan cada día por salir adelante. Ella junto a sus esposo trabajaran arduamente día a día. Su compañero de vida, se dedica a la albañilería y ella vende tortillas en las afueras de su hogar, desde muy temprano se levanta a preparar lo necesario para su negocio (inicia desde las 7 a.m a 4 p.m).

Saira quiere invertir el efectivo de su crédito en una revisión medica(Ultrasonografia), ella se hace chequeos de salud. Lo cual le genera un gasto extra, así mismo le servirá para comprar los medicamentos que sean recetados.

A futuro ella sueña construir una casa propia que le permita vivir cómodamente junto a sus pequeña y su esposo. Juntos lucharan por salir adelante, prosperar y ser mejor cada día, ademas lucharan por darle un mejor futuro a su pequeña bebe, quien es la motivación de ellos por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sara, 24, is the married mother of a 9-month-old daughter. Together, she and her husband work hard every day to survive. Her husband earns his living as a mason and she sells tortillas outside of her home. She gets up very early to prepare what is necessary for her business which she runs from 7 am to 4 pm.

Sara wants to invest the cash from her loan in a medical examination (ultrasonography) and to have a medical checkup. This examination will generate extra expenses, so she will also use the loan to buy any drugs that are prescribed.

In the future she dreams of building a home that will allow her to live comfortably with her baby and her husband. Together, they work to get ahead, flourish, and be better every day. Plus, she works for a better future for her little baby who motivates her to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for medical exams and procedures.

loans.name: Mukti

texts.en:
Mukti is a 31-year-old housewife who has four members in her family. Mukti completed her education up to grade 7 whereas her husband completed his education up to grade 10. One of their daughters is in grade 7 and one completed her higher secondary education. They have their own house in the small town of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Mukti's husband cultivates different crops on their own small piece of land.  He has been working in the agriculture business for many years. His small income is insufficient to get over the financial hurdles of their family, so she decided to start cultivating garlic on their land. For this reason, she needs some capital, so she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase garlic seeds and fertilizers. 

She hopes the profit that will be generated from their new business will meet the financial needs of their family as well as help her to give her child a better education. She hopes to upgrade their financial condition by selling garlic in the local market. She is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase good quality garlic seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business buying and selling herbal medicines in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of herbal medicines to sell in her business.

Phoebe has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from selling ready-to-wear.

Phoebe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of herbal medicines to sell.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Minu is a 24-year-old married woman and the mother of one daughter. Her husband is 26 years old. Minu is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. Her daughter is studying in school. She decided to farm because she owns farmland and has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that they can cultivate gourds on their land. This will add another variety of vegetables that they can sell in the market to earn more money. She hopes it will help her to earn more profit easily and improve her family’s financial status. She will also be able to give an education to her daughter with the business profit.

Now Minu is happy because she has received unbelievable support from BJS and Kiva and she will remember them forever.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and insecticides

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Wilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rahela

texts.en:
Rahela is a 44-year-old housewife who is illiterate and can only sign her name.  She, along with her husband Tofajjana, is raising four children (three sons and one daughter), who are school going. They live in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own house. Rahela's husband, 50, is a farmer by profession.

Rahela's husband has been associated with the cultivation of vegetables for a long time. He grows different vegetables in different seasons and sells the produce in the local market. Rahela helps her husband to grow more vegetables and to carry the produce to the market.  This is the only source of income for the family. So they need more money to give financial sustenance to their family.

Rahela came to know about BJS and has taken a loan from them to purchase a cow and start a new business supplying milk and making dairy products like paneer, butter and curd, which are in great demand in the present market.  She will sell her products to her neighbors. She hopes to get an increase in the production of milk, which ultimately helps to generate more cash.

She dreams of giving a better education to her children, overcoming the financial crisis, purchasing more cows with the profit generated from her business and purchasing a bus.

She is highly thankful for Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Yenis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yenis, madre de 34 años de edad,una mujer emprendedora que trabaja todos los dias muy arduamente. Yenis estudio hasta 5º grado por sus escasos recursos economicos, ella esta acompañada con una caballero que es pescador, tienen 2 hijos. Los cuales cuidan y aman muchisimo.
Ella se dedica la confección de ropa(faldas, vestidos y blusas) este trabajo lo ejerce desde hace aproximadamente 10 años. Trabajo que le ayudado a sacar a delante a sus hijos. 
Quienes actualmente están estudiando, en momentos libres de su hijo mayor le ayuda a pegar botones, es decir le colabora en su trabajo de sastrería.

Yenis invertirá el efectivo del Crédito en la compra de telas para costura, ademas aprovechara en remodelar su casa, pues quiere que este mas segura y amplia para ella y su familia. 
A futuro desea tener su propio Bazar de ropa,(confeccionado por ella misma).
Ademas de eso desea ver a sus hijos convertidos en unos profesionales trabajando en su bazar.
texts.en:
Yenis, a 34-year-old mother, is an enterprising woman who works very hard everyday. Yenis only studied through the 5th grade because of scare economic resources. She is married to a fisherman and they have 2 children. They care about and love them very much.

She makes clothing (skirts, dresses, and blouses), work that she has done for 10 years. This work has helped her support her children. They are currently in school but her oldest son helps her in his spare time, sewing on buttons and assisting in tailoring her work.

Yenis will invest the cash from the loan in the purchase of fabrics for sewing and to also remodel her house for security and more space for her family. 

In the future she wants her own clothing shop full of clothing she makes. She also wants to see her children become professionals working in her shop.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for making clothing.

loans.name: Kuriya

texts.en:
Meet 48-year-old Kuriya from Waterloo2 in the western rural area of Freetown, Sierra Leone.  She is married with four children.  In 2002, Kuriya established her food business. She began her business because she wanted to be successful and take care of her family's welfare. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and the proper business location.

Kuriya requires a loan in order to purchase bag flour, cooking oil and sugar to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Kuriya plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil and sugar to expand her business.

loans.name: Masaratu

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Masaratu from Waterloo2, western rural in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with three children. In 2010, Masaratu established her retails business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 5:30 p.m., 6 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and proper business location.

Masaratu requires a loan in order to purchase cigarette carton to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Massratu plans to expand her business more than even store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarette carton to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics and clothing, since her business is doing well and she wants to have more products to attract the attention of her customers.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Mariama from Waterloo2, a western, rural area in Freetown. She is married with one child, who is one year old. 

In 2006, Mariama established her pharmacy business. She began her business because she wanted to create income for her daily living. She works at the business eight hours per day and six days per week. She says that at present her business is doing well.

Mariama requires a loan in order to buy more medical drugs for resale.  She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family's welfare and increase her business. In the future, Mariama plans to open a big pharmacy shop. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medical drugs for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase uniform material, zippers, thread and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Greda Group

texts.en:
These members are the group called Greda Traders, and are six in number from Teshie, Accra, Ghana. Each of the members is very hard-working and helps his/her family through his/her work. They sell plastic products, cosmetics, slippers, ladies' and gents' tops, bed sheets, towels, kenkey and fish, wigs, perming cream, shampoo, conditioners and groceries. 

One of the members is Olivia, who is  the group's featured borrower. Olivia sells bed sheets, towels, underwear and shirts. She buys from the main market in Accra at wholesale prices and and sells to customers. She states that she always has a lot of orders, so her business is going well. She is asking for this loan to invest in sheets, towels, underwear and shirts for her business so that she can be more competitive, make more profit and serve her customers better. 

They are all grateful for the opportunity they are receiving to improve their lives through work and training.

loans.use: to buy sheets, towels, underwear and shirts from the main market in Accra at wholesale prices to sell to customers.

loans.name: Soumo 2 Group

texts.en: The Soumo 2 group consists of four ladies whose individual efforts and struggles encouraged them to join ID-Ghana for their sixth loan. They sell cooked beans, fried plantains, banku, smoked fish and cement. Augustina (on the right in the photograph) is the group's representative borrower; she has been selling smoked fish for four years. She is applying for this loan to buy more fish to smoke and sell to customers. This will help her to finalize her business plan and thus improve her income. The group members have received an orientation about loans and micro finance, so they are aware of the work and effort expected from them and required to ultimately be successful and provide a better life for their families. There is continuous training and verification provided that encourage the women to fight to escape poverty. The group needs a total amount of GHS3,400 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more fish to smoke and sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bitter ball, pepper, candy, coal and other items to sell

loans.name: Ana Yeny

texts.es:
Ana esta acompañada, ella no estudio  y el esposo trabaja como motorista de buses y albañilería, aunque también en ocasiones, trabaja en la agricultura, tiene cinco hijos,  tres que no son de sus actual pareja y viven con ellos y los otros dos hijos viven con la  mamá de ella, ellos tres trabajan como empleados informales ella hace trabajos  de lavar ropa, planchar y de oficios domésticos con amigos o vecinos de ella. Por días trabaja en un comedor del pueblo como cocinera, anteriormente ella tenía un negocio en el pueblo, pero por motivos de desalojo se quedó sin el puesto por lo que busco otra manera para seguir adelante.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar una refrigeradora y también para invertir un poco en oras necesidades del negocio, su sueño es seguir trabajando y tener su casa esto son sus sueños, pues desea tener su casa con muebles,  pues solo cuanta con una televisión, una radio y sillas de plástico, además quiere que sus hijos estudien pues su idea es que ellos no pasen por lo que ella está pasando, lo que gana lo invierte en alimentación y el pago del crédito que tiene.
texts.en:
Ana is married, she didn't finish school and her husband works as a bus driver and bricklayer, although occasionally, in farming. She has five children, three of whom are not from their marriage and live with them and the other two children live with Ana's mother. Those three work as informal employees and Ana does chores such as wash clothing, iron, and domestic tasks with friends and neighbors. During the day she works in a restaurant in the town as a cook, previously she had a business in the town but because of an eviction she was left without a position so she looked for another means of income.

The loan will be used to buy a refrigerator and also to invest in some other necessities of her business. Her dream is to continue working and have a house, as she wishes to have a house with furniture and currently only has a television, a radio, and plastic chairs. In addition she wants her children to study in school so that they do not have the life that she currently has. What she earns she invests in food and paying the loan.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and also to invest in other necessities for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, paint and iron rods for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vegetable seeds to expand her garden.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, sausage, ham, cheese, fruit, vegetables, milk, soda, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock such as soap, paper tissue, and milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, onions and vegetable oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials including iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, cement, iron rods, etc. for the construction of a house for his family

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, cement and iron rods for the construction of a dwelling house for his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chicken rotisserie and ingredients at wholesale (chicken, cold cuts, bread, sauces, soda).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets for the construction of a dwelling house for his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, salt, Maggi cubes, etc., for her business

loans.name: José Atilio

texts.es:
José de 62 años de edad, nunca fue  a la escuela siempre ha trabajado desde que era pequeño, ya que su padre falleció aun cuando él era un niño. Es viudo su esposa falleció hace unos cuatro años, tiene dos hijos con ella los cuales ya no viven con él. Él vive solo en su casa, se dedica a la agricultura, también realiza la actividad de carpintería desde hace más de cuarenta años,  su padre le enseño el oficio de la carpintería, trabaja casi todos los días de 6.00 am a 3 pm ya que hay que caminar un poco hacia el trabajo unos cinco kilómetros de ida y de vuelta.

 el crédito lo necesita para comprar madera, ya que esta actividad la realiza periódicamente cuando tiene algún encargo, ya que lo buscan generalmente para la fabricación de llantas de carreta las cuales las hace a un buen precio y de calidad, con el crédito mejorara sus actividades productivas y sus ingresos aumentaran, sus sueños es que sus hijos tengan su propia casa y su terrero, ya que no la tienen actualmente las ganancias del negocio las destinara en seguir trabajando fuertemente para su familia para mejorar su calidad de vida y de sus hijos, los cuales le apoyan grandemente.
texts.en:
José, 62, never went to school. He has always worked, since he was young, since his father passed away when he was still a boy. He is a widower, as his wife passed away about four years ago. He had two children with her, who do not live with him anymore. He lives alone in his house, making a living as a farmer. He has also done carpentry for more than 40 years. His father taught him the carpentry profession. 

He works almost every day from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm, since he has to walk a bit to get to work - about five kilometers there and back. He needs the loan to buy wood, since he periodically does carpentry when he has an order, since people generally seek his services for the making of wagon wheels, which he makes for a good price and of high quality.

With the loan, he will improve his productive activities and his income will increase. His dream is that his children will have their own house and land, since they do not currently have them. He will use the earnings from the business to continue to work hard for his family and improve his quality of life and that of his children, who greatly support him.

loans.use: to buy wood for the making of wagon wheels.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large amount of fish to add to her current stock for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy  a bale or two of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy items such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, Vaseline and creams wholesale and add them to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron corrugated zincs, sand, nails, cement, iron rods, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio es un productor de café de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Tiene 68 años y vive con su esposa y su hijo de 23 años que apoya en las actividades de la finca y además está iniciando sus estudios universitarios. La finca de este pequeño productor es de 13.3 hectáreas de las cuales 4.2 son de café. Está integrado a los procesos de certificación de Fairtrade, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices, lo cual evidencia el cumplimiento aspectos productivos, sociales y ambientales en su finca, que han derivado en el mejoramiento de los rendimientos productivos en los últimos años. Porfirio dice que el café es un rubro rentable, él y su familia viven con los ingresos del café principalmente, y que su mayor desafío es “hacer frente a las plagas y enfermedades que afectan el café”. 
Para garantizar un manejo adecuado de su cafetal en este año, él está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que aseguren las condiciones requeridas para una buena cosecha. Su dedicación y disciplina le permitirán asegurar la implementación de todas las actividades que requiere su cafetal y continuar mejorando sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Porfirio, 68, is a coffee producer in the north of Nicaragua.  He lives with his wife and his son, 23, who helps with the farming tasks and also is beginning his college education.  This small producer's farm has 13.3 hectares, 4.2 of which are coffee.  Porfirio's farm participates in the processes of Fair Trade certification, UTZ certification, and C.A.F.E. Practices.  This proves the social and environmental productivity of his farm, which has improved his efficiency in the last few years.

Porfirio said that coffee's a profitable field.  He and his family live mainly on the income from his coffee.  His biggest challenge is dealing with pests and diseases that affect the coffee.

He's requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs and fertilizer so he can manage the farm well this season and guarantee the conditions he needs for a good harvest.

Porfirio's dedication and discipline will allow him to implement all the tasks his coffee farm needs so he can keep on improving his income and his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house-building materials, including corrugated iron and zinc, sand, nails, cement and iron rods, for the construction of a home for his family

loans.name: Pisila

texts.en: Pisila is a 27-year-old lady, with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as Lavalava shirts, make ups, souvenirs and painted fabric. She has been doing this for three years.  Pisila needs a loan to buy fabric, paintbrushes, a design board and paints. She hopes to use her profits to support her family and kids. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, paintbrushes, a design board and paints.

loans.name: Yehowa Da Group

texts.en: Mercy, who is a married woman in her early 40s, has three children who are in school. Mercy makes her living by selling plastic products, cutlery sets and glasses at her residence. Mercy has been in this business for six years and she operates from 7am to 7pm each working day. She is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Mercy's fifth loan from ID-Ghana, which she will use to buy new plastic containers, cutlery sets and glasses to resell. Mercy dreams that one day she will be able to build a house. She will share this loan with her other loan group member. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new plastic containers, cutlery sets and glasses for resale.

loans.name: Mariela Erlinda

texts.en: Mariela dreams of becoming a linguist. She is currently attending the Universidad Autónoma Juan Misael Saracho, working towards her degree in linguistics. She plans to graduate in September 2014 but without a loan from Vittana, she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. With the $875 loan, Mariela plans to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Tarija. With a degree in linguistics, she expects to earn $13 a day. Mariela's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family of eight, finances have always been tight. As the youngest of five, with three older siblings attending college already, Mariela is unsure how she will be able to finance her graduation on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, cement, iron rods, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en: Lerma is 40 years old, and married with five children, who are currently in school. Lerma works very hard to provide for them. Lerma's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lerma now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.  Lerma has taken a PHP 8,910 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.  She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.  Lerma is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy parts such as sparkplugs, brakes, mirrors and lights at wholesale.

loans.name: Gumercindo Antonio

texts.es:
Gumercindo de 24 años de edad, viene de una familia humilde, con muchas limitantes económicas, entre todos sus hermanos él fue quien se pudo preparar más (4° grado), gracias al esfuerzo de este joven su familia ha podido ir mejorando sus condiciones básicas. Esta acompañado y su señora realiza los oficios del hogar, tienen dos hijas, por las cuales luchan diariamente.


Realiza trabajos de albañilería desde hace 4 años, este oficio lo aprendió gracias a que su hermano le enseño, también trabaja en la agricultura, cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Anteriormente trabajaba en una granja de cerdos, luego fue acompañando como ayudante a su hermano hasta que hizo pequeños trabajos y se fue dando a conocer como albañil y hoy en día tiene mejores ingresos gracias a esta actividad, trabaja de lunes a sábado, de 7:30am hasta las 4:00pm, el lugar de trabajo está a una cuadra de su casa.

El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de dos terneras, aprovechando los residuos que han quedado de los cultivos de la milpa, así podrá engordar el ganado y poder venderlos dentro de un tiempo a mejor precio obteniendo ganancias. Si no tuviera el financiamiento, no podría invertir en este momento.

Su sueño es construir una casa propia, para independizarse, ya que su pequeña familia en este momento vive en la casa de sus padres, y sabe que lo lograra trabajando duro e ir ahorrando poder comprar los materiales; en la mano de obra no gastara ya que él, la construirá.
texts.en:
Gumercindo, 24, comes from a modest family with a lot of economic limitations.  Among his siblings, he was the one who managed to go to school the longest (fourth grade).
