Thanks to this young man's effort his family has improved their basic living conditions.  He's married and his wife's a homemaker.  They have two children for whom they strive every day.

He has worked in construction for four years.  He learned this trade thanks to his brother, who taught him.  He also works in agriculture, growing corn on 7,000 square meters.  Previously he worked on a pig farm.  Later he helped his brother do small construction until he became known as a bricklayer.  Today Gumercindo earns a better income thanks to this job.  He works from 7:30 a.m. until 4 p.m., Monday through Saturday.  His workplace is a block from his house.

Gumercindo's going to use the loan to buy two calves and make the most of what's left over from his corn crop.  He'll fatten and sell the livestock to get the best price and make a profit.  He wouldn't be able to make the investment right now if he didn't have the loan.

His dream is to build his own house and become independent, because his small family currently lives in his parents' house.  He knows he'll achieve this by working hard and saving the money to buy the materials.  He won't have to pay for labor because he's going to build it himself.

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Orlin

texts.es:
Orlin es un productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Vive en su pequeña finca de 6.33 hectáreas junto a su esposa e hijo de 4 años. Su principal actividad económica es el café, del cual ha dependido en los últimos 5 años. El mantenimiento oportuno de sus plantaciones de café y estar integrado al proceso de certificación Fairtrade le ha permitido disminuir los riesgos en este mercado. El rendimiento promedio por hectárea de café en los últimos 3 años de este productor ha sido de 42 quintales pergamino. 

Su meta para el presente ciclo es obtener 55 quintales de café pergamino, siendo su principal reto disminuir la presencia de plagas y enfermedades que afectan al café. Para esto, él solicita un financiamiento que le permita garantizar las aplicaciones de insumos y fertilizantes en tiempo y forma, y así mantener bajo control este riesgo. Confía que su empeño y responsabilidad en su trabajo y con su familia, le ayudará lograr la meta propuesta.
texts.en:
Orlin is a farmer from the north of Nicaragua. He has a small farm measuring 6.33 hectares, on which he lives with his wife and four-year-old son. For the past five years he has relied on coffee growing, which is his main economic activity. Timely maintenance of his coffee plantations and participation in the Fairtrade certification process have allowed him to reduce risks in this market.

Over the past three years, Orlin has achieved an average yield of 4.2 tonnes of parchment coffee per hectare. His goal for the current crop cycle is to produce 5.5 tonnes of parchment coffee, his main challenge being to reduce the presence of blights and diseases that affect the coffee. He is therefore seeking funding to allow him to guarantee the application of inputs and fertilisers on time, and thus keep this risk under control.

He is confident that his determination and responsibility in his work and towards his family will help him to achieve his stated goal.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilisers

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 47-year-old married woman, with five children; one child is currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Rosita's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store, and is committed to regain what she lost.  Rosita is taking out a PHP 9,750 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Rosita has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Rosita would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild a house for her family.

loans.name: Javier Edgardo

texts.es:
Javier de 29 años de edad, logro cursar educación media, luego tuvo que dejar por un lado los estudios, para dedicarse a trabajar solamente, ya que no tenía los recursos económicos para ir a la universidad, se acompañó y formo una familia, su señora también es comerciante, vende ropa. Juntos generan los ingresos necesarios para cubrir con los gastos del día, día.

En este momento tiene venta de sorbetes, al no poder seguir estudiando, surgió la posibilidad de poner este negocio, lo tiene desde hace 5 años, anteriormente trabajaba elaborando pan. Vende helados de lunes a domingo, sale por las calles del pueblo y también a cantones, además vende en su casa.


El crédito lo utilizara para reactivar la panadería que tenía anteriormente su padre, pero que por problemas la habían descuidado. Comprará latas, reparara el horno, materia prima para la elaboración de pan. Javier ve una gran oportunidad en este negocio y quiere invertir en él.

Sueña con tener una fuerte panadería, poder generar empleo a personas que lo necesiten, establecerse y diferenciarse por la calidad de sus productos, hacer un gran negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Javier is 29 years old. He completed high school. Later he had to leave his studies behind to solely work for a living as he didn't have the economic resources to go to college. He got married and started a family. His wife also is a merchant. She sells clothes. Together they generate the necessary income to cover the daily expenses.

Today he is in ice cream sales, since he wasn't able to continue his studies. He came up with the idea of starting this business. He has had it for 5 years. Previously he worked making bread. He sells ice cream from Monday to Sunday. He going out to the streets of his town and also to cantons and he also sells out of his home.

He will use the loan to restart the bread business his father previously had, but due to problems had been neglected. He will buy cans, oven repair, and raw materials for the making of bread. Javier sees a great opportunity in this business and wants to invest in it.

He dreams of having a strong bread shop to be able to create employment to people that need it, establish himself and differentiate himself by the quality of his products and having a great family business.

loans.use: to buy cans, over repair, and raw materials to make bread.

loans.name: Taneice

texts.en:
Taneice is the owner of Heaven Your Way, a full service salon and spa dedicated to helping those with cancer or who need special treatment. The salon and spa is located in Old Bridge, near two of the most renowned cancer centers in New Jersey. 

According to Taneice, the hair replacement industry earns more than $1 billion/year in the United States alone. Millions of women suffer from some form of alopecia or sudden hair loss every day.  

Having experienced her own traumatic hair loss several years ago, Taneice wanted to do something to help women and educate them about the latest techniques to help combat their hair loss. 

The salon and spa offers unique services such as custom wigs, head shavings, mastectomy fittings, and lymphatic drainage, as well as massages, facials, wraps, pedicures, nails, and waxing. It also offers retail products that are all natural, organic, paraben and carcinogen free. 

This loan will be used for expenses associated with a start-up salon and spa including rent, insurance, fees, licensing, inventory, equipment, build-out costs, advertising, products and supplies, signage, software, utilities and wages. In addition, Heaven Your Way hopes to create 14 jobs upon opening.

loans.use: To pay for inventory, working capital, and other start-up expenses for her specialized salon

loans.name: Ronal Wilver

texts.en:
Becoming a mechanic is Ronal's dream. To achieve his goal, Ronal has enrolled in Escuela de Mecanica Automotriz Simon Bolivar. He expects to graduate in April 2014 but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. Ronal shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With a loan, Ronal plans to pay his graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Tarija. With a degree in mechanics, he expects to earn $17 a day. 

Unfortunately, Ronal's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. As the youngest of eight, with one older sibling attending college already, Ronal is unsure how he will be able to finance his graduation on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra wants to work in the hospitality industry. She is currently attending Infocal El Alto, working towards her degree and expects to graduate in December 2015 but without a loan, she is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Sandra shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible.

With the Vittana loan, Sandra plans to pay for her tuition. With a career in hospitality, she expects to earn $6 a day, a substantial increase from before.

Sandra's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family of eight, finances have always been tight. With one older sibling attending college already, Sandra is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 31 years old and is married with five children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbage, taro, yams, bananas, and other items that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Fatima needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, shovel, spade, fertilizer and gloves.

She joined SPBD in 2014. Fatima will use the profits from her sales to improve her family's living conditions and also keep her kids in school.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, shovel, spade, fertilizer and gloves

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 45 years old, married, and has six children; two children are currently in school.  Cresencia and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.  Cresencia is taking out a housing loan in the amount of PHP 9,312  to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  Cresencia has been an NWTF borrower since 2000. 

With your help, Cresencia can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

loans.name: Yessenia Mabel

texts.es:
Yessenia de 28 años de edad,  no estudio, pero ha aprendido con el programa de alfabetización, es acompañada, el esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tienen una hija que va a parvularia, y la familia, son solo ellos tres.

Ella solo se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero en ocasiones trabaja en viveros, cree que lo hace porque en la zona no hay otra opción de trabajo.

El crédito lo utilizara para cancelar parte del dinero que saco anteriormente en credicampo.

Ella no tiene planes de negocio, solo desea que a futuro su esposo encuentre un mejor empleo, que también su hija, siga estudiando para que sea profesional. El dinero que obtiene la familia lo invierten en gastos de alimentación, estudio de su hija y en todo lo necesario para la familia.
texts.en:
Yessenia, 28, did not study but has learned with the literacy program. She is married, her husband works in agriculture and they have a daughter that goes to nursery school.

She takes care of the home but on occasion she works in nurseries, which she does because in the area there is no other option of work.

The loan will be used to repay part of the money she took out earlier from CrediCampo. She does not have business plans, she only hopes that soon her husband can find a better job and that her daughter continues to study so that she can be a professional. 

The money that she receives will be invested in family food costs, her daughter’s study and in everything else necessary for the family.

loans.use: to repay part of the money that she took out earlier from CrediCampo.

loans.name: David Yasmani

texts.en:
David dreams of becoming a musician but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. To achieve his goal, David has enrolled in Escuela Superior De Fomacion De Maestros Simon Bolivar. He plans to graduate in December 2015 but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

With his Vittana loan, David plans to buy his school books. Until now, he has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, he feels he will be able to get better grades. With a career in music, he expects to earn $10 a day.

David's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For his family of four, finances have always been tight. With two older siblings attending college already, David is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. David currently works as a painter to help afford his school and living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies

loans.name: Madelyn Wendy

texts.en:
Madelyn dreams of becoming an architect but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. Madelyn is currently attending the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, working towards her degree. She expects to graduate in November 2015 but without a loan, is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Madelyn shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With this loan, Madelyn plans to buy her school books. Until now. she has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, she feels she will be able to get better grades. With a degree in architecture, she expects to earn $73 a day. With one younger brother, Madelyn hopes to be a role model for her younger sibling by being the first in her family to graduate from the university.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies

loans.name: Sohara

texts.en:
Sohara is a 45-year-old married woman with one child. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as lavalava, design T-shirts, puletasi (Samoan formal wear), and design dresses. 

She has been doing this for three years. Sohara needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, design board, fabric materials, threads, needles, and paint brushes. She hopes to use her profits to support her family and kids. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, design board, fabric material, threads, needles, and paint brush.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is a 24-year-old married woman with one child. She runs a small business selling snacks and pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. Rosa has requested a loan to buy snacks, soft drinks, flour, cooking oil, baking soda, and sugar. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Rosa will help her family with their needs.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, flour, cooking oil, baking soda, and sugar

loans.name: Ever Americo

texts.en:
Ever is currently attending the Instituto Tecnico Ayacucho, working towards his degree in electrical engineering. He plans to graduate in December 2015 but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

With this loan, Ever plans to purchase his much-needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Ever feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. With a career in electrical engineering, he expects to earn $25 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

Unfortunately, Ever's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. With two other siblings, Ever is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: José Joel

texts.es:
Joel es un joven de 26 años de edad, que se dedica al comercio de carne y destaso, su nivel de estudios es de quinto grado, ya que no pudo continuar con sus estudios por dedicarse a cuidar a sus padres y además sus padres no podían apoyarlo económicamente; por tal razón se ha dedicado ha trabajar fuertemente por su familia, además de esa actividad tiene un puesto de vender tortillas, las cuales las elabora su prima que trabaja con él, el negocio tiene más de 3 años de dedicarse al negocio, esto lo aprendió gracias a sus padres que le enseñaron dicha actividad económica, el negocio lo desarrolla a unos 2 kilómetros de su casa; por lo que tiene que desplazarse todos los días de su casa.

 Con respecto al financiamiento lo necesita para comprar más animales para destazarlos y vender la carne, ya que necesita el apoyo crediticio, ya que obtendrá mayores ingresos de su negocio y su calidad de vida mejorara  de él y su familia a futuro planea construir una nueva casa, ya que la que tienen esta muy deteriorada y es de bahareque y no está en muy buenas condiciones algunas de sus paredes están rajadas en muy mal estado, con las ganancias que genere el negocio continuara ayudando a sus padres, ya que ellos están bastante mayores y necesitan de su ayuda ellos dependen directamente de él y su negocio.
texts.en:
Joel is a young man of 26, who makes a living selling and butchering meat. His level of studies is fifth grade, since he could not continue with his studies because he had to take care of his parents, and his parents could not support him financially. For that reason, he has dedicated himself to working hard for his family. 

Along with butchering, he also has a stand where he sells tortillas, which his cousin who works with him makes. He has been working at the business for over three years, and learned how to do his work thanks to his parents, who taught him this economic activity. He developed the business about two kilometers from his house, which is why he has to travel there every day from his house.

He needs the loan to buy more animals for butchering so he can sell their meat, since he needs financial support to obtain a better income from his business and improve his and his family´s quality of life in the future. He plans to build a new house, since the one they have is very deteriorated, is a bahareque (wattle and daub) house, and is not in very good condition. Some of its walls are cracked and in a very bad state. With the earnings that his business generates, he will continue helping his parents, since they are quite old and they need his help. They depend directly on him and his business.

loans.use: to buy more animals for butchering so he can sell their meat

loans.name: Lola Marcela

texts.en:
Lola dreams of becoming a doctor. She is currently attending the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, working towards her degree in medicine. She expects to graduate in December 2016 but without a loan, is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Lola shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With her Vittana loan, Lola plans to purchase her much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Lola feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. With a career in medicine, she expects to earn $34 a day, a substantial increase from before. As the youngest of four, with one older sibling attending college already, Lola is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for school books

loans.name: Diego Armando

texts.en: Diego has always dreamed of becoming a lawyer. To achieve his goal, Diego has enrolled in the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier. He plans to graduate in September 2014 but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. With a Vittana loan, Diego plans to spend the money to purchase his textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Diego hopes to be able to better understand his subjects. With a degree in law, he expects to earn $13 a day. As the youngest, with one older sibling attending college already, Diego is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for school books

loans.name: Bruna Isabel

texts.es:
Bruna tiene 28 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora que solo pudo estudiar hasta bachillerato, está acompañada y solo tiene un hijo el cual se encuentra estudiando educación básica. 

Bruna tiene 8 años de dedicarse al comercio, ella decidió abrir un negocio de venta de carne, ya que cuenta con un puesto en el mercado municipal y le va muy bien en sus ventas porque los clientes la prefieren por la calidad de carnes que vende.

Con el préstamo que ella está solicitando a CrediCampo, se le estará ayudando a Bruna para que pueda compra distintos tipos de carnes como la de res, de cerdo, y de gallina, y de esta forma no se verá estancada en su negocio, pues podrá ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y por ende mejorarán sus ingresos económicos.

Ella sueña con tener un negocio muy fuerte, capaz de cubrir la demanda de los consumidores de carnes y sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda de los créditos que la institución le brinda.
texts.en:
Bruna is 28 years old. This hardworking young woman only has a high school education. She is in a relationship and only has one child who is studying for his basic education.

Bruna has worked in the retail trade for eight years. She decided to open a meat business at a stall in the municipal market. Bruna is doing very well in her sales because her customers prefer the quality of the meat she sells.

With this loan she is requesting from CrediCampo, Bruna will be able to buy different types of meats such as beef, pork, and chicken. This will prevent her business from becoming stagnant since she will be able to offer a variety of meats to her customers and improve her earnings.

Bruna dreams of having a very strong business and being able to meet the demand of meat consumers. She knows that she can achieve these goals with the help of the loans provided by CrediCampo.

loans.use: to buy different types of meat such as beef, pork, and chicken.

loans.name: Daniel Reynaldo

texts.en:
Daniel dreams of becoming an information technologist. To achieve his goal, Daniel has enrolled in the Universidad Mayor de San Andrés. He plans to graduate in July 2014 but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

With a Vittana loan, Daniel plans to pay his graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in El Alto. With a career in information technology, he expects to earn $17 a day. With three younger brothers and three younger sisters, Daniel hopes to be a role model for his younger siblings by being the first in his family to graduate from the university.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Maria Noelia

texts.en:
Maria has always dreamt of becoming a psychologist. To achieve her goal, Maria has enrolled in the Universidad Juan Misael Saracho. She plans on graduating in December, 2014 but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. With a Vittana loan, Maria plans on purchasing her much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Maria feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. With a degree in psychology she expects to earn $25 a day. 

With one older sibling attending college already, Maria is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. To help afford her school and living expenses, Maria currently works as a secretary.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Oloitiefu

texts.en: Oloitiefu is a 56-year-old single woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Oloitiefu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a spade, a hose, a wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, weed spray, a pair of gloves, and a bush knife.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Oloitiefu hopes to improve her business to help her family and assist with her kids' educations.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a spade, a hose, a wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, weed spray, a pair of gloves, and a bush knife

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 23-year-old woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, and peanuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years.Esther has requested a loan to buy a wheel barrow, spades, gloves, a bush knife, fertilizer, and a rake. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Esther hopes to provide good support to her family and kids.

loans.use: to buy a wheel barrow, spades, gloves, a bush knife, fertilizer, and a rake.

loans.name: Kato

texts.en: Kato is a 35-year-old married woman with two children. She makes and sells ice cake in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Kato needs a loan to buy sugar, plastic bags, cordial flavor, and a cooler. She plans to use her profits to buy more ingredients to improve her business and help her family. Kato has been a member of SPBD since 2013

loans.use: to buy sugar, plastic bags, cordial flavor, and a cooler

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make adjustments to her premises (paint the walls and fix the bathrooms) and pay off her current credit balance

loans.name: Taufono

texts.en:
Taufono is a 69-year-old widowed woman with eight children. She runs a business selling food and local goods in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Taufono has requested a loan to buy snacks, soft drinks, rice, sugar, salts, onions, flour, and noodles. She plans to use her profits to save for family needs. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, rice, sugar, salts, onions, flour, and noodles.

loans.name: Levale

texts.en: Levale is a 32-year-old married woman, with four children. She would like to expand her small business; a lawn-mowing service in her community. In order to do this, Levale needs a loan to buy a new lawnmower and gasoline. She hopes to use her profits to save for family needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a new lawnmower and gasoline.

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Miriam de 24 años, estudio solamente noveno grado, ya que se ha dedicado a trabajar por su familia es acompañada tiene solo una hija, la cual tiene dos años. Su familia está conformada por tres los cuales dependen de ella.

 Miriam se dedica al comercio de productos comestibles, como lo es la venta de pan, también tiene otra actividad lo que es la agricultura siembre de granos básicos, tiene más de cinco años de dedicarse a estas actividades tiene experiencia en el negocio, su negocio que queda muy cerca, ya que la actividad la desarrolla en su casa a la orilla de la carretera.

 El crédito lo utilizara para reforzar su negocio de venta de pan y así continuar trabajando fuertemente para su familia, ya que obteniendo mejores ingresos mejorara su calidad de vida y de su familia por lo que se rebusca día con día para mantener a su familia, entre sus sueños , esta construir una casa, ya que en la que vive solo tiene un par de paredes un techo de lámina y algunas carpetas que le sirven de protección contra la lluvia, sueña con construir la casa para heredársela a su hija, ya que es muy importante para ella, además de su madre la cual la apoya fuertemente en las actividades que realiza día a día, también trabajar duro para que su hija tenga una buena educación.
texts.en:
Miriam is 24 years old. She only studied through the 9th grade, as she had to work for her family. She is in a relationship and only has one daughter, who is 2 years old. Her family is made up of 3 members that depend on her.

Miriam is in the sale of consumables for a living like bread. She also has another job which is agriculture. She grows basic grains. She has more than 5 years in these jobs. She has experience in business. Her business is quite handy since she does the work in her house at the edge of the road.

She will use the loan to strengthen her bread selling business and continue working hard for her family to obtain better income to improve her quality of life and that of her family for whom she struggles daily. Among her dreams is constructing a house as the one she lives in has a pair of walls, laminate roof, and some carpet that serve as protection against the rain. She dreams of constructing a house to leave to her daughter which is very important for her as well as her mother who supports her in her daily activities. She also wants to work hard to give her daughter a good education.

loans.use: to strengthen her bread selling business.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan wants to become an accountant. To achieve his goal, Ivan has enrolled in the Universidad Autónoma Juan Misael Saracho. He expects to graduate in December, 2014 but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. Ivan shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With a Vittana loan, Ivan plans on spending the money towards purchasing his textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Ivan hopes to be able to better understand his subjects. With a degree in public accounting and finance he expects to earn $20 a day. 

With two older siblings attending college already, Ivan is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Ivan's father's salary from his job in construction is the family's primary source of income. To help afford his school and living expenses, Ivan currently works as a mason.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora dreams of becoming an accountant. To achieve her goal, Flora has enrolled in the Instituto Tecnologico Caranavi. She plans on graduating in December, 2016 but without a loan from Vittana she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. With a Vittana loan, Flora plans on using the funds to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Caranavi. Unfortunately, 

Flora's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. With one older sibling attending college already, Flora is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. To help afford her school and living expenses, Flora currently works as a secretary.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Josefina Maribel

texts.es: Josefina, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija y vive en el sector de San Manuel, Cortes junto a su familia. Hace 3 años que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz. Esta actividad la realiza desde su casa. ha solicitado un préstamo por 12,000 lempiras para comprar una maquina de hacer tortillas, maíz y compra de laminas y madera para construir una pequeña galera para poner su negocio de tortillas. Con esta inversión va mejorar las ventas y sus ingresos. Su plan es ayudar a su hija, mejorar el negocio y lograr vender ropa para aumentar los ingresos.
texts.en:
Josefina is 37 years old and a single mother with a daughter. She lives with her family in the sector of San Manuel, Cortes.

For the past three years, Josefina has been preparing and selling corn tortillas. She operates this business from her house. Josefina is requesting a loan of 12,000 HNL so that she can buy corn and a machine for making tortillas. She will also buy construction sheets and wood in order to build a small galley kitchen for her tortilla business. With this investment, she will be able to improve her sales and her earnings.

Her plans include helping her daughter, improving her business, and selling clothes so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy corn, a machine for making tortillas, and construction materials for building a small galley kitchen.

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en:
Rasela is a 30-year-old woman with three children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as lavalava (A traditional Polynesian cloth worn as a skirt by men and women), design dresses, and design T-Shirts. She has been doing this for three years.

Rasela needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, paint brush, design board, and paints. She hopes to use her profits to support her family and kids. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, paint brush, design board, and paints.

loans.name: Seepalatafale

texts.en:
Seepalatafale is 26 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling BBQ'd food in her community and has been doing this for 4 years.  

Seepalatafale has requested a loan to buy a new BBQ grill, meat, sauce, onion, salts and rice. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Seepa will look at improving her business and will also help her family and kids.

loans.use: to buy a new BBQ grill, meat, sauce, onion, salts and rice.

loans.name: Vineta

texts.en:
Vineta is a 28 year old married woman with 2 children.  She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, green onions, tomatoes, green peppers, carrots to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 1 year.

Vineta has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, chemicals, hose, a wheel barrow and gloves.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.  With her profits,Vineta hopes to earn more profits to help her business and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, chemicals, hose, a wheel barrow and gloves.

loans.name: Luis Javier

texts.es:
Luis, a sus 29 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, tiene una charcutería y licorera que inició en el año 2012, trabaja todos los días de 9 am a 10 pm, el oficio lo aprendió de un hermano que se dedica a la misma labor, cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado que le colabora durante algunos días en los que él cumple con otros compromisos.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de surtido (mecato, cervezas, gaseosas y licor), esto le permitirá tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer y satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes, mejorando así las ventas e ingresos.
Luis con su espíritu de superación y su tenacidad, desea poder cumplir el sueño de dedicarse de lleno a su negocio y ser totalmente independiente, así mejorará su calidad de vida y además tendrá la oportunidad de generar oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Luis is 29 years old and works as an independent merchant. He has a delicatessen and liquor store that he started in 2012. He works from 9 AM to 10 PM. He learned this business from a brother who has the same kind of business. He counts on the support of an employee who works with him on some days while he completes other tasks.

The loan will be used to buy stock for the business (snacks, beer, soda pop, and liquor), which will permit him to have a greater variety of products to offer and satisfy his customers, thus improving his sales and income.

With his spirit to succeed and his tenacity, Luis wishes to be able to complete his dream of working full time on his business and being totally independent, and in this way improve his quality of life and in addition he will have the opportunity to generate employment opportunities for others.

loans.use: to buy stock for the business (snacks, beer, soda pop, and liquor).

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 43 years old, and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them. Lucia's business was devastated by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013.  Lucia is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her business. Lucia is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell, such as shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, sugar, coffee, etc. 

Lucia is committed to rebuild her business, and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 42 years old, and married with six children; five children are currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Riza's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Riza needs materials to provide her family with safe shelter.  She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Rizais is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future, would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 38 years old and single.  Jasmin survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Jasmin is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,960 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  Jasmin has been an NWTF borrower since 2013.

With your help, Jasmin can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan.  In future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben lives in Kitale, which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya and, at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting Blue Gum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Ben is single and has four children. He is a teacher as well as a farmer. He has been farming for twenty years now and he is currently growing maize and rearing livestock in his farm. Ben is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey, earn him some income and the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Ben’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children. Ben’s hope for the future is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Vincent is married and has seven children. He runs a small business of buying and selling cattle. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for thirty years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, bananas and millet. Vincent is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey.

This is Vincent’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to improve the living standards of his family. Vincent’s hope for the future is to be a veteran in beekeeping.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre casado de 42 años de edad, actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus cinco hijos  en el Departamento de Sololá. 
Actualmente cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada a unos metros de su vivienda. Eligió esta actividad porque es rentable y productiva, ya que a través de lo que realiza puede contribuir a la economía de su familia. Como también comenta que se dedica a la  albañilería. Ambas tareas le han ayudado a salir adelante junto a su familia.
Ahora cuenta con varios años de tener su negocio que le ha generado buenos ingresos y ganancias. Por lo que ahora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para la  compra de productos de consumo diario, para poder ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así incrementar sus ganancias.
Uno de los sueños de don Julio es construirles una casa a sus hijos, para que en futuro tengan un lugar donde vivir.
texts.en:
Julio is a 42-year-old married man. He currently lives with his wife and five children in the Department of Sololá.

Julio currently has a grocery store that is located a few meters from his home. He chose this business because it is profitable and productive. It also allows him to contribute to his family’s finances. In addition, Julio works as a bricklayer. Both jobs enable him to help his family get ahead.

Now that he has had his grocery business for several years, Julio is generating good income and earnings. At the moment, he has decided to request a loan of 10,000 GTQ in order to buy everyday consumer products. This will allow him to offer better service to his customers and increase his revenue.

One of Don Julio’s dreams is to build a house for his children so that they will have a place in the future where they can live.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in his store.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio tiene 46 años de edad, nunca fue a la escuela, actualmente es felizmente acompañado, la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, se dedica al trabajo de campo en la agricultura, siembra maíz, frijol, maicillo, tiene siete hijos de los cuales cuatro son hombres y tres son mujeres y de los cuales seis viven con él  y una hija vive en hogar aparte, los demás están estudiando. Se desplaza una hora de camino para llegar al lugar de trabajo, este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres, desde pequeño, goza de buena reputación en la comunidad, persona trabajadora.
El préstamo que esta solicitando es para instalar una venta de verduras en la comunidad, ya que tiene experiencia porque en  años anteriores ya ha tenido este tipo de negocio y hoy quiere retomarlo, y manifiesta que el préstamo le ayudara mucho, le dará fuerza para seguir adelante y obtener buenas ganancias.
Él tiene muchos planes a futuro, que sus hijos siguen estudiando y apoyarles en su proceso de formación, y que en un futuro sean buenos profesionales y serviciales al desarrollo de la comunidad, y dinero de la ganancia dice que lo invertirá en el negocio para ir creciendo poco a poco en el negocio.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 46 years old. He never went to school. Currently he is happily in a relationship. His wife dedicates herself to domestic work. He makes a living by working in the fields, in agriculture. He plants corn, beans and sorghum. He has seven children, four of whom are men and three of whom are women. Six of them live with him and one daughter lives in a separate house. The rest are studying. It takes him one hour to walk to his place of work. He learned this work from his parents from the time he was young. He enjoys a good reputation in the community as a hardworking person.

The loan he is asking for is to start a business selling vegetables in the community. He has experience in this work because he already had this kind of business in the past. Currently he wants to start this business again. He states that the loan will help him a lot; it will give him strength to keep moving ahead and to obtain good earnings.

He has a lot of plans for the future. He wants his children to keep studying and to support them in the process of their training, so that in the future they will be good professionals and helpful in the development of the community. He says that he will invest the money from his earnings in the business so that it will keep growing bit by bit.

loans.use: to start a business selling vegetables in the community

loans.name: Suitupe

texts.en:
Suitupe is a 25-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation, and grows cabbages, green onions, tomatoes, green peppers, and carrots to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. 

Suitupe has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, chemicals, a hose, a wheelbarrow, and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. With her profits, Suitupe hopes to earn more profits to help her business and kids education.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, chemicals, a hose, a wheelbarrow, and gloves.

loans.name: Pasia

texts.en:
Pasia is a 40-year-old lady with one child. She would like to start growing taro and bananas to earn a living. Pasia has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, shovel, wheelbarrow, spade, hose, rake, and bush-knife.

She joined SPBD in 2013. Pasia will spend her profits to enlarge her business and on her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, shovel, wheel barrow, spade, hose, rake, and bush-knife.

loans.name: Emeleen

texts.en:
Emeleen is 28 years old and has two children.  Emeleen is married and has one child who is still in school.

Emeleen and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out.  Emeleen is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,075 to purchase building material and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Emeleen has been an NWTF borrower since 2013.  With your help, Emeleencan will rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan.  In future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building material and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Leonesa

texts.en:
Leonesa is 48 years old and has three children.  Leonesa is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Leonesa and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Leonesa is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 9,925 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Leonesa has been an NWTF borrower since 2011.  With your help, Leonesa can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan.  In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Exuperta

texts.en:
Exuperta is 43 years old and married with three children. 

Exuperta and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business was wiped out. 

Exuperta is taking out a bridge loan to restart her agricultural business, farming vegetables and rice.  Exuperta requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Exuperta has been farming vegetables and rice for 1 year now and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

With your help, Exuperta is committed to rebuilding her business.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family.  On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 4,750 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Alicia will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.  In the future, Alicia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Louie

texts.en:
Louie is 34 years old and married with eight children.  With six children currently in school, Louie works very hard to provide for them.

Louie's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013.  Louie has started rebuilding her house and now needs materials to provide her family with a safe shelter.

Louie has taken a PHP 8,400 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.  She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.  Louie is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and has a live-in partner with two children.  With two children currently in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013.  Vilma has starting rebuilding her house and now needs materials to provide her family with a safe shelter.

Vilma has taken a PHP 9,400 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.  She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Vilmais is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building material and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Kyakaigo Abagambakamu Women Group

texts.en:
Gorreti, aged 53, lives in Fort Portal,Uganda and has been in the farming business since 1988 mainly growing bananas alongside piggery to supplement her income. She went into farming to produce food for her family as well as to earn income through food sales. Despite this long journey she continues to face a challenge of price fluctuations and seasonality changes of agricultural products. Her dream is to educate her children to university.

Gorreti needs this loan to pay school fees for her child. She is a member of Kyakaigo Abagambakamu Women's Group where members guarantee one another to get a loan,

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Iraides

texts.es:
Iraides es una mujer luchadora y dinámica, casada y madre de un hijo al que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
A sus 56 años de edad, se gana la vida trabajando como comerciante independiente, pues tiene un negocio de comidas rápidas, labora desde la comodidad de su vivienda y los productos que vende son por encargos, adicionalmente vende productos lácteos y otros artículos de la canasta familiar, así genera los ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de insumos y surtido al por mayor (carne, verduras, lácteos y otros), esto le permitirá ofrecer más variedad de productos para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes y así mejorar los ingresos.
Iraides manifiesta que sueña con tener su propio local para montar su negocio de comidas rápidas y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, así tendrá mayor rentabilidad con lo que podrá brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Iraides is a dynamic woman and a fighter. She is married and the mother of one son who she has gotten ahead with much effort and dedication. At 56 years of age, she makes a living working as an independent saleswoman in her fast food business. 

She works from the comfort of her home and the products she sells are done by orders. She also sells dairy products and other household goods. In this way, she generates enough income to support her husband by helping pay for the home expenses.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of wholesale supplies and stock (meat, vegetables, dairy products and more), which will allow her to offer a greater variety of products to satisfy the needs and tastes of her customers and improve her income. 

Iraides states that she dreams of having her own space in order to set up her fast food store and offer her customers better service, which would allow her to have better profitability, through which she could provide her family with a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies and stock (meat, vegetables, dairy products and more)

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is 43 years old and has a live-in partner.  Evelina works very hard to provide for them.

Evelina's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013.  Evelina is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Evelina has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.  She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell such as shampoo, toothpaste, detergent soap, sugar and other groceries.  Evelina is committed to rebuilding and in the future would like to save enough money to expand business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, toothpaste, detergent soap, sugar and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with five children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Marissa is 43 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Marissa has a general store business in the Philippines.  It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013.  Marissa requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store to restart her business activities.

Marissa would like to start her business again and would like to rebuild it with your help.  Marissa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: John Patrick

texts.en:
John Patrick is 57 years old, married with four children and living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He owns a bar and also buys and sells a local brew commonly known as waragi to his customers.  He ventured into business to earn a living and get income to construct commercial buildings.

However,he is challenged by inadequate capital to accomplish his plan.  His vision is to educate his children.  John Patrick intends to use the loan to buy beers, sodas and local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas and local brew to sell.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris works hard to support her family.  Maricris is married and has a raising pigs business in the Philippines.  It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business Maricris requested a PHP 10,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Maricris has been in this business for 2 years now.  With your help Maricris will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Maricris would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Yowasi

texts.en: Yowasi used the previous loan to buy lumber to make furniture.  As a carpenter, he also deals in the buying and selling of maize to his customers.  He has been in this business for eight years, a business he started to raise income to support his family.  He maintains his dream of building a permanent home though he is limited because of inadequate capital.  Yowasi needs the loan to add to his stock of lumber to make furniture for selling.

loans.use: to add stocks of lumber to make furniture for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to build a pigsty with bars, and more piglets

loans.name: Hilario De Jesús

texts.es:
Hilario es un hombre humilde, pujante y trabajador, a sus 47 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos a los que les ha brindado educación y sustento, ganándose la vida mientras se desempeña como comerciante independiente; su vida productiva comenzó cuando trabajaba en una empresa de gas propano muy reconocida en el departamento antioqueño, pero, luego de varios años se le presentó la oportunidad de independizarse y fue entonces cuando alquiló un local y compró pipetas con gas propano para distribuirlo entre los vecinos, amigos y los negocios de comidas de la región, su actividad comenzó a dar resultados y ha logrado generar los ingresos suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares durante los últimos 13 años que lleva funcionando su negocio.
El crédito que solicita lo utilizará para comprar más pipetas con gas, así tendrá la disponibilidad requerida para satisfacer la demanda actual, ya que existen unas zonas donde aún no se puede instalar la red de gas natural, siendo los restaurantes y negocios de comidas los que conforman su principal clientela.
Hilario manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener un carro para transportar el producto, pues hoy en día realiza los domicilios en una moto y esto aumenta los gastos, pues debe realizar más desplazamientos. Así podrá mejorar las utilidades que percibe por su labor y estará en la capacidad de dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hilario, 47, is a modest, thriving, and hardworking man.  He's married and has two children, whom he has supported and educated.

Hilario earns a living as an independent merchant.  His working life began when he was working in a very well-known propane gas company in the department of Antioquia.  After several years, however, he had the opportunity to work on his own, so he rented a space and bought propane tanks to distribute to neighbors, friends, and the food businesses in the region.  The business started to yield results and he has managed to earn enough income to pay his family expenses for the last 13 years during which he has had his business.

Hilario's requesting the loan to buy more gas tanks so he has enough to satisfy current demand.  There are areas where they still aren't able to install a natural gas supply.  Restaurants and food businesses are his main customers.

Hilario said his biggest desire is to have a car to transport his product.  Currently he makes deliveries on a motorcycle, which increases his expenses because he has to make more trips.  That way he'd be able to increase the profit he earns for his work and be in a position to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy gas tanks

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es: Sandra es una mujer joven, humilde y trabajadora que ha sido vendedora en varios almacenes de vestido, pero hace aproximadamente tres años estudió un curso de confecciones y compró un máquina plana y una fileteadora, para empezar su negocio y solicitó el crédito para utilizarlo en la compra de otra máquina plana familiar y una fileteadora industrial, con lo que pretende ampliar su negocio y adecuar el local. Sueña con generar empleo y tener mayores ingresos estables para mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Sandra is a young, humble, hard-working woman who has been a saleswoman in various dress stores, but approximately three years ago she took a course on tailoring and bought a tabletop sewing machine and an overlock sewing machine to start her own business. 

She requested a loan to use it in the purchase of another tabletop sewing machine and an industrial overlock sewing machine, with which she intends to expand her business and adapt her business premises.

She dreams of generating employment and having a better and more stable income to improve her family´s finances.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine and an industrial overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is married with two children. She buys drinks and sells them to her customers. She has been in this business for twelve years and has expanded and grown gradually. She buys from a wholesale depot and sells to her customers. She operates her drinking bar from her residence. Janet needs this loan to buy more drinks, and new types of drinks, for her bar to increase her stock and attract both new and old customers. Her greatest desire is to educate her children who attend school so that she can guarantee them a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for her bar to increase her stock and attract both new and old customers.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel es un campesino de 56 años de edad, humilde y trabajador, padre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Las labores del campo las aprendió por medio de su padre y actualmente es su única alternativa para generar ingresos, tiene cultivos de plátano y además compra y vende heno, así complementa los recursos para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas) y heno al por mayor, así logrará obtener una cosecha más productiva y mejorar las utilidades que recibe por la venta.
Miguel manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder tener buena salud para poder continuar fortaleciendo su negocio y así dejar un buen legado a sus hijos, para que no pasen necesidades de tipo económico y tengan un futuro próspero.
texts.en:
Miguel is a humble, hard-working 56-year-old rural employee. He is the father of three children whom he has gotten ahead with much effort and dedication. 
He learned about field work from his father and currently it is his only way to generate an income. He has banana crops and also buys and sells hay, which is how he complements the resources that he uses to support his family.

The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of agricultural supplies (compost, fertilizer, pesticide) and wholesale hay, with which he will be able to obtain a more productive harvest and improve the profit he receives through the sale.

Miguel states that his greatest wish is to be able to have good health in order to be able to continue strengthening his business, and leave a good inheritance to his children, so that they do not have financial needs and do have a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (compost, fertilizer, pesticide) and wholesale hay

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a married man, aged 28, with 2 children aged 7 and 5 years, who all attend school.  He lives in Kagadi where he has been operating a retail shop and produce selling to provide necessities to his family.  He hopes to grow his business to the level of a whole sale shop despite challenges of competition from similar businesses and high transportation costs caused by poor roads.  Simon is requesting for a loan to buy more sugar, salt and other general merchandise for his business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and other general merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a 51 year old married man living in Kagadi-Uganda with 5 children between the ages of 2 and 18 years old, but only 3 attend school.  He has been dealing in alcohol production to generate income for his family although challenged by poor and slippery roads.  Bernard hopes to educate his children and is asking for a loan to buy more alcohol and drums for resale and to pay his employees.

loans.use: to buy more alcohol and drums for resale and to pay his employees.

loans.name: Gonzalo De Jesús

texts.es:
Gonzalo es un hombre de 51 años de edad, entregado a su familia y dedicado a su labor, desde hace 2 años abrió una legumbrería en el barrio donde se radicó, proviene de un municipio del cual fue desplazado por la violencia que se presentaba, trabaja solo todos los días de 7 am a 8 pm, ofreciendo todo tipo de frutas y verduras a precios competitivos, lo que le ha permitido ser reconocido y aceptado en el sector.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de surtido al por mayor (frutas y verduras) esto le permitirá mantener la variedad y frescura que buscan sus clientes, logrando aumentar las ventas e ingresos con los que solventa los gastos de su hogar.
Gonzalo expresa que tiene como propósito darle continuidad y permanencia en el tiempo a su negocio, logrando una buena acreditación y fortalecimiento, para así garantizar una estabilidad económica que le permita disfrutar una vejez tranquila en compañía de su esposa.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is 51 year old, committed to his family and dedicated to his work. 2 years ago he opened a vegetable business in the neighborhood to where he relocated, coming from a municipality which was displaced by the violence that was present. He works alone every day from 7 AM to 9 PM, offer all kinds of fruits and vegetables at competitive prices which has allowed him to become well-known and accepted in the area.

The loan he seeks will be invested in buying stock at wholesale (fruits and vegetables), which will permit him to maintain the variety and freshness that his customers seek, thus increasing his sales and income with which he can pay his household expenses.

Gonzalo states that he has the goal to provide continuity and permanence in his business, achieving a good accreditation and strengthening, and in this way guarantee an economic stability that allows him to enjoy a tranquil old age in the company of his spouse.

loans.use: to buy stock for his business at wholesale (fruits and vegetables).

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer (pictured) is a 30-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife and three kids (two sons and one daughter) in a small and simple house.

Two years ago, Amer opened a small electrical repair workshop. It has been a very good project, in large part because Amer has significant experience in this field.

Amer would like to improve his store. As a result, he is seeking a loan from FATEN. The loan proceeds would help him buy more repair parts for his workshop, which Amer believes will enable him to increase his productivity and also his income.

loans.use: to purchase additional repair parts for his electrical repair workshop.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 26 years old and from Kagadi, Uganda. She is a divorced, hard-working lady. Judith has two children, 10 and 6 years old, all of whom attend school. She owns a food stall in the market where she sells farm fresh foods to generate income to support her family. Despite inadequate capital, she has hopes to buy land for agriculture in future. Judith is intending to use a loan to buy more tomatoes, fruits and other fresh foods for resale.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, fruits and other fresh foods for resale.

loans.name: Mario De Jesús

texts.es:
Mario es un adulto mayor, que siempre ha trabajado como conductor de transporte público, pero hace unos meses se quedó sin empleo y al no poder ubicarse nuevamente, tuvo que cambiar su actividad y ahora vende yogures, que distribuye en su carro, por las tiendas de su barrio, pero actualmente ha tenido fallas mecánicas y se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar el crédito, para poder repararlo y comprar más insumos (frutas, azúcar, leche) para su negocio. 

Mario sueña con cambiar su vehículo por otro más grande, en el que pueda vender más yogures y mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Mario is an older adult who has always worked as a driver of public transportation vehicles, but a few months ago he found himself unemployed and since he could not find employment again, he had to change his profession and now he sells yogurt. 

He distributes the yogurt in his car, to the stores in his neighborhood, but he is currently having mechanical failures and needs to request a loan to be able to repair his vehicle and purchase more supplies (fruit, sugar, milk) for his business.

Mario dreams of exchanging his vehicle for a bigger one, in which he could sell more yogurt and improve his finances.

loans.use: to repair his car and buy more supplies (fruit, sugar, milk)

loans.name: Vevelyn

texts.en:
Vevelyn, 50,  is married and has five children. One child is still in school.

Vevelyn and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Vevelyn is taking out a housing loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos. She will use the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labour to build a house for her family. 

Vevelyn has been a borrower with the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation since 2012. With your help, she can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of the typhoon. 

In future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labour

loans.name: Marcos Jose

texts.en:
Becoming an automotive mechanic is Marcos' dream. To achieve his goal, Marcos has enrolled in CETAM. He expects to graduate in December, 2015 but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. 

Marcos shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With a Vittana loan, Marcos plans on purchasing his much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Marcos feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. With a degree in mechanics he expects to earn $10 a day. 

Unfortunately, Marcos' parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. With four older siblings Marcos is unsure how he will be able to afford his school costs on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Marcos' and his father's salary from their job as a mason is the family's primary source of income.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 34-year-old married man from Gaza City. He lives with his wife in a small and simple house. 

Mohammad is a public sector employee. He is the sole source of income for his family. Unfortunately, he earns a low income.

Mohammad injured his back and urgently needs surgery. Since he does not have enough money, he is requesting a loan from FATEN. The loan will help him pay for the hospital expenses associated with his surgery.

loans.use: to pay for the hospital expenses associated his surgery

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en:
Mousa (pictured) is a 24-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small and simple house.

To earn a living, Mousa uses his van to transfer goods for local traders. It is a very good business and allows him to earns a nice income.

Mousa is seeking a loan from FATEN to repair his van so that he can continue to transfer goods. What's more, with the loan proceeds, Mousa believes that he will be able to take on more orders and thereby increase his income.

loans.use: to repair his van so he can continue transferring good on it

loans.name: Mahran

texts.en:
Mahran (pictured) is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of five kids: three sons and two daughters.

Mahran opened a small store where he sells women's clothes. He buys the clothes from local wholesalers. He explains that it is a good business but that it still needs some improvements.

Mahran is seeking a loan from FATEN to help him to buy more products for his store, which he can then re-sell to his customers. With the loan proceeds, Mahran is confident that he will be able to improve his store and also his sales.

loans.use: to improve his store by purchasing additional inventory and products

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a conservative person, who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son appears in this photo.

Sabah is a 46-year-old married woman from the city of Jabalia. She lives with her husband and six kids, one son and five daughters. Sabah opened a small stall two years ago, selling women's clothes. She buys clothes from the local wholesalers. It is a good business but still needs some improvements.

Sabah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more products for her stall to resell. By taking this loan, Sabah will be able to improve her store as well as her sales.

loans.use: to buy more products for her stall to resell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, 51, is married with seven children. With one child still in school, Nida works very hard to provide for her family.

Nida's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Nida needs materials to provide her family with safe shelter.

Nida has taken a housing loan of 4,660 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase building materials  and pay for construction labour to rebuild her family home.

Nida is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in future, would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labour

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a father of four school-aged children and ventured into the businesses of produce and bar operation. He wants to earn more income, to support his family, and to expand his business into new market areas despite being challenged by poor roads that make transportation of produce to his customers difficult. 

Godfrey used the previous loan to buy beer and sodas to sell. Now, he has asked for a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y servicial, a sus 31 años de edad es casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años, quien se ha convertido en su principal motivación para luchar con empeño y dedicación.
Actualmente se desempeña como empleada de oficios varios en una institución universitaria de la ciudad pero, con el ánimo de mejorar los ingresos desea iniciar un taller de confección para lo cual ya posee 3 máquinas que ha ido comprando con el salario que devenga en su empleo, para ello solicita el apoyo del crédito que será invertido en la compra de 2 máquinas fileteadoras de segunda mano que le están ofreciendo a buen precio, así podrá dar inicio a su nuevo proyecto productivo con el que espera generar recursos suficientes para dar a su hijo un mejor bienestar y educación.
Diana tiene como propósito para el futuro dedicarse de lleno a su negocio independiente y así pasar más tiempo con su familia mientras genera recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida al lado de sus seres amados.
texts.en:
Diana is a hard-working, charismatic, helpful, 31-year-old woman.  She is married and has a four-year-old child who is her main motivation to fight with determination and dedication. 

Currently she works at a local university carrying out various duties, but she plans to open a sewing shop so she can improve her income. She already has three machines which she bought with the salary from her job, but she is requesting a loan so that she can buy two second-hand overlock machines which she can get for a good price. Then she can start her new project which she hopes will generate enough income to provide her son with a better quality of life and an education. 

In the future, Diana aims to devote herself fully to her independent business and spend more time with her family while generating resources to support her husband with the household finances and enjoy a better quality of life together with her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy two overlock sewing machines.

loans.name: Pelusi

texts.en: Pelusi is a 29 year old, hard-working, single parent who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. She has three children who are 11, 7 and 1 years old. She has been operating a retail shop since 2011 and farming to generate income to support her family. She hopes to buy land and build a residential house for her family. Pelusi is requesting a loan to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad (pictured) is a 28-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of three kids: one son and two daughters.

One year ago, Mohammad opened a small electrical store, where he sells small electrical devices and repair parts. He explains that it is a good business but that it still needs some improvements.
