Mohammad is seeking a loan from FATEN to help him to buy more products for his store, which he would then re-sell to his customers. With the loan proceeds, Mohammad is confident that he will be able to improve his store and to increase his sales.

loans.use: to improve his store by purchasing additional products for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his stall by purchasing additional clothes for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 44-year-old single man from the city of Bethlehem. He lives alone in his small house in the city. Imad opened a small beauty salon seven years ago. It is a good business and Imad has very good experience in this field. Imad would like to improve his business by adding a small section for selling wedding dresses.

Imad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy wedding dresses for his store to resell. By taking this loan, Imad will be able to improve his store and also his sales. 

Imad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses for his store to resell

loans.name: Suhad

texts.en:
Suhad is a conservative person, who prefers not to have her photo published online. So, her husband appears in the photo. 

Suhad is a 41-year-old married woman from Gaza City. She is a mother of three kids, two sons and one daughter. Suhad's husband opened a small electrical store two years ago, where he sells small electrical machines and repairs parts. It is a good business but still needs some improvements.

Suhad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband buy more products for his store to resell. By taking this loan, he will be able to improve his store and also his sales.

loans.use: to help her husband buy more products for his store to resell

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 59 years old and married with six children. With one child currently in school, Clarita works very hard to provide for them.

Clarita's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She needs materials to provide her family with safe shelter.

Clarita has taken a 9,800 PHP housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Clarita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Kifaya

texts.en:
Kifaya is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in this photo. 

Kifaya is a 40-year-old married woman from the city of Qalqilia. She is the mother of seven kids, four sons and three daughters. Kifaya's husband opened a small auto repair workshop ten years ago. It is a good business but still needs some improvements.

Kifaya took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband buy more auto repair parts for his workshop. By taking this loan, he will be able to increase his productivity as well as his income

loans.use: to help her husband buy more auto repair parts for his workshop

loans.name: Reyadh

texts.en:
Reyadh, 24, is a single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is an educated young man who graduated from secondary school. 

Recently, he became an employee in the private sector. Although he worked very hard and even worked overtime, his salary was not enough to cover all his family living expenses. Therefore, he decided to start up his own business. 

He opened a small mill two years ago. His business is going very well, and he wants to expand it through purchasing more wheat bags. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do so, so he has requested a youth loan for 200,000 Yemeni Rial from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. He will use the loan to buy wheat bags. 

He looks forward to improving his living standards and wants to open another mill in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat bags

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a Ugandan married man with two children, one year old and three years old. Neither children attend school. Joseph lives in Kagadi. 

He has been selling produce for development and profits. He also earns income from a salon and owns two maize milling machines to earn extra income. 

Joseph intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell. His vision is to start rearing animals and buy a motorcycle to make transportation of his produce easier.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 42-year-old hardworking married Ugandan man living in Kagadi. He has five children between the ages of 18 and 26 years old. All of the children are attending school. 

Vincent has been dealing in the cattle trade to earn a living alongside farming. He hopes to educate his children in spite of high competition in the business. 

Vincent is requesting a loan to buy cattle for slaughtering.

loans.use: to buy cattle for slaughtering.

loans.name: Dicky

texts.en: Dicky is a 41-year-old, Ugandan married man, who lives in Kagadi. He has four children between the ages of 17 and 6 years old, three of whom attend school. He has been selling produce to finance his family's needs. He hopes to educate his children but he is challenged by poor road conditions. Dicky is requesting a loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a 54-year-old married Ugandan man living in Kagadi where he has been selling produce and milk to generate income. 

He has four children between the ages of 6 and 17 years old, and all attend school. 

Abdul intends to use the loan to buy maize for resale. He hopes to grow his business in the future despite poor roads.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Daira Lizet

texts.en:
Becoming a computer engineer has always been Daira's dream. Daira is currently attending the Universidad Autónoma Juan Misael Saracho, working towards her degree in computer engineering. She plans on graduating in April 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. Daira plans on using the funds from this loan to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Tarija.

With a degree in computer engineering, Daira expects to earn $30 a day. Daira hopes to be a role model for her younger brother by being the first in her family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent is a 42-year-old, hard-working, married man who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a cattle trader and a farmer, and owns a butcher shop. Vicent also has rentals where he gets income to meet his family's needs. He hopes to educate his seven children despite his challenges of competition and inadequate capital to expand his business. Vicent intends to use this loan to buy more cattle.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a freezer and a variety of other products for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es de la ciudad de Ybycui, una persona muy trabajadora que con sacrificio está estudiando y trabajando a la vez.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y comenta que su sueño siempre ha sido poder ayudar a las demás personas y por medio de su trabajo también poder ayudar a su familia y realizarse como persona y profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus gastos de titulación, para que de esa forma siga estudiando y cumplir con su sueño.
texts.en:
Nancy is from the city of Ybycui.  She is a very hard-working person who, with sacrifice, is studying and working at the same time.  She is studying for a career in nursing and says that her dream has always been to help other people.  Through her job she would also be able to help her family and to find fulfillment as a person and a professional.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay for her degree expenses so that she can continue studying and fulfill her dream.

loans.use: to pay for degree expenses.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 21-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda and has no children. 

He operates a retail shop alongside farming and alcohol businesses to earn a living and improve his standard of living. He hopes to construct a good house, but he is challenged by competition and high license fees by the tax authority.  

Robert intends to use the loan to buy sodas and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Kisinsiima Abeteraine Group

texts.en:
Leonard is a 43-year-old Ugandan male living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is married with four children. All of the children attend school. 

He sells produce to earn a daily income and also earns money from farming. With his passion for agriculture, he dreams of buying a car to help him transport his stock to the city. He also wants to educate his children. 

Leonard wants a loan to buy coffee and beans to sell. He is a member of Kisinsiima Abeteraine Group in which members guarantee each other to get a loan since they don't have any security.

loans.use: to buy coffee and beans to sell.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is a 51-year-old, married, hard-working man. He has 12 children, between 30 and 2 years old; five of whom attend school. He lives in Kagadi. Tom has been selling produce and alcohol to earn a living. He hopes to educate his children, though he is affected by price fluctuation. Tom intends to use this loan to buy more alcohol and produce.

loans.use: to buy more alcohol and produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal, salt, rice, milk, soap, etc. for her business,

loans.name: René Del Carmen

texts.es: René es un joven de 28 años que vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 3 años, en una comunidad de Nicaragua. Desde muy pequeño hacía algunas tareas de la familia en la finca de café de sus padres. Ahora cuenta con su pequeña finca de 11 hectáreas de las cuales 4.2 son de café. Este joven emprendedor logró bachillerarse en su comunidad y ahora cuida de su pequeña familia, su mamá y abuela. Es parte de los productores de avanzada que atiende la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), contando con las certificaciones de Fairtrade, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices en su producción de café. Los rendimientos de café que ha logrado este joven en su finca han sido de 57 quintales pergamino por hectárea. Para este ciclo 2014-2015 él requiere un financiamiento para garantizar el mantenimiento de las plantaciones de café y continuar mejorando los rendimientos productivos. En su comunidad lo conocen por ser un joven emprendedor, honesto y responsable. Estas cualidades considera le han ayudado a salir adelante y le permitirán crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
René is 28 and lives with his wife and small 3 year old son in a community in Nicaragua. 

Since he was very young he did chores for the family in his parents coffee farm. 

Now he has a small farm of 11 hectares out of which 4.2 are coffee. 

This young entrepreneur was able to graduate high school in his community and now he supports his small family, mom and grandmother. 

He is part of the advanced producers who are members of the "Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria" (PAC) association with Fairtrade, UTZ and C.A.F.E.certifications. 

He has produced 57 quintals per hectare of coffee in his farm. For the 2014-2015 season he is requesting a loan to guarantee the maintenance of his coffee farm and to keep improving his production. 

In his community he is known as a honest and responsible young entrepreneur.

He believes these qualities have helped him to get ahead and will allow him to grow financially.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz es una mujer de 51 años, emprendedora y honesta que hasta hace diez años trabajaba en talleres de confección, pero decidió iniciar su propio negocio y montó un restaurante que con el pasar del tiempo ganó muchos clientes y buen reconocimiento, al punto de convertirse en referente del sector. Luz invertirá su crédito en la compra de surtido para el restaurante (carne, granos, pastas, verduras) y sueña con hacer crecer considerablemente su negocio y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Luz, 51, is an enterprising and honest woman who worked in garment workshops until 10 years ago.  She decided to start her own business, so she set up a restaurant.  As time passed, the restaurant acquired a lot of customers and good recognition, and became a model in the sector.

Luz will invest her loan in supplies for her restaurant (meat, grains, pasta, vegetables).

She dreams of expanding her business considerably and improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy meat, grains, pasta, and vegetables

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es: Juan Angel tiene 49 años de edad y vive con su esposa y 6 hijos en una comunidad de Jinotega, al norte de Nicaragua. Desde hace 30 años posee una pequeña finca de 8 manzanas en las cuales cultiva malanga coco, maíz, frijol y café en 4 manzanas. Hasta ahora ha obtenido 10 créditos de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), a través de la cual está integrado al proceso de certificación Comercio Justo. Para este año, este pequeño productor requiere un financiamiento para la compra de abono y fertilizantes que le permitan garantizar el mantenimiento de sus plantaciones de café, y con ello incrementar los rendimientos productivos de su finca. El sueño de Juan Angel es que todos sus hijos lleguen a graduarse de una carrera universitaria y tengan mejores condiciones que las que él puede darles ahora. Su esfuerzo y trabajo día a día es para seguir apoyando a sus hijos y lograr su sueño en unos años.
texts.en:
Juan Angel tis 49 years old. He lives with his wife and 6 children in a community of Jinotega in the North of Nicaragua. For the past 30 years he has had a small farm of 8 manzanas (about 14 acres) where he grows malanga (eaten like a tropical potato) corn, beans and coffee on 4 mazanas. Up to now he has received 10 loans from Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) during which time he been in the process getting Fair Trade certification. 

For this season he needs a loan to buy fertilizers and manure which will guarantee the maintenance of his coffee crops and also raise the productivity of his farm. Juan Angel's dream is for all his children to graduate from university and that they enjoy better conditions that what he can give them now. His effort and daily work is to continue to support his children and achieve his dream in a few years.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a two needle sewing machine and sewing supplies (thread, cloth, buttons etc.)

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
La Srita. Fabiola es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, aspira ser una buena profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Está estudiando la carrera de Licenciatura en prótesis dental, a lo que le está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para ser una estudiante destacada.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y cumplir con su meta
texts.en:
Fabiola is very responsible and dedicated to her studies and her family. 

She aspires to be a good professional and to keep studying and help people. 

She is studying to get a Bachelors degree in dental prosthesis. 

She is putting all her efforts into being an outstanding student. 

She is requesting this loan so she can pay for her fees and in this way keep studying and reach her goal.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 26 años, está cursando el último año de la Carrera de Administración de Empresas, vive con su abuela, sus padres son separados, él trabaja en un estudio Contable hace 2 años y con lo que gana está costeando los estudios, su abuela tiene un pequeño ingreso, y también lo ayuda un poco con ello. Él está consciente de su responsabilidad y se siente decidido a terminar su carrera para ser un profesional independiente.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y así seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 26 and is in his last year of studying for his bachelors in Business Administration. 

He lives with his grandmother. His parents are separated. 

For the past two years he has worked for an accounting firm and he pays for his studies with his earnings. 

His grandmother has a small income and she also helps him a little bit. 

He is aware of his responsibilities and is dedicated to finishing his studies in order to be an independent professional. 

He is requesting this loan so he can pay his fees and keep studying.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 53 years old and married with one child. 

Bernadette and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Her business and family home was wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan in the amount of 9,950 PHP to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Bernadette has been a Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) borrower since 2013. 

With your help, Bernadette can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and has a live-in partner with four children. With two children currently in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her house and business and now needs materials to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a 9,775 PHP housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Evelyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 33-year-old hardworking and divorced Ugandan woman living in Kagadi. She has three children aged 5, 9, and 12 years old. All of the children attend school. 

Christine has operated a beauty salon business since 2011 to generate an income for her family. She also earns an income from farming. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more hair extensions for her business. She also hopes to buy land despite inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy more hair extensions for her business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel vive en una comunidad rural de Nicaragua, donde la principal actividad económica es la producción de café. En su pequeña finca de 2 hectáreas, este productor ha establecido 0.7 hectárea de café en la cual ha logrado cosechar 35 quintales de café pergamino en el último ciclo. Para este año, este pequeño productor requiere un financiamiento para adquirir los insumos y fertilizantes que permitan la nutrición de las plantas y lograr así una mayor productividad. Su objetivo en los próximos años, es ir estableciendo otras áreas de café en su pequeña finca, ya que considera que este es un rubro rentable, que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel lives in a rural community in Nicaragua where the main economic activity is coffee production.  On his small farm of just 2 hectares, this producer has established 0.7 hectares of coffee, of which he managed to harvest 35 quintals (1 quintal = 100kg) of parchment coffee in the last cycle.  For this year he needs funding in order to acquire the supplies and fertilizers that would allow him to provide nutrition to the plants and achieve greater productivity.

His goal for the coming years is to establish other areas of coffee on his small farm since he considers this to be a profitable field.  This would allow him to have higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Magaly Cecilia

texts.es: Magaly es una mujer de 53 años, madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, quien hace seis años se percata de que no está invirtiendo su tiempo de manera productiva, por lo que decide empezar a trabajar la venta de mercancía por catálogo (productos de belleza y productos para el hogar), negocio en el que le ha ido bien hasta ahora, pero quiere invertir el dinero del crédito en más mercancía (cosméticos, cremas faciales, productos de aseo personal y para el hogar), con lo que puede ganar descuentos y premios por pedir mayores cantidades. Ella sueña con vivir en una casa independiente y montar una miscelánea con los premios que gana y los productos que vende, con el fin de subsistir en condiciones más cómodas y cubrir sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Magaly, 53, is the mother of three adult children.  Six years ago she realized she wasn't using her time productively, so she started making catalogue sales of beauty products and home products.  This business has gone well for her thus far.

Magaly wants to invest the loan in more merchandise: cosmetics, face cream, personal care products, and home products.  She'll be able to earn discounts and prizes by ordering large quantities.

She dreams of living in her own house and setting up a store with the prizes she wins and the products she sells.  Her goal is to live in more comfortable conditions and cover her personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, face cream, personal care products, and home products

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
This is Eufemia, a 55-year-old resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nonito, an employee, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eufemia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns an income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also sells food for lunch for an additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP700 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Eufemia dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to give her family a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and while there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 60 years old and married with five children.

Antonieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

She has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from raising pigs and farming rice.

Antonieta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. Arlene is married and, for the last two years has had a buy and sell vegetable and spices business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

In the future, Arlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Julio Alexander

texts.es:
Julio  de 37 años de edad por sus escazos recursos económicos no fue a la escuela,  tenía que ayudarle a sus padres a trabajar ya que sus familia era muy pobre, aparte de eso sus padres no creian en el estudio, actualmente está acompañado y su esposa que se dedica a trabajar con él en el campo, tienen 3 hijos y están estudiando.

Julio actualmente se dedica a sembrar maíz  y lo ha hecho desde que era niño, se levanta desde las 4:00 AM y tiene que trasladarse al campo donde tiene la milpa, hace un recorrido de unos 4 kilómetros en bicicleta.

Julio utilizará el dinero del préstamo para sembrar una hectárea de maiz, ya que en estos días es donde empiezan a limpiar las tierras donde trabaja, ademas comprará una ternera  y asi podrá ir teniendo ganado.

Julio en un futuro, sueña con tener una mejor casa, tener un vehiculo en cual poder trasportar a su familia y sueña con darle a sus hijos el estudio que él no tuvo.
texts.en:
Julio is 37 years old and did not attend school because of scarce financial resources.  He had to help his parents work because his family is poor.  Besides that, his parents didn’t believe in education.  He is married and his wife also works in the fields.  The have three children, all in school.

Julio raises corn and has done this since he was a boy.  He gets up at 4:00 am and goes to the fields where his corn crop is.  He travel 4 km by bicycle.

Julio will use the money to plant a hectare of corn now that they are beginning to clear the fields where he works.  He will also buy a steer so that he can begin to have livestock.

Julio dreams of having a better house in the future, a vehicle so he can transport his family, and provide his children with the education he didn’t have.

loans.use: to plant corn and buy a steer.

loans.name: Jesús Ana

texts.es:
Jesús de 72 años de edad, solo estudio segundo grado, solamente tiene un hijo, es soltera. Se dedica al comercio de tienda en sus localidad, desde hace más de 30 años, sus familia le enseño a trabajar y a seguir en el comercio, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y trabaja todos los días abre bien temprano y cierra la tienda hasta por la noche.

 El crédito lo necesita para incrementar los productos que vende en su tienda. Para ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos a disposición de los clientes y que se sientan satisfechos.
texts.en:
Jesús is 72 years old. She stayed in school only through the second grade, she has one son, and she is single. Her primary work is running a store in her neighborhood, which she has done for more than 30 years. Her family taught her to work this business, which she runs out of her home. She opens early every day and closes the store at night. 

She needs this loan to increase the amount of merchandise that she sells in her stores. It will help her offer greater quantity of products to meet the needs of her customers and keep them satisfied.

loans.use: increase the goods she sells in her store.

loans.name: Marjul

texts.en:
Marjul is now married and has been helping her husband in their transportation business to make a living. The couple earns well from this. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan which was used for buying spare parts and tires. Marjul is also engaged in a retail business selling grocery goods in their village. To offer more to her costumers, she has taken a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a better life and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. With it, she was able to buy the products needed for her variety store. She was also able to help her family financially as the income from her business is assisting with their everyday household expenditures. She works hard to provide for her everyday needs. She also has a direct selling business and electronic loading station for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better, as this will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria Victoria dreams that all of her business will be successful and hopes that her family will always be in a good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
Heriberto es un hombre casado y padre de dos hijos por quienes ha luchado durante arduas jornadas para sacarlos adelante.
A sus 57 años de edad, se desempeña como técnico y comerciante independiente de electrodomésticos, oficio que aprendió desde hace 30 años de forma empírica y poco a poco fue ampliando sus conocimientos, el taller se encuentra ubicado en un espacio de su casa, además de prestar el servicio de reparación también compra electrodomésticos que estén en mal estado, los repara y luego los revende a un mejor precio, generando utilidades para así solventar los gastos de su familia.
Es por esta razón que solicita el crédito, el dinero será utilizado en la compra de electrodomésticos de segunda mano (televisores, radios, planchas), esto le permitirá repararlos y luego venderlos para obtener ganancias, con las que podrá seguir reinvirtiendo en su negocio y además brindar un mejor bienestar a sus hijos y esposa.
Heriberto manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir soñando y por ello lucha con empeño y constancia para lograr ampliar su negocio, pues es su mayor anhelo, así podrá dejar un buen legado a sus hijos y disfrutar una vejez más tranquila en compañía de su amada esposa.
texts.en:
Heriberto is a married man and the father of two children for whom he has fought long and hard to get them ahead. At 57 years of age, he has 30 years of experience gaining skill as a technician and independent salesperson of household electronics. He learned the job by doing it, and little by little he increased his knowledge. His shop is located in his home. In addition to doing service repairs, he also buys broken household electronics, repairs them, and then sells them at a higher price, thus earning income for his family's expenses.

He will use the money from the loan to buy second-hand household electronics, such as televisions, radios, and irons. This will let him repair them and then later sell them for income, which he will reinvest in his business and use to provide his wife and children with a comfortable living.

Heriberto says that his age does not stop him from dreaming, and that he continues to fight hard to expand his business, his dearest wish. He hopes to leave his children a good legacy, and enjoy his old age peacefully in the company of his beloved wife.

loans.use: buy second hand household appliances for repair and resale.

loans.name: Gerson Alexander

texts.es:
Gerson tiene 31 años de edad, estudió solamente hasta cuarto grado, no pudo seguir preparándose por la necesidad de comenzar a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres y hermanos, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar a sus 2 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando.

Gerson trabaja en la albañilería, este actividad la aprendió gracias a  su hermano mayor, quien lo capacitó con lo básico y posteriormente fue practicando hasta perfeccionarse en este oficio, tiene 12 años de  trabajar en este rubro, también  realiza trabajos de estructuras metálicas, desde hace 8 años. Gerson trabaja de lunes a sábado, tiene que viajar lejos de su casa y quedarse hasta 15 días lejos de su familia.

 Él necesita este préstamo para la compra de herramientas de trabajo: escuadra, grifas, cañuelas, taladro y un aparato soldador para trabajar en las estructuras metálicas, con estos materiales se le facilitará el trabajo y tendrá mayores y mejores oportunidades de obtener ingresos.

Gerson sueña con tener su propio vehículo para movilizarse y llevar sus herramientas de trabajo, ya que cuando surgen trabajos en lugares que están lejos de su casa, se le dificulta el traslado. Sabe que con mucho trabajo y sacrificándose un poco en este momento podrá comprarlo en un futuro.
texts.en:
Gerson is 31 years old and only has a fourth grade education. He was not able to continue his studies because he needed to work in order to help his parents and siblings. Gerson is in a relationship and his partner takes care of the household chores and looking after their two children who are in school.

Gerson works as a bricklayer, a trade that he learned from his older brother. After learning the basics, Gerson went on to perfect his skills in this trade. He has been in this line of work for 12 years. Gerson has also been doing metal work for eight years. He works Monday through Saturday. His work requires him to travel far from home, so he can be away from his family for up to 15 days at a time.

Gerson needs this loan so that he can by tools for his work such as a framing square, wrenches, rods, a drill, and welding equipment for his metal work. These materials will make his work easier, thus giving him more and better opportunities to generate income.

Gerson dreams of having his own vehicle that he can use for travel and carrying his work tools since the jobs he takes are in places far from his home. At the moment, travel is difficult. Gerson knows that a lot of work and a little bit of sacrifice will enable him to buy a vehicle in the future.

loans.use: to buy a framing square, wrenches, rods, a drill, and welding equipment for his metal work.

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es:
Milagro de 34 años de edad,  es una mujer que trabaja arduamente por sacar adelante su familia, solamente pudo estudiar sexto grado, porque a temprana edad tuvo que involucrarse en las actividades productivas para ayudar a sus padres. Esta acompañada y su cónyuge es jornalero en tejeras de la zona. El hijo mayor emigro para Estados unidos y  la hija menor esta estudiando. 


Anteriormente se dedicaba  ayudar a sus padres en las actividades de agricultura y desde hace un año tiene venta de ropa, aprendió este oficio gracias a una amiga que le dio la oportunidad de acompañarla a vender, trabaja de lunes a domingo.

El crédito lo necesita para surtir el negocio de venta de ropa, ya que en este momento cuenta con varios pedidos y no tiene el suficiente dinero para invertir. Sin el financiamiento dejaría pasar la oportunidad de obtener mejores ingresos.

Su sueño es tener un local donde pueda vender ropa en el mercado, ya que hay mas oportunidades de vender y mayor afluencia de clientes y no tendría que andar vendiendo casa por casa. Caminando grandes distancias.
texts.en:
Milagro is 34 years old and works arduously to get her family ahead.  She was only able to study to sixth grade because she had to go to work to help her parents at a young age.  She is married and her husband is a laborer for weavers in the area.  Her son emigrated to the United States and her daughter is in school.

She used to help her parents farm, but this years she has a clothing business.  She learned to do this thanks to a friend who provided her the chance to work with her. She works Monday through Sunday.

She needs this loan to stock her clothing sales business, since she has various orders to fill and doesn’t have the money to invest.  Without financing she will have to pass on the opportunity to have a better income.

Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell clothing in the market where there are more opportunities, the customers have more money, and she won’t have to sell door to door, walking great distances.

loans.use: to stock her clothign business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana es del último año de Contaduría Pública. Espera recibirse y continuar con la tienda de ropas que tiene y además comenzar con su propio estudio contable.
Además le gustaría realizar un postgrado en didáctica universitaria e incursionar en la educación universitaria además le gustaría seguir la carrera de administración agropecuaria en un futuro no muy lejano.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de universidad, con lo cual podrá seguir estudiando y cumpliendo con su meta.
texts.en:
Susana is in her final year of studying to become a public accountant. She hopes to graduate, continue with the clothing shop that she has, and also begin her own studies in accounting.  

Additionally, she would also like to continue with postgraduate work in university teaching and enter into a professorship. She would also like to continue her studies in agribusiness administration in the near future.

She is requesting his loan to invest in her college education, allowing her to pay her tuition, keep studying, and achieve her goal.

loans.use: pay her college tuition.

loans.name: Dolorosa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Dolorosa works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  Dolorosa is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is a married woman who works hard to support her family.

To earn a living, Emelda operates a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers. In the future, Emelda would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana de 30 años de edad, estudio solamente tercer grado, es soltera y tiene dos hijos  que van a la escuela, ella trabaja de doméstica en una farmacia de la localidad sus hijos dependen económicamente  de ella, nada mas sus ingresos provienen del trabajo que ella realiza día a día, trabaja en ese lugar desde hace diez años como doméstica, su trabajo le queda muy lejos por lo que se queda no viaja, solo a este trabajo se dedica nada más.

 El crédito lo necesita para terminar de arreglar su casa, ya que solo las paredes tiene terminadas, le falta el techo y las puertas, por lo que necesita el financiamiento para que sus hijos tengan un buen lugar donde vivir, su sueño es terminar sus casa que sus hijos tranquilos que continúen trabajando y estudiando para que sean personas de éxito en el futuro, para que dependan de ellos mismos.
texts.en:
Juana, 30, went to school through the third grade.  She's single and has two children who attend school.

Juana has worked as a housekeeper in a pharmacy in her town for 10 years.  Her children are financially dependent on her and on the income from the work she does every day.  It's her only job.  Her job is very far so she stays there; she doesn't travel.

Juana needs the loan to finish fixing up her house.  Only the walls are finished; the roof and the doors are missing.  She needs the loan so her children will have a good place to live.

Her dream is to finish her house.  She also wants her children to be happy and continue working and going to school to be successful and self-sufficient people in the future.

loans.use: to buy the roof and the doors for her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eggs, yogurt, juices, flour, rice, sodas, and other products.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana es de la ciudad de San Pedro, cuenta que a los 14 años vino a la ciudad para estudiar, anteriormente venía  desde la granja que venía caminando, en moto o cualquier otro medio que se presente para llegar a la escuela. Con el colegio ya se iba complicando venir de ahí ya que los quehaceres eran cada vez más amplios así que decidió mudarse y  alquilar una casa en la que vive con su hermana quien también es su compañera de facultad.
Está estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad y le faltan dos años para terminar la carrera. Al culminar sus  estudios quiere capacitarse constantemente y si es posible seguir otra carrera. Sueña y anhela tener su propia casa con un buen trabajo y  ser una excelente profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de estudios, como copias, materiales y demás.
texts.en:
Emiliana is from San Pedro. She moved there at age 14 to go to school. Before, she used to come in from the farm on foot or on motorbike or however else she could manage to get to school. When she reached high school, things got harder since she had more homework and more chores. She decided to move to town and rent a house with her sister, who is also a classmate.

She is studying accounting and has two years left to complete her degree. When she finishes school, she wants to constantly train for something, and is thinking about another degree. She hopes for and dreams of having her own home, having a good job, and of being an excellent professional.

She will invest his loan in her future, by paying for her school expenses, such as copies, materials, and more.

loans.use: pay her school expenses, like copies, materials and more.

loans.name: Leilanie

texts.en:
Leilanie is married and has one child.

She helps her husband operate their fishing business. At the same time, she is engaged in a service-based transportation business in their village to help earn additional income for the family. She explains that she and her husband earn decent income to provide for the needs of the family. She works hard at both of these businesses in order to provide her child with a good education. In the picture, she is next to the motorcycle she uses for her transportation business.

She is seeking a loan from GDMPC micro-credit for additional capital to buy fishing nets. In the near future, she plans to build a store and wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts and supplies and to maintain her shop.

loans.name: Abadias Antonio

texts.es: Abadías vive en unión libre y tiene 6 hijos, tiene  como profesión la ebanistería y desde tiempo atrás aprendió el arte de elaborar juguetes tradicionales  (trompos, pirinolas, raquetas, lazos, yoyos) y se dio a la tarea de iniciar con un capital de $30.000 viajó a otras ciudades para ofrecer sus servicios como asesor e instructor de estos juegos tradicionales, lo cual en la actualidad le ha demandado mucha materia prima por la gran acogida que han tenido todos sus jueguetes en las diferentes escuelas e instituciones de la ciudad, por ello el sueño de Abadías es comprar una caladora para minimizar el tiempo de elaboración de los artículos y también adquirir materia prima al por mayor, debido a que se le presentan pedido extras en muchos eventos de competencia  y con ello poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, es apasionado y muy responsable con la labor que desempeña,  Abadías desea también hacerle mejoras a su negocio y poder de esta  manera disfrutar de un mejor solvencia económica para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Abadías lives in a common-law marriage and has six children.  He is a professional woodworker; some time ago he learned how to make traditional toys, such as tops, rackets, bows, and yoyos.  He began his business with $30,000 in capital. He started by traveling to other cities to offer his services as an advisory and instructor of traditional toys. This currently demands a great deal of raw materials, thanks to the warm reception that his toys have received in various schools and institutions in the city.

Abadías' goal is to buy a jig saw, which will reduce the time he needs to create his items, and also to acquire more raw materials at wholesale. Many of his customers order extras at various competitive events, and acquiring these things will help him meet his customers' demands. He is passionate and very responsible in the work that he does. Abadías also wants to improve his business and enjoy greater profitability for his entire family.

loans.use: buy a jig saw and raw materials, such as wood and paint

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es:
Cinthya es de la ciudad de Pilar, es estudiante y también está trabajando. Comenta que su meta es poder terminar sus estudios en administración de negocios, y ser una persona útil las demás personas.
Está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo en realizarse como persona y como profesional para poder ayudar a las demás personas de la sociedad.
Cinthya pide este préstamo para cubrir sus gastos de manutención como también para poder comprar sus útiles de la universidad y de esa forma poder estar más cerca de su meta. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Cinthya is a student who is from the city of Pilar and is also working. She says that her goal is to finish her studies in Business Administration so that she can become useful to other people.

Cinthya is putting forth her best effort to become a professional individual so that she can help other people in society. She is requesting this loan so that she can pay for her living expenses and also buy supplies for her university studies. This will help her get closer to her goal. She appreciates the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to pay for her living expenses and buy supplies for her university studies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es soltera, vive con su mama y papa en casa propia, tiene 2 hermanos que ya son independientes, actualmente trabaja en un hogar de ancianos y comenta que al terminar su carrera le gustaría abrir mi negocio contable, ya que le gustaría ser independiente y ayudar a sus padres.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de contaduría pública, en lo que se está esforzando bastante ya que quiere poder cumplir con su meta.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, con lo cual podrá seguir estudiando y luchando por mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is single. She lives with her mother and father, who have their own house. She has two siblings, who are already adults. Currently she works in a home for the elderly and notes that on finishing her studies she would like to open an accounting business since she would like to be independent and help her parents.

She is studying for a degree in public accounting and is working hard because she wants to be able to meet her goals. She is requesting this loan to pay for her studies so that she can continue studying and struggling for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay her university costs.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 35-year-old married woman. She has three children, who are currently in school.

To earn a living, she works in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Specifically, she raises pigs, which she has been doing for 10 years now,

Gemma is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs. Notably, she has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Ligaya works hard to support her family.

She has a pig-raising business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by running an internet cafe.

Ligaya is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pig-raising business. Notably, she successfully repaid seven previous loans from NWTF, which have helped her sustain her business activities, and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Gerson Jhonatan

texts.es:
Gerson tiene 22 años de edad, estudio bachillerato en el instituto nacional y también estudio un año en la universidad, pero a raíz que adquirió un compromiso familiar, ya no pudo seguir. Actualmente esta acompañado, vive con su esposa, quien tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y tienen dos hijas, una de 7 años que estudia en la escuela primer grado y otra de 2 años que es la hija de él, es una familia muy unida, gozan de buena reputación en la comunidad, son personas trabajadoras y tienen mucho sueños a futuro.
Por el momento no tiene una fuente de trabajo fuerte desde hace un mes, pero necesita el financiamiento para poner un negocio de venta de gas propano, ya que tiene mucha experiencia en este negocio y tiene mucha clientela, por que antes él se dedicaba a este negocio, lo único que trabajaba para una tienda y hoy necesita poner su propio negocio.
El financiamiento lo necesita para poner un negocio propio de venta de gas propano, ya que con los $500.0 sale bien, él tiene mucha experiencia en este negocio, por que ya la ha hecho, trabajo seis meses en este negocio y tiene clientela en la zona.
Él tiene muchos sueños a futuro, poner su propio negocio y de las ganancias ir incrementando mucho mas, ayudar a su familia en darle una vida mas mejor y si el negocio va creciendo mas adelante necesitara que CREDICAMPO le siga financiando para cumplir sus sueños y también sueña con tener su propia casa, Además, sueña de seguirle dando el apoyo a sus hijas en el estudio para que en un futuro sean profesionales para el desarrollo de la comunidad y él dice que nunca es tarde para estudiar entonces quiere seguir sus estudios en la universidad. Quiere tener una casa más digna, que cumpla la buena estabilidad familiar.
texts.en:
Gerson is 22 years old. He finished secondary school in a national institute. He also studied one year in the university, however because he had a family commitment he was unable to continue. Currently he has a partner and lives with his wife,who has a business selling clothing. They have two daughters, one, who is seven years old is in the first grade and the other, who is two years old, and who is his daughter is 2 years old. It is a very united family, which has a good reputation in the community. They are hardworking people and have big dreams for the future. For the moment, the past month, he does not have a strong source of work, however he needs funding to open a business selling propane gas. He has had a lot of experience in the business and has many customers because previously he make a living in this business. He used to work for a store and today he needs to start his own business. He needs funding to open his own business selling propane gas. With the $500 he will do well. As noted he has had a lot of experience in this business and has customers in the area.

He has many dreams for the future, to open his own business and from the profits expand his business and help his family by providing a better life for them. If the business continues growing in the future he will need for CREDICAMPO to continue with financing so that he can fulfill his dreams. He also dreams of owning his home. As well, he dreams of continuing to support his daughters in their education so that in the future they will become professionals who help with community development. He says it is never too late to study; consequently he wants to continue his university studies. He wants to have a more decent home that provides a more stable life for his family.

loans.use: to establish a business selling propane gas.

loans.name: Lotea

texts.en:
Lotea is 30 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, diapers, soap, etc.

Lotea has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns income from raising pigs.

Lotea aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, diapers, soap, etc

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is a housewife from a small town in Maynaguri in the Jalpaiguri district. She lives with her husband and one son in a kaccha (house made of stone and straw). Her husband is involved in farming and cultivates many kinds of vegetables to sell in the village market. They both have not completed secondary school, and their son is too small to go to school. 

Due to their low income, Jayanti is unable to manage the family expenses. Her husband is struggling hard all the day but fails to earn adequate income for the family. Therefore, Jayanti requested a loan from Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for the cultivation of good quality garlic in the same field. She is very much ambitious and hopeful about her business. She dreams of purchasing more farmland with her business profit in future. 

Jayanti is thankful to BJS and Kiva for making her self-sufficient.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivation of garlic.

loans.name: Melencia

texts.en:
Melencia previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were important for her children’s education and for their personal, household and business expenditures. Melencia also sells Vitaplus products.  She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy more Vitaplus products like multivitamins, coffee, lotion and other products. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. Melencia looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Melencia dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to have a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy Vitaplus products like multivitamins, coffee, lotion and other products that she can sell.

loans.name: Rolan Deyvyn

texts.es: Rolan es un joven de 25 años con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por lo que hace un tiempo inició un negocio propio, una salsamentaría, en la cual trabaja de miércoles a domingo, desde las 6pm hasta las 2 de la madrugada. Rolan sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y tener casa propia, para lo cual va a utilizar el crédito en la compra de surtido para su negocio (licor, cerveza, gaseosas, mecato) y así poder acreditarlo, con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos y darle una mejor vida a sus dos hijos, de 2 años y de 4 meses de edad.
texts.en:
Rolan is a young man who is 25 years of age and has tremendous drive to succeed. Some time ago he started his own business, a delicatessen, where he works Wednesday through Sunday from 6:00 P.M. to 2:00 A.M.

Rolan dreams of improving his family’s quality of life and having a house of his own. For this reason, he will use this loan to buy inventory for his business such as liquor, beer, sodas, and snacks. This will help his business gain recognition so that he can increase his earnings and provide a better life for his two children, ages 2 and 4 months.

loans.use: to buy liquor, beer, sodas, and snacks.

loans.name: Héctor Darío

texts.es: Héctor es un hombre casado, tiene dos hijos, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable, trabajó con su familia en  diferentes negocios donde adquirió experiencia en las ventas, desde hace tres meses inició con un granero para trabajarlo como independiente y  labora desde las 7:00 am a 10:00.  Héctor sueña con tener un supermercado a futuro, por lo pronto con el crédito solicitado  adquirir al por mayor una gran variedad de productos como (verduras, granos, frutas, hortalizas etc.) y poder brindarle a sus clientes artículos de excelente calidad. Sueño que se haría realidad al iniciar de lo poco a lo mucho y mejorando así su calidad de vida y el de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Héctor is married, has children, and is a very hard-working and responsible man.  He worked with his family in different businesses where he acquired experience in sales.  Three months ago he started a store in order to work independently, and he works from 7:00am to 10:00.  

Héctor dreams of having a supermarket in the future.  For the moment, he has asked for a loan to acquire a large variety of wholesale products like vegetables, grains, fruit, etc. and to be able to offer his customers articles of excellent quality.  His dream would become a reality by starting gradually and thus improving his quality of life and all of his family's.

loans.use: to acquire a large variety of wholesale items (like vegetables, grains, fruit, etc.)

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is a 31-year-old married woman with two children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. Lyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase equipment for her business.

Lyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her business

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba de 31 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora que junto a su marido ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella estudio  hasta 8° grado y tuvo que dejar de estudiar cuando salió embarazada de su primer hijo y no tuvo apoyo en ese momento.  Su pareja es motorista, se dedica a trasladar materiales de construcción y cultiva la tierra, en esta actividad le ayuda la señora; con ellos también vive la hermana menor de Alba. Sus dos hijos están estudiando. 


Alba realiza los oficios domésticos del hogar , además , le ayuda en las actividades agrícolas a su marido, ella realiza estas actividades desde muy pequeña, ya que acompañaba a su padre cuando él cultivaba maíz. La milpa la tienen a tres kilómetros de la casa, viajan a pie casi todos los días, como él marido trabaja como motorista, ella con su hijo mayor se encargan mayormente a el manejo del cultivo.


Utilizará una parte del préstamo, para comprar materiales de construcción, porque debe hacerle algunas reparaciones a su vivienda, ya que esta en mal estado y el resto para la compra de insumos agrícolas, ya que se acerca la época agrícola y es mejor comprarlos antes porque están a menor precio que ya en la época.


Su sueño es que sus hijos puedan prepararse, estudiando  y tengan oportunidades de trabajos menos pesados a los que a ella le ha tocado realizar.
texts.en:
Alba is 31 years old and a hardworking woman who, along with her husband has managed to get her children ahead.  She has an 8th grade education and had to quit school when she got pregnant with her first child.  She didn’t have any support at the time.  Her husband is a driver who transports building materials and cultivates soil.  She helps him with this.  Alba’s sister also lives with them.  The two children attend school.

Alba works in the home and helps her husband with the farming tasks.  She’s been doing this since she was very young and she helped her father raise corn.  The corn field is three kilometers from the house and they walk there almost every day.  Since her husband works as a driver, she and her oldest son manage the crops.

She will use part of this loan to buy building materials because she needs to make some home repairs because it’s in bad shape.  She will use the rest to buy farming supplies, now that the farming season is approaching and it’s better to buy them early because the prices are better.

Her dream is for her children to attend school and have better work opportunities then the ones she had.

loans.use: to buy building materials and farming supplies.

loans.name: Santos Enrique

texts.es:
Santos es un joven muy trabajador de 30 años de edad, solo logro estudiar hasta noveno grado por circunstancias economicas, actualmente vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de tan solo 4 meses de edad.
Santos tiene 10 años de experiencia en satreria oficio que aprendio de su madre y tambien se dedica a la albañileria cuando se le presenta algun trabajo este oficio lo aprendio de su padre.

con el prestamo se les estara ayudando, para que pueda comprar materiales como zipper, telas botones, hilo y tijera que utiliza en la confeccion de pantalones y camisas.
Su gran sueño es abrir un taller de sastreria y de los ingresos poder construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Santos is a hardworking 30 year young man.  He has a ninth grade education because of financial circumstances.  He currently lives with his wife and four month old son.

Santos has 10 years’ experience as a tailor and he learned this from his mother.  He also works as a mason when there is a work opportunity.  He learned this from his father.

He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as zippers, fabric, buttons, thread, and scissors to make pants and shirts.

His greatest dream is to open a tailor shop and build a house with the income.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Camilo Andrés

texts.es: Camilo, es soltero y tiene una discapacidad parcial, pero es de mucho ánimo y mucho carisma,  trabajaba en una empresa familiar y por su dificultad física para movilizarse le terminaron el contrato, y no logró volver a emplearse en otro lugar, Camilo  es una persona con sueños y muy emprendedor,  montó su propio negocio de stickers y extintores. Actualmente tiene ciertas necesidades económicas y por ello solicita el crédito con la  Corporación, inicialmente cancelar el saldo de dos créditos vigentes con otras entidades y con el restante comprar mercancía (como sticker y extintores). De esta manera obtendrá una tranquilidad en su labor tanto como persona,  como económicamente para seguir adelante con su negocio de venta de extintores.
texts.en: Camilo is single and has a partial disability but a lot of enthusiasm and charisma.  He worked in a family business but was terminated because he had difficulty moving around and he was not able to find another job.  Camilo is a very enterprising person with dreams.  He set up his own slickers and extinguisher business.  He has certain financial needs and is asking for this loan to pay off a group of other loans and also buy some sticker and extinguisher equipment.  In this way he will have some peace in his work and can get ahead in his business.

loans.use: to pay off loans and buy equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Claudia Mercedes

texts.es: Claudia una mujer emprendedora y muy responsable, tiene en su vivienda unas confecciones a terceros desde hace muchos años, ella sueña con ampliar su negocio y prestar un mejor servicio, también con el crédito que solicita Claudia necesita comprar insumos para las confecciones (telas, hilos, cierres, accesorios para las máquinas, etc) y con este stock podrá trabajar y cumplir con sus pedidos, además está la posibilidad de generar empleos para que su taller crezca y siga teniendo mucha acogida en el gremio de los microempresarios textileros. Claudia ha sacado su familia adelante con este trabajo y esto le representaría mas ganancias y mejoramiento en la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Claudia is an enterprising and very responsible woman.  She has had a workshop in her home, where she makes things for other people, for many years.  She wants to expand her business and provide better service.  She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies (fabric, thread, zippers, sewing machine accessories, etc.) so she can fill her orders.  She also has the chance to win jobs so she can grow her business and be successful as a small textile company.  Claudia has gotten her family ahead through this work and she has greater earnings and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en: Bernadeth is married with 6 children. She  is 42 years old and lives in Buenavista, Tudela, Philippines. Bernadeth is a farmer and grows flowers to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to buy additional fertilizers. Bernadeth has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, she hopes to start up other business.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers

loans.name: Kembang Kertas Group

texts.en:
With the current loan, Ni Nengah purchased piglets and during the loan period, the piglets grew healthy and fat. When the payment time came, she sold all of her pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. She was really happy with her results, because during the period, her piglets grew well without disease. Thus, she was able to sell them at a high price. The profit covered her daily needs, her children's school fees, and most importantly it provided capital for her business. She is very grateful to MUK, KIVA, and lenders for supporting her business. She said she will always need assistance from the loan officer of MUK for advice and other business solutions.

Ni Nengah wants to increase her business by keeping local pigs for a pig roast. She needs a new loan to purchase three local pigs and feed. She usually only keeps the pigs for the barbeque for two or three months and then she sells them. Her husband supports her business by helping her feed the pigs and clean the barn. Ni Nengah saves her profit, because she dreams to renovate her kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase three local pigs and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy new fashion clothing for her shop

loans.name: Lizel

texts.en:
Lizel previously used a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase chicken and fish for her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to pay for more chicken and fish for her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lizel dreams of becoming successful in her business and hopes to have a happy family. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: pay for more chicken and fish needed for her business

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
Adelita is 50 years old and single with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Adelita's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines November 8, 2013. Adelita is taking out a bridge loan to restart her vegetable vending business.

She has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart her vegetable vending business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to re-sell such as vegetables. 

Adelita is committed to rebuilding, and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy additional stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is 22 years old and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Angelica and her family survived the super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines November 8, 2013, but her business was wiped out. 

Angelica is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store, Angelica has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Angelica has been rebuilding for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

With your help, Angelica is committed to rebuilding her business. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Eufrocina

texts.en:
Eufrocina previously utilized a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more vegetables. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a variety store for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to purchase more vegetables for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eufrocina hopes to be successful in her business and dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more vegetables needed for her business.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is married with 5 children. Nila is 62 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.
Nila sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 40,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.
Nila has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.  In the future, Nila hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 34 years old and lives in Buenavista, Tudela, Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
To earn a living, Josefina has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about PHP 6000 each month doing this type of work. Josefina has requested a loan to buy additional ingredients for her snack vending business.
Josefina has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, Josefina would like to put up other profitable businesses.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is married with 6 children. Marcelina is 70 years old and lives in Maikay, Tudela, Philippines.
Marcelina is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy 1 sack of fertilizer for her gardening business.
Marcelina has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, Marcelina hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of fertilizer for her gardening business

loans.name: Canaan Group

texts.en:
Levish, with her hand raised, is the featured borrower of Canaan SHG. She lives in Bishnupur, which is 25 km from the main capital city of Imphal, Manipur in the northeastern region of India. She is a mother of two sons. One of her sons is a schoolteacher in the village and the other one is an auto driver. Her husband was in the military but he took a voluntary retirement due to his poor health. 

Levish’s main source of income is a fishery pond near her house. Every morning and evening, she goes to the pond, catches fish and sells it in the nearby market. With the WSDS loan, she wants to expand and put more varieties of fish in the pond. Apart from this, she wants to buy new fishing equipment such as landing net and a rod and reel. Since the household income is not sufficient to run the family, Levish wants to concentrate fully on her fish-selling business because fish is considered as a staple food in Manipur and the demand is very high throughout the year. There’s a high chance of generating a good income. She thanks WSDS for being so considerate towards her and the group. The rest of the group members are engaged in chive cultivation.

loans.use: To buy more varieties of fish and fishing equipment such as landing net, fishing rod and reels

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Remedios is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Remedios has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Sonia has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Sonia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 53 years old, married and has two children. 

She is in the agricultural business doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Tita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Tita has been pig fattening for 30 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Esther Shg Group

texts.en:
The self-help group “Esther Shg” is made up of 10 women who fight each day to improve their families’ financial stability. They are friendly, kind people who still maintain the culture and traditions of their village. These women live in a small village in Bishnupur, which is 25 km from the city of Imphal, in the northeastern region of India. Rongneishem, the lady in the picture standing with her hand raised, is the featured borrower of this group called Esther. She is 40 years old and has two children.
 
Rongneishem’s husband works as a cultivator. This member learned to work in the fields from her parents at a young age. It is now her way of life. Agriculture provides her income. Rongneishem is taking this loan because she wants to keep investing in her business. The profit she earns is a great help in meeting her family’s expenses.

With the WSDS loan, she wants to expand her farm and buy more chive seeds and fertilizer to earn more income. In addition, she wants to help her child have a decent career. Like her, the rest of the group members are doing chive farming.

loans.use: To buy more chives seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child, in their personal house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her rug-making business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and child’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosa dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she finds strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her rug-making business.

loans.name: Atenidora

texts.en: Atenidora is 58 years old, married, and has 3 adult-aged children.  She lives in Northern Poblacion, Calamba.  She has been engaged in her business for 5 years earning a monthly income of 3,000 PHP.  She applied for a loan to re-stock her sari-sari store with basic commodities.  She uses her profits to cover her family's daily needs and her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her loan helped not just in her business, but also in the education of her children. Income from her business helps cover her household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her business profits will help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses.
