She looks forward to this financial support with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilyn hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. At these meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 12 kilograms of wood to make chairs and tables.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gloria is 55 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

Gloria has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Meet Denis, a farmer living in the rich highlands of Kericho. He has been practicing agriculture for four years and his primary source of income is milk, eggs, crops, and transportation services. In farming, he enjoys dairy farming the most, while his biggest challenge is that milk prices are not constant.

Denis chose Juhudi Kilimo for this dairy loan because their interest rates are low and the repayment mode is easy and achievable. He learnt how to develop a culture of saving. This loan will bring an increase in assets that will bring income through more milk. This will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 33 years old and has four children. She is married and her four children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of farming flowers in the Philippines. Ruth requested a 11,000 PHP (Philippines Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase additional fertilizers.

Ruth has been farming flowers for four years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 44 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase stock to sell, like soap, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

Mary Ann has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fishing.

Mary Ann aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell, like soap, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Nieve

texts.es: Blanca es casada, vive en una zona rural del Departamento, en vista de las crisis que ha tenido con el cultivo de café, Blanca y su familia optaron por trabajar la hoja de viao, con la cual hasta el momento le ha ido bien, Sueña con tener una mayor extensión de sembrado porque la demanda de la hoja es mucha y a veces no la pueden suplir por falta de insumos para la siembra, con el crédito ella invertirá en comprar productos para la adecuación de la siembra y abono de la hoja de viao y de esta forma ofrecer a sus clientes en el momento que les soliciten su producto, Blanca con ello mejora su económia y su bienestar familiar en general.
texts.en: Blanca is married. She lives in a rural area. In view of the crises that she has had with her coffee crops, Blanca and her family decided to grow “viao” leaves (leaves for making tamales), which has been going well so far. She dreams of extending her crop area because the demand for the leaves is high and sometimes she cannot supply them due to the lack of planting supplies. With the loan, she will invest in purchasing products for modifying the cultivated land and compost for the “viao” leaves so she can offer her clients her product when they ask for it. This will enable Blanca to improve her finances and the wellbeing of her family in general.

loans.use: to buy products for modifying her cultivated land and compost for her tamale leaves

loans.name: Ma. Clarita

texts.en:
Ma. Clarita is 39 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Ma. Clarita has borrowed and paid 29 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from van rental. Ma. Clarita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Carmel

texts.en: Carmel is 21 years old and has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Carmel has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Carmel requested a 5,000 PHP bridge loan through NWTF to buy products to sell including soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc. to restart her general store business activities. Carmel has been in this business for one year and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Carmel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy products to sell including soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing net and other materials for her fishing business.

Rachel has been in this business for five years. Rachel earns more income from her motorcycle transport business.

Rachel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and other materials

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen works hard to support her family. Karen has a general store business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. To restart her general store business, Karen requested a 7,000 PHP bridge loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell. Karen has been in this business for five years now. With your help, Karen will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Karen would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Lizza

texts.en: Lizza is 34 years old, married and has six children. Five of her children are in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business was wiped out. Lizza is taking out a bridge loan to restart her business. Lizza requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy products to sell including coffee, soap, milk, etc. She has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it. With your help, Lizza is committed to rebuilding her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy products to sell including coffee, soap, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Dolores works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish vending. Dolores is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy material needed for her tailoring business.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy material needed for her business

loans.name: Sigaran Indah Group

texts.en:
Ni Made and all the members of Sigaran Indah group successfully paid off the loan although not on schedule. It’s because a big ceremony was held in their village and most of them attended there. They sold all the pigs. Although they did not have the higher price, they feel happy and satisfied with the result. They are grateful that the pigs were not attacked by diseases and they could sell them to pay off the loan. They all said thank you to lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting them. They used the profit to help the family income.

Ni Made successfully maintained her pigs and her husband supports her business because the result can help to improve the family income. She also succeeded in renovating the barn. Now she needs a new loan to purchase super quality feed to make the piglets grow faster and also to purchase two superior piglets for fattening. She also has a sow that will give birth soon. She hopes the piglets can grow fast and healthy so she can sell them to other breeders in her village.

Two of the members decided to resign after they succeeded in having enough profit from the last sales. They continue the business with their own money. They are really grateful and thankful for the support they had from lenders KIVA and MUK. They were replaced by two new members.

loans.use: to purchase super quality feed and two superior piglets for fattening

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lelanie works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Lelanie is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lelanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia is 59 years old, married and has ten children, one of whom is in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business was wiped out. Nelia is taking out a bridge loan to restart her agricultural business. Nelia requested a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs. Nelia has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it. With your help, Nelia is committed to rebuilding her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Lyllen

texts.en:
Lyllen is 38 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lyllen has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from a beauty salon.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: M. Hussain

texts.en:
M. Hussain is a milk seller by profession. He has been expanding his cattle herd through breeding. Now he has a few buffaloes, cows, sheep and goats. He has increased his milk production and sells scapegoats to butchers. He is famous in his hometown due to the quality and freshness of his milk. He preserves some milk for household use.

M. Hussain is 56 years old. He is a father to five children. Now he has grown old and weak as well. Most of the time he is sick and cannot perform his duties to produce and sell milk.  M. Hussain wants to give his obligations to his younger son so that he can continue the business. Before handing over the business, M. Hussain wants to do maintenance on his cowshed and complete the herd. For this reason, he wants to buy an additional buffalo. 

M. Hussain has requested a second loan with BRAC and KIVA for his dairy farm to buy a buffalo. With the profit, he will do maintenance on the cowshed. He is very happy about receiving this loan, because the new buffalo will expand the heard and reduce the shortage of milk. He thanks KIVA and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an additional buffalo for his dairy farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, jackets and bedding.

loans.name: Mekar Sandat Group

texts.en:
The Mekar Sandat Sari group succeeded in making their last repayments to MUK. The repayment is attended to by all members, but the boards are responsible for the process. Ni Komang, as the head of the group, is fully responsible for the group. Ni Komang is a housewife and raises pigs to support her economic life. At the last loan, she maintained two pigs. Ni Komang is really grateful because the pigs can grow well and healthy. She sold the pigs at a price of 3.6 million IDR. After deducting all the costs, she earned a profit of about 2.5 million IDR. She used the profits to develop her business, for saving and daily life. She said thanks to all the lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her business. 

Having succeeded in the previous period, the Mekar Sandat group proceeds to the next loan. Based on the assessment of MUK, they still receive the same loan size - currently 15,000,000 IDR for group lending, and 1 million IDR to 1.3 million IDR for each individual person. Because most have been able to increase their numbers of pig populations, the current loan will be used to buy food and fix the cages. Ni Komang will use this loan to buy super-quality feed and build new cages. She is very pleased with the effort that can be developed. She hopes to become a big pig seller in her village and for all the profits to improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy super-quality feed and build new cages.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina works hard to support her family. Paulina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. To restart her business, Paulina requested a 7,000 PHP bridge loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell including soap, noodles, canned goods, etc. Paulina has been in this business for five years now. With your help, Paulina will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell including soap, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Luslivilla

texts.en: Luslivilla is 51 years old, married and has three children. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Luslivilla requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Luslivilla has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Luslivilla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mary Alice

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Mary Alice works hard to support her family. She has a boarding house rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income as a Jeepney operator. Mary Alice is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional wood, bamboo, paints, etc. for her boarding house rental business. Mary Alice has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood, bamboo, paints, etc. for her boarding house rental business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, 39, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jose, a worker, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elvira operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Elvira hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cornellius

texts.en:
Meet Cornellius who lives and does farming in the rich highlands of the Kericho area of South Rift Kenya. He is married and has one child. He has been doing farming for three years where his income source comes from milk, eggs, tea and transportation services. In farming, he enjoys dairy farming the most, but his biggest challenge is that animal feed is very expensive.

Cornellius chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they finance agricultural assets. During the training, he learnt how to develop a savings culture, and how to develop consistency in repaying the loan. This loan will bring in more income to his family because of the addition of the dairy goats. This will improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice works hard to support her family. Alice is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now. Alice requested a 17,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy the additional materials she needs. In the future, Alice would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy the additional materials she needs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 34 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Gina has borrowed and paid back 6 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 6 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

She aspires to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Jeraldine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jeraldine works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jeraldine is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Jeraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Matet

texts.en:
Matet works hard to support her family. Matet is married and has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy additional fish to sell.

Matet has been in this business for three years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is 63 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Aniceta has been in this business for three years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Kipsang

texts.en:
Meet Kipsang, a farmer living in the highland area of Kericho with his wife and 1 child.

He loves farming and has been involved in it for 4 years, with his primary income being milk, eggs, tea and transportation services. In farming, he enjoys dairy farming the most, but the challenge he faces in dairy farming is that dairy feeds are quite expensive.

Kipsang chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of the easy mode of repayment and grace period that Juhudi gives to farmers, which allows them to prepare to repay. He learnt that if loans are repaid within a short period, the interest on the loan will be reduced. He said that this loan will increase milk output and so increase his profit, and he will be able to sustain his family well.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to maintain and grow his business and to buy supplies (grain, vegetables, cleaning products, dairy products, and other things).

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip lives in the very rich highlands of Kericho with his wife and one child where his primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and transportation services. Like many farmers in Kericho, he enjoys doing dairy farming and has been doing it for three years. His biggest challenges are market prices and storage facilities.

Philip chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loans is low and it is on a reducing balance basis. During the training session, he learned that  saving is a continuing process in many microfinance institutions. This loan will help him purchase a milk freezer for storing milk and thus increase his family's income and give them better living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a milk freezer.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois dont fait parti ce groupe de 2 femmes, a été crée le 3 novembre 2009. il est composé de membres très solidaires, la plupart pratique le commerce.
Khady sur la photo est en position debout et a levé la main. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 4 garçons. Elle s'active dans l'embouche bovine et ovine, une activité qu'elle pratique depuis son adhésion dans le banc villageois. 
Avec le prêt elle envisage d'acheter un bœuf à 200000f et 2 moutons à 30000f chacun. Elle va aussi acheter de l'aliment de bétail pour engraisser les sujets afin de les vendre au bout de 4 mois.
Les bénéfices lui permettront de renforcer son épargne et aussi d’assister ses enfants dans leurs besoins.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' was established on 3 November 2009, and the two women in the group are part of this organisation.  All the members are mutually supportive, and most of them are traders.

Khady (seen in the photo with her hand raised) is 46 years old, married and has six children, four of whom are boys.  She raises cows and sheep, and has done this since she started working with the field partner.

Khady will use her loan to buy a cow for 200,000 francs CFA, and two sheep for 30,000 francs CFA each.  She will also buy animal feed to fatten up her livestock, which she will sell after four months.  She will use her earnings to increase her level of savings and also to help provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy 1 cow and 2 sheep, to fatten up for resale.

loans.name: Nerly Patricia

texts.es: Nerly tiene 32 años, vive en unión libre y tienen una familia numerosa de 10 hijos, desde hace muchos años viven en una finca en zona rural y trabajan en la cría y engorde de pollos, con el crédito solicitado Nerly comprará más pollos para engorde y también alimento en cantidad para los mismo, ya que la demanda en pedidos ha aumentado, también se deben hacer mejoras a las jaulas donde realizan estas tareas para engorde, esto conlleva mantener a los animales (pollos) con excelentes cuidados y deben comprar todo lo necesario para la vacunación de los pollos, y ofrecer de esta forma un producto que sea de confianza y de buen peso, lo que le da la oportunidad de ganar más dinero para el sostenimiento de su familia mejorando su nivel y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nerly is 32 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and has a large family of 10 children. For many years they have lived on a farm in a rural area, and work raising and fattening chickens. With the loan requested, Nerly will buy more chickens to fatten, as well as enough feed for them, since her orders have increased. There are also improvements that should be made to the cages where she carries out the tasks to fatten the chickens, which goes along with maintaining the animals (chickens) by giving them excellent care. They should also buy everything needed to vaccinate the chickens, and in this way, offer a product that is trustworthy and of good weight. This will create the opportunity to make more money to support her family, improving their quality of life and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise and fatten, vaccines, and to make improvements to the henhouses

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 7 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 4 juin 2011. Ce banc regroupe des membres qui habitent dans le même village et ceux des environs. Une entente règne dans le groupe.Leur activité principale reste le commerce de détails. 
Fatou debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants et a en charge 2 autres. Avec le prêt elle va acheter du mil, le kg à 150f pour le vendre au moment opportun à 225f. Elle va aussi acheter un mouton à 75000f, elle assurer son engraissement pendant 5 mois pour le revendre à 150 000f, pour cela elle va acheter de l'aliment de bétail.
Les bénéfices lui permettront d'assurer les besoins de la famille et de renforcer son épargne au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group of seven women are part of the 'banc villageois' which was created on 4 June 2011.  The women all live in the same village or surrounding villages.  The women work very well together, their main business is retail sales.

Fatou (standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised) is 50 years old.  She is married, mother to three children and is responsible for two further children.  She will use her loan to buy millet for 150 francs CFA a kilo.  She then hopes to be able to sell it for 225 francs CFA a kilo.  She will also buy a sheep for 75,000 francs CFA and animal feed.  She will fatten the sheep for five months and then resell it for 150,000 francs CFA.

Fatou will use her earnings to provide for the needs of her family and increase her savings at the 'banc villageois'.

loans.use: to buy 1 sheep and some millet.

loans.name: Abone's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 2 membres fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 03 novembre 2009. Ce banc regroupe des membres qui habitent dans le même village et ceux des environs.les membres vivent dans la bonne entente et sont solidaires entre elles. Leur principale activité c'est l'embouche.
Abone debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 66 ans. Elle est veuve et mère 3 garçons. Elle fait comme activité principale l'embouche. Elle mène cette activité depuis longtemps, elle en a une bonne expérience.Elle gère cette activité avec le soutien de ses enfants. 
Avec le prêt elle va acheter un bœuf à 200000f, elle va aussi acheter de la nourriture pour le bétail et assure aussi les frais vétérinaires. Avec le reste de l'argent elle achète un mouton. 
Les bénéfices lui servent à assurer le quotidien de ses enfants, elle est seule à prendre en charge la famille.
texts.en:
This group has two members and is part of the Banc Villageois that was established on November 3, 2009. The Banc regroups members living in the same village and the ones surrounding it.

The members live in good harmony and stand by one another. Their main business is raising livestock.

Abone is the woman raising her hand on the right in the photograph. She's 66 years old, a widow, and the mother of three boys. Her main business is raising livestock.

She's been running this business for a long time, and has a lot of experience. She handles this business with her children's support.

With her loan, she will buy an ox for XOF 200'000 (ca US$ 420). She will also buy cattle feed and cover veterinary expenses. With the remaining money, she will buy a sheep.

Her profits will be used to provide for her children's daily necessities. She's the only one covering the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy one ox, one sheep, and animal feed

loans.name: Savirna Del Carmen

texts.es: Savirna tiene 39 años y está en unión libre, vive en una finca zona rural, se dedica desde hace muchos años a trabajar en la cría y engorde de cerdos los cuales mata y los porciona para venderlos por kilos, esto le demanda mucho trabajo pero a la vez es una tarea que desempeña con mucho gusto, Savirna solicita el crédito porque su anhelo es aumentar el número de cerdos y de esta forma también las ventas, necesita comprar insumos para la cría de los cerdos (vacunas, cuidos, y otros alimentos), representándole mayor y mejor distribución en el gremio.  Resultado que espera para que sus ingresos sean excelentes y todos queden satisfechos con el producto final ofrecido.
texts.en:
Savirna is 39 years old and has a partner. She lives in a farm in a rural area and for many years has earned a living breeding and raising pigs, which she slaughters and butchers to sell by the kilo. This is a demanding job but at the same time it is a job which she really enjoys.

Savirna is asking for the loan as she wants to increase the number of pigs and consequently also increase her sales. She needs to buy supplies for raising the pigs (vaccines and feed), giving her a bigger and better presence in the trade. This is what she hopes for so that she will have an excellent income and everyone will be happy with the product she offers.

loans.use: to buy suckling pigs and supplies for raising the pigs (vaccines and feed).

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the materials needed for making rugs. She also used her loan in her other business. Her income is assisting her everyday household expenditures. She continues to work to provide for her family. She also sells dried fish and ice crumbles for additional income.
 
Magdalena would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials such as fabric, needles and thread for her business. She will also use the loan in buying dried fish and ice crumble ingredients. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Magdalena hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her children will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials such as fabric, needles and thread for her business.

loans.name: Lina Maria

texts.es:
La joven Lina Maria es un persona la cual no tiene los suficientes recursos para tener una educación adecuada, a ella le gustaría tener una profesión y con eso ayudar a futuro a la mama que la ha ayudado en el estudio con mucho esfuerzo, le interesa estudiar auxiliar de enfermería.
Esta interesada en el convenio kiva para tener un mejor medio de pago porque la situación económica de la mama no es la mejor, por que es la única que esta ayudando para salir adelante en el futuro, es por eso que necesita el convenio de kiva.
texts.en:
Lina Maria is a young woman who does not have enough income to have a good education. She would like to have a profession so that in the future she can help her mum who has put a lot of effort into helping her with her studies.

She would like to be a nursing assistant. She is interested in the Kiva agreement so she can have a better way of paying for her studies, as her mum's financial situation isn't the best. She is the only one who is helping her to make progress in the future, so this is why she needs the Kiva agreement.

loans.use: to pay for a term's tuition.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling sweet potatoes in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her sweet potatoes business.

Amalia has been in this business for four years. Amalia earns additional income from raising livestock.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is married with three children. Her spouse is a farmer. To augment her spouse's income, she patiently raises hogs to sell and vends fruits and vegetables, too. This way, she earns PH 300 a day, which provides daily allowances for her children at school. 

Elma wants to keep growing healthy hogs, so she is asking for PHP 10,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs' sustenance. It will help them grow and this could enable her to offer them at a higher price someday. The other part of her loan will be used to buy more vegetables to sell.  

She hopes to become a successful entrepreneur in her village.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs' sustenance.

loans.name: Nelly Mercedes

texts.es:
Nelly de 59 años de edad, soltera  sin hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del  país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En su juventud lamentablemente no pudo terminar sus estudios, por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad sigue luchan día a día para poder sobrevivir de su negocio.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general como pantalones, faldas, vestidos, blusas, ropa interior, sandalias, perfumes, body, cosméticos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas  10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Nelly agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Nelly is 59 years old. She is single and has no children under her responsibility. She is from Leon, which is located in the western part of the country. People there are characterized as being hardworking, responsible, and eager to get ahead. Unfortunately, in her youth, she was unable to finish her education due to a lack of resources. Right now, she keeps fighting day to day to be able to survive in her business. 

Thanks to her hard work and her eagerness to get ahead, she has as an economic activity selling general merchandise such as pants, skirts, dresses, blouses, underwear, sandals, perfume, body lotion and cosmetics. She spends about 10 hours a day on her business offering her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business and sell merchandise, so that in the not so distant future she can obtain better income. Nelly is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer people of low income and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business by buying and selling pants, skirts, dresses, blouses, underwear, sandals, perfumes, body lotion and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a farmer in the very rich and productive highlands of Kericho, where she lives with her husband and 4 children. 

She has been farming for 30 years, and her income comes from the sale of milk, eggs, tea and crops. In farming, she enjoys horticultural farming, but her biggest challenge is the lack of sufficient labor.

Rachael chose Juhudi Kilimo because they are interested in the growth of small scale farmers, and she wants to increase her income through farming. This loan will be used to construct a greenhouse where she will plant more crops which will lead to more income. This will improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 21-year-old single man, living with his family in Taiz, Yemen. 

He has a diploma in mobile phone maintenance. He didn’t wait for the government to employ him because he knows that there are thousands of graduates waiting their chance to get a job. Therefore he decided to begin his own business. One year and a half ago he opened a small store selling mobile telephones and other electronic appliances, and repairing them. Now he wants to decorate his store to make it look better and attract more clients, so Naser needs to purchase decor materials. 

Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money. For this reason he has decided to apply for a Youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase these materials and to expand his store. He is looking forward to improving his business by opening a retail and wholesale store.

Naser hopes that his business keeps on developing to make sure that he can provide his family with the necessary living expenses and the best education to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase decorating materials and to expand his shop

loans.name: Benito Jacinto

texts.es:
Benito de 36 años de edad, padres solteros con tres hijos menores de edad, es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañía de sus hijos.  Lamentablemente  por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar  desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos de hogar. En la actualidad lucha para brindarle   a sus hijos un futuro mejor, y formarlos en personas profesionales y que lleguen a tener mejores condiciones de vida.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  el servicio de carpintería, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de  habitación, el negocio consiste en la elaboración de muebles como: juegos de sillas, sillones de madera, ropero, camas, cómodas, jugueteras, comedor. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias la elaboración de muebles. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y compra madera que se la ofrece a buen precio para fabricar muebles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Benito agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Benito is 36 years old and is a single father with three young children. He is originally from Leon, which is located in the western part of the country. He is a hard-working and responsible person with a desire to improve his situation in life. In his free time he likes to spend time with his children. Unfortunately due to lack of money he was not able to study for a degree and he found it necessary to start work from a young age to help with the household expenses. 

Now he is working hard to provide a better future for his children and train them to become professionals so they can have better living conditions. Thanks to his hard work and his desire to get on in life, he runs a carpentry business. His business is based in his home and he makes furniture such as sets of chairs, wooden armchairs, wardrobes, beds, chests of drawers, shelving and dining furniture. He spends around 10 hours a day in his business making the furniture. 

The purpose of the loan is to have working capital to buy wood which is available at a good price for making furniture, so that in the not-too-distant future he can have a better income. Benito is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people of limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can have a decent means of making a living.

loans.use: to have working capital to stock the business by buying wood for making furniture such as chairs, beds, dining furniture, shelving, wardrobes and wooden armchairs.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a married woman and a mother of seven children from Bien Unido, Bohol.  She has been engaged in the fishing business for more than 20 years now.  Her husband works as a fisherman.  This is the source of their income.

Bernadette is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks.  With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Bernadette hopes of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy five cartons of Bata shoes, five bales of jean trousers and ten lessos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of baby clothes

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Imelda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Imelda is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a 65 year old widow with five children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy stocks to sell like canned goods, chips, egg, soap, etc.  Letecia has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell like canned goods, chips, egg, soap, etc

loans.name: Francisca Marlene

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca de 67 años de edad, madres solteras con un nieto bajo su responsabilidad, es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal.  Desde su juventud ha tenido que trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha para proporcionarle a su nieto de crianza un futuro mejor.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva como: pantalones, short, faldas, vestidos, toallas, ropa interior, ropa de cama. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto de forma ambulante  y por encargo, la rutina de trabajo de Francisca es correré su comunidad con un bulto de unos 20 kg ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Francisca agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es  Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
67-year-old Francisca is a single mother with a grandson under her care and originally comes from Leon, which is in the western part of the country. She is hard-working and responsible, with a desire to improve her situation in life. Since she was young she has had to work to help out with the household costs. Now she is working hard to give the grandson she looks after a better future. 

Thanks to her hard work and her desire to get on in life she has a business selling new clothing such as trousers, shorts, skirts, dresses, towels, underwear and nightwear. She spends 10 hours a day working in her business, selling her items as a street vendor and to order. Francisca usually goes around her community with a 20kg bundle of items for sale.

The purpose of the loan is to have working capital to stock her business, so that in the not-too-distant future she can earn more income. Francisca is grateful for the help which the Kiva lenders give to people of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a decent means of earning a living.

loans.use: to have working capital to stock her business with merchandise such as trousers, shorts, skirts, dresses, towels, underwear and nightwear

loans.name: Ronald Francisco

texts.es:
Ronald de 36 años de edad, casado con tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales están estudiando. Es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en l zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar mercadotecnia.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de comida corriente en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias, ofreciendo su comida casera como pollo con papas, pollo empanizado, frito, canelones, arroz relleno, carne rojas, pescado, maduros, tostones, frijoles, manuelitas, sopas. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para la preparación de la comida como: carne, pollo, plátanos, repollos, arroz, frijoles, maduros, yuca, tomates, aceite, mantequilla, chiltomas, etc.para que en futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Ronald agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ronald is 36 years old and is married with three young children who are at school. He is originally from Leon, which is located in the western area of the country. The people are typically hard-working and responsible with a desire to improve their situation in life. Unfortunately, due to lack of money, he was not able to study for a degree but he would like to have studied marketing.

Thanks to his hard work and his desire to get on in life, Ronald has a business selling staple dishes from his home. He works in his business for 12 hours a day, offering his home-made food such as chicken with potatoes, breaded chicken, fried food, cannelloni, stuffed rice balls, red meat, fish, plantains, fried sliced green banana, rolled pancakes and soups.

The purpose of the loan is to have working capital to stock the business with ingredients for the preparation of his food such as meat, chicken, bananas, cabbage, rice, beans, plantains, cassava, tomatoes, oil, butter, bell peppers etc so that in the not-too-distant future he can increase his income. 

Ronald is grateful for the support which the Kiva lenders give to people of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a decent means of earning a living.

loans.use: to have working capital to stock his business selling food products such as chicken and potatoes.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her business.

Mercy has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from fish-vending and raising pigs.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soaps and spices for her grocery store

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional merchandise to sell for her business.

Merlinda has been in this business for 14 years. She earns additional income from hog-raising.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to sell in her business

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Remedios works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs and rice-retailing. Remedios is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 56 years old and is married with ten children, two of whom are in school. Veronica works very hard to provide for them.

Veronica runs a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of dry goods to sell.

Veronica has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Vevencia has been in this business for 8 years. Vevencia earns additional income from peanut-processing and raising pigs.

Vevencia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Salvacion dreams of being successful and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of four children from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. 

Elena is asking for a loan to buy animal feed and additional  piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to grow healthy pigs thus improving her hog raising business. In the future, Elena hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional  piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for more fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Bebita

texts.en:
Bebita works hard to support her family. Bebita is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 13 years.

Bebita has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.


In the future, Bebita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a musical entertainment business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her sound system for her musical entertainment business.  Salvacion has been in this business for 5 years. Salvacion also earns an additional income from food vending.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her sound system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, rice, milk and soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wood to make a grandfather clock.

loans.name: Nubia Mercedes

texts.es:
Nubia de 26 años de edad, soltera con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera, y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  la venta de mercadería en general como: pantalones de jeasn, de vestir, faldas, blusas, short, vestidos, blusas, camisetas, ropa de cama, ropa de niños. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Nubia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Nubia is 26 years old and is a single mother with a young son. She is originally from Leon, which is located in the western area of the country. She is hard-working and responsible with a desire to improve her situation in life. In her free time she likes to spend time with her children. Unfortunately she was not able to study for a degree and found it necessary to work from a young age to help with the household expenses. 

Thanks to her hard work and her desire to get on in life she has a business selling general merchandise such as jeans, formal trousers, skirts, blouses, shorts, dresses, t-shirts, nightwear and children's clothing. She spends around 10 hours a day in her business, selling clothing. 

The purpose of the loan is to have working capital and stock her business buying and selling merchandise so that in the not-too-distant future she can earn more income.

Nubia is grateful for the help which Kiva lenders give to people of limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can have a decent means of earning a living.

loans.use: to have working capital to stock her business buying and selling products such as jeans, formal trousers, blouses, shorts, dresses, t-shirts, nightwear, children's clothing.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dionisio is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of seven children. Dionisio has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. He grows rice in his field.

Dionisio is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. With this, he will be able to improve his harvest, thus augmenting his yield and income.
 
In the future, Dionisio hopes to make his business a success and sustainable. He adds that he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: E.m Standard B Group

texts.en:
Rajeshwari says that “it is indeed a pleasure and opportunity for a mother to avail this loan.“ She is the featured borrower profile member for the group and belongs to E.M Standard B Group. She and her son are pictured with their hands raised.

Depending on meagre income is difficult when you have other basic necessities to take care of. Families have to be fed and clothed and while paying for basic needs, paying school fees on regular basis can be impossible. The headache for monthly fees is more when annual exams are to be held. Paying the monthly fees on a regular basis is difficult because at the beginning of the year, she usually gets money from money lenders on a high interest rate so that the kids don’t miss the session, which usually paralyses her while paying the monthly fees again.
 
With the KIva education loan, she can pay for her son's admission fees, sets of school uniforms, text books and stationery and tuition fees for a complete 12 months. She says, “Thank you so much, Kiva and WSDS.”  She says, "Now I don’t have to go to the school heads and seek permission to let my son sit for exams” and she can let her son continue his schooling without worrying for the whole year. 

She will repay the loan on time and also work together with her husband to generate better income for the family to supplement their needs.

The other group members also pay for admission fees, school uniforms, text books, stationery and tuition fees for the year. They all are thankful and grateful towards Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for the admission fees, text books, stationery and other necessary annual expenses for the academic year 2014.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Meet Sharon, a farmer living in the Eldoret area of North Rift Kenya with her husband and 3 children. She has been farming for 5 years, with her primary income sources being milk and crops. In farming, she loves feeding her livestock most, while her biggest challenge is acquiring the animal feed.

Sharon chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because it finances agricultural assets and she wants to purchase a dairy cow. During the training, she learned how to keep records and to develop a savings culture. She said that this loan will lead to improved cash flow and this will improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mayra Milena

texts.es:
Hola ella se llama Mayra Milena, nace en Bogotá el 03 de septiembre, ha vivido siempre acompañada de la gran familia, papas y hermanos. A los 5 años de vida empieza la escuela con mucho amor y con ganas de ser siempre la mejor termina los estudios básicos a los 16 años. Luego y con pocas posibilidades de seguir estudiando decide trabajar por lo cual antes de ser mayor de edad se le ve trabajando en almacenes de zapatos, de llamadas, supermercados,  entre otros. Al cumplir la mayoría de edad el primer trabajo formal es en una tienda  importante de  marca de ropa, al año de trabajar consigue un trabajo mejor como auditora, pues había hecho algunos cursos de ingles en el Sena y ya empezaba a estudia Ing. De Sistemas, donde curso IV SEMESTRE logrando el titulo de Tec. De Sistemas. Luego de este trabajo  logra trabajar en una importadora de productos odontológicos en donde empieza como recepcionista y donde se le da la oportunidad de hacer carrera dentro de la compañía terminando como coordinadora de Servicio al cliente y Garantías trabajo en el que duro 4 años. La empresa le dio por el desempeño la posibilidad de que continuara con los estudios y se decide a estudiar Ing. Industrial, donde cursa I semestre, el cual aplaza pues afortunadamente Dios le mando el mejor regalo de todos un bebe. 
Hoy ella vive con el esposo y novio por más de 6 años y el hermoso hijo llamado SAMUEL CAMILO con dos años de edad, adicional trabaja hace un año como auxiliar administrativa, sigue con los mismos proyectos de vida y con metas aun más claras, pues el hijo y familia la impulsan a ser cada día mejor,  a dar siempre todo en cada actividad que hace. 
Admira del hijo la inocencia con que ve la vida, la dulzura con la que la vive pero sobre todo el inmenso amor y fuerza que le da para lograr y cumplir con cada uno de los proyectos.  Le gusta todo lo relacionado con la salud, mas las parte administrativa en la que se deja ver por la forma de trabajo y ayuda hacia los demás, le gusta ayudar a los pacientes a agilizar todos los procesos para recibir un buen servicio de salud. Actualmente como es auxiliar administrativa de un centro medico se ha visto mas motivada a seguir los estudios y continuar progresando.
Ella encesitaria del convenio con kiva ya que no cuenta con el total del dinero para poder pagar el valor de las cuotas mensuales, ya que los gastos del hijo y de la casa son un poco costosos, con el convenio el valor de las cuotas seria mas económico.
texts.en:
Hello! Her name is Mayra Milena. She was born in Bogotá, on the 3rd of September. She has always lived together with her large family, parents and siblings. When she was five, she started school with great expectations and the will to be the best. She finished her basic studies when she was sixteen. It was difficult for her to continue studying, so she decided to start working. Already as an underage, she started working at a shoe store, a call center, supermarkets and other places. When she became an adult, her first formal job was at an important clothes store. After a year, she got a job as an auditor, since she had taken some English courses with the National Education Institution (SENA) and had started to study Computer Engineering. She studied there for four semesters and received a diploma as a Computer Technician.

She changed job and started working for a company that imported dental products. She worked as a receptionist at the beginning, but the company gave her the opportunity to grow professionally, so she became the coordinator of the customer service and warranty department, where she worked for four years. Because of her good performance, the company helped her to continue with her studies, so she decided to study Industrial Engineering. She is in the first semester, but had to postpone her studies because she received the best present of all from God: a baby.

She is currently living with her husband, who was her boyfriend for more than six years, and her son Samuel Camilo, who is two years old. She has been working as an administrative assistant for a year. Her goals in life continue to be the same but are clearer now that she has a son and a family that encourage her to be better every day and give her best in each activity.

She admires from his son the innocence with which he sees life, how sweet he is, but most of all how much love and strength he gives her to achieve all of her goals. She likes everything related to the healthcare sector, but most of all working with administrative tasks, since she is more visible to others and can help them. She also enjoys helping patients to get a better and quicker service. Now that she has been working as an administrative assistant for this healthcare center, she has regained the motivation to continue with her studies and get ahead.

She needs the help from Kiva because she does not have what she needs to pay the university fees. The home expenses are high, but with this support she will be able to cover them more easily.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's fee at the university.

loans.name: Celzo

texts.en:
Celzo is a very patient and loving father of six who is married. 

Celzo has managed a store for eight years. According to him, his store is open from 5 in the morning to 10 in the evening to serve his customers. He loves what he is doing that's why he gained more clients. 

To have additional stock, he is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, spices and snack foods for his business.

Celzo hopes that his business expands to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, spices and snack foods for his business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
This is Amelita, a 45-year-old resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Renato, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Amelita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP8,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Amelita dreams to expand her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 51 years old and from Nyahururu. She is married to Francis, and they are blessed with four children, aged 25, 15, 9 and 7 years old.

She is a poultry farmer, a business she has been running for the last year. To enable her to buy poultry feed for her chickens so as to increase and improve production of eggs and meat, she has applied for her first loan of KES 35,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 15,000, and she intends to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children, pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya and to buy some goats for fattening and resale.

In the future, Jane hopes to buy a plot of land and construct some rental houses.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 58 years old, married and has six children. Five of her children are already married and the youngest is living with them. Her spouse is a farmer planting corn and tobacco. Anita also buy and sells vegetables for income. She has been doing it for over five years and still wants to improve her sales for the education of her child. 

Anita is asking for PHP6,000 to buy cabbages, eggplant, squash and beans to sell, providing her more vegetables to offer. She hopes to keep selling fresh vegetables at an affordable price. Anita also wants to save income for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, eggplant, squash and beans to sell

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 30-year-old widow, living with her three children at her brother-in-law’s home in Lahore, Pakistan.
  
She owns a small canteen in a school where she offers chips, spicy food items, stationery, etc. to the students. She wants to buy burgers and sandwiches as well but she does not currently have the funds to buy the raw materials. Razia requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a field partner of Kiva, so that she can buy spicy ingredients for making burgers. She belongs to a poor family; her brother-in-law does not fully financially support her because he is responsible for his own family as well. 

Razia seems very glad and thankful to Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy food items for her canteen

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a 46-year-old single mother of four children who are in school.

She has had a farming business in Ndunyu njeru for eight years and has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy a cow for rearing. With the anticipated profit, she plans to buy dairy cows for rearing and resale at a profit.

In the near future, Beth hopes to expand her farming business to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Melvin Antonio

texts.es:
Melvin de 23 años de edad,  es un joven luchador, ha logrado cursar hasta bachillerato, debido a que las condiciones lo obligaron a buscar un trabajo y dejar sus estudios por un lado, luego de eso Melvin decidió casarse, su esposa es muy trabajadora, ambos tienen que levantarse temprano para irse a trabajar y así poder obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Melvin ha desempeñado mucha clase de trabajos, algunos muy pesados, pero en este momento desempeña el trabajo de gondolero dentro de un supermercado, en este trabajo tiene 1 año y aunque tiene trabajar por la noche, ha sido para él una oportunidad para seguir adelante.


El crédito lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de una cocina ya que se le hace difícil comprar la comida todos los días, tomando en cuenta que trabaja media noche y se tienen que levantar temprano. Con este crédito se le estará ayudando a cubrir su necesidad, y así  podrá preparar su comida antes de irse al trabajo sin tener que afectar sus ingresos.

Melvin sueña con poder  tener una casa propia,  donde pueda vivir tranquilo junto a su familia, ya que por el momento está alquilando donde vive. Esto lo piensa lograr con mucho esfuerzo y con el apoyo de su esposa.
texts.en:
Melvin is 23 years old and is a striving young man who managed to complete high school, even though he had to leave school and look for work.  After that Melvin decided to marry.  His wife works hard and both of them have to get up early every day to go to work to earn an income to be able to cover the household expenses.

Melvin has done many jobs, some very tough but at the moment he works at a supermarket.  He’s been doing this for a year, even though he has to work at night it’s given him the opportunity to get ahead.

Melvin will use the money from this loan to buy a stove because it’s hard for him to buy food every day, considering that he works half the night and also gets up early.  This loan will help cover his needs and he will be able to prepare his food before going to work, without affecting his income.

Melvin dreams of having a home of his own where he can live peacefully with his family.  He rents his current home.  He wants to do this with great effort and help from his wife.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub is a 52-year-old man from Kakamega county. His wife is called Paustine and she is a housewife. They have three children together.

Ayub supplies newspapers as his business and has done this for the last 30 years, earning an average income of KES 20,000 per month. He is taking his eighth loan of KES 98,000 with VisionFund Kenya to use for buying a motorcycle. The profits will be used to repay the loan and make additional savings.

His dream is to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding chickens.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. 

Her husband is an auto rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last few years. For some time his auto rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the auto rickshaw. Therefore, Rubina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Rubina is so much thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair the auto rickshaw.

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años de edad, tiene un grado academico superior, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja de jornalero, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 7 años de edad y los dos se encuentran estudiando.

María se dedica a los oficios domésticos, trabaja en casa cuidando niños, además en su vivienda tiene cerdos el cual los engorda y luego los vende, esto lo aprendió de su madre pues ella la incentivó para que realiza estas actividades para obtener mayores ingresos.

El crédito lo necesita específicamente, para reparar el techo de su casa, ya que no sirve y se encuentra en muy malas condiciones, además se acerca el invierno y puede ser peligroso para su familia, por eso es urgente repararlo antes, y de esta manera su familia estará en un lugar seguro.

Sus objetivos a futuro son seguir mejorando su casa, puesto que hay otras cosas que reparar y espera lograrlo con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old. She has a higher education degree. She is in a relationship and her partner works as a day laborer. She has two children, 10 and 7 years of age, and both are students.

María dedicates herself to the household chores. She works at home caring for children. Also, in her home she keeps pigs, which she fattens and later sells. She learned this from her mother; she encouraged her to perform these activities to earn a higher income.

She needs the loan specifically to repair the roof of her house since it does not work and is in a bad condition. Furthermore, winter is coming and so it could be dangerous for her family. This is why it is urgent to repair it before and so her family will be in a safe place.

Her future objectives are to continue improving her home since there are other things to repair, and he hopes to be able to do so with the help of the loans.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is a 32-year-old woman; she is the mother of two children. 

Her husband owns a workshop in which he provides services to maintain bicycles; he is professional in his techniques and can easily fix the bicycles in no time. He has to use various types of tools for the repairs; a few days ago he shifted his workshop to another place, but in the process of moving, some important and expensive tools have disappeared.

Ayesha requested a loan for her husband so that her husband would be able to compensate against this loss. He will buy repair tools, spare parts, tires, brake shoes, etc., for his bicycle repair workshop. She wants to provide better education and living standards for her children. She is hopeful that her husband will utilize this amount in a positive way and his monthly income will increase. She thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy repair tools, spare parts, tires, brake shoes, etc., for her husband's bicycle repair workshop

loans.name: Janneth

texts.en:
Janneth is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from San Miguel, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store. She sells various goods to the people in her place.

 Janneth is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, sodas, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, cooking ingredients and others. With this loan, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock thus allowing her to attract and cater for more buyers in her store. In the future, Janneth has hopes of expanding her store and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, sodas, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, cooking ingredients and others

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is 44 years old, married and has eight children. Despite the large family, she manages to support them in their needs like food and education. Four are studying. To earn an income, she sells vegetables on a house-to-house basis while her husband plants and harvests corn to sell. 

Leonita hopes to sell more vegetables, and that is why she is asking for P3,000 to buy cabbages, beans and tomatoes to sell. This will help maintain good sales in her business.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, beans and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for extracting building stones

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit is married and has two children. She lives in Ayntap village. Near the house, Margarit and her husband run a small store where they sell different supplies such as food, home supplies, etc. Margarit does her best to run her store in a sustainable way.
