Her husband goes to a nearby country and bring new supplies to their store.

Margarit requested a loan, which she will use to purchase a new stock of supplies to sell in her store. She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, was not able to pay it back on time. By ensuring that her retail business is successful and being to provide monthly payments for this loan, Margarit has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to sell

loans.name: Asphod

texts.en:
Asphod is 32 years old and together with his wife, they are blessed with three children aged between 7 and 2 years old.

Asphod operates a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has been doing for three years, and he has now applied for a third loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy a dairy cow. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees and make some savings.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his farming business to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and propane gas for her business selling tortillas.

loans.name: Champion Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq membres du groupe Champion ont en moyenne 31 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (tomates, piments,  aubergines, choux), pommes de terre, produits cosmétiques, habits et du bois de chauffage. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Tenin (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (tomates,  piments,  aubergines, choux). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une corbeille de tomate, une corbeille de piment, 
 1 sac d’aubergine et 1 sac de choux à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Tenin compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The five members of the Champion Group are married and most of them live in monogamous households.  The women are, on average, 31 years old and have four children.  They live in Kanadjiguila, and know one another through business and neighbourhood ties.  The women sell their products at the market in Kanadjiguila.  They sell food ingredients (tomatoes, chillies, aubergines and cabbage), potatoes, cosmetic products, clothing and firewood.

In order to increase their working capital, the women have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, this will be their first group loan.

Tenin (sitting on the far right of the photo) is well-known for selling food ingredients (tomatoes, chillies, aubergines and cabbage).  She plans to use her loan to buy a basket of tomatoes, a basket of chillies, one sack of aubergines and one sack of cabbages from the market in Bamako.  She then resells her produce in Kanadjiguila, mostly to women.  

Tenin expects to earn a monthly average of 35,000 francs CFA, and will use this to reinvest in her business and provide for any small expenses in her household.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 60 year old, married gentleman from Kakamega County.  He and his wife are blessed with five children.  Charles sells timber as his business.  For the last four years he has earned an average income of KES 5,000 per month. He is taking his third loan of KES 20,000 with VisionFund Kenya to use to buy supplies in bulk. The profits will be used to repay the loan and do some saving.  His dream is to prosper.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Garantie Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Garantie est composé des femmes mariées vivant  avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de friperies, encens et boissons. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Maï (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente d’habits de la friperie. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une balle d’habits de la friperie à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Maï espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the Garantie Group are married women who live with their husbands and children in nuclear families.  They are, on average, 45 years old and have five children.  All the women live in Kanadjiguila and are friends, relations or live near one another.  The women sell second hand clothing, incense and drinks.

In order to increase their working capital, the group has decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, this will be their first group loan.

Maï (sitting on the far left of the photo) is well-known for selling second hand clothing.  She will buy a bale of clothing from Bamako with her loan.  She will then sell the clothing at the market or on foot, mostly to women.

Maï hopes to earn a monthly average of 30,000 francs CFA, and this will be reinvested into her business and used to provide for the smaller expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa owns and operates a transportation service to earn a living. She has been in her business for six years with the help of her husband and they earn enough to provide for the family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for buying tires and spare parts.

Elas gained access to micro finance services after joining GDMPC. The cooperative helps her to improve her ability to engage in business. Recently, she took a new loan to cover registration renewal and licenses. Aside from transportation services, she has had a cosmetic products buy-and-sell business in addition to her income. Her hope and dream is to have a better future.

loans.use: to cover registration renewal and licenses

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income assisted their everyday household expenditures. She works hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add into her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Editha dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to have a peaceful living. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages to resell in her store.

loans.name: María Deisy

texts.es:
María tiene 47 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado en la escuela, actualmente está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en Estados Unidos; pero suele venir a visitarla cada cierto tiempo, tiene 5 hijos, su hija mayor tiene dos hijos, otro hijo suyo trabaja en el campo y en obras de construcción y su otra hija trabaja como impulsadora de productos.

María es una mujer emprendedora que tiene un negocio de venta de panes, sale a vender por las tardes en la comunidad, también tiene contrato en la escuela del cantón para hacer la comida para los niños, además de esto, la señora María ha tenido siempre pollos que cría en el patio de su casa.

Ella necesita de este préstamo para comprar pollos y todos los insumos necesarios para criarlos, como lo es la comida, vitaminas, minerales, vacunas, etc.

Ella sueña con tener una granja de pollos en un futuro, para incrementar sus ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María is 47 years old and studied until the ninth grade. Right now she has a common law spouse, and he works in the United States but usually comes to visit every so often. She has five children, her older daughter has two children, her son works in the fields and construction, and her other daughter works as a product promoter. María is an enterprising woman who has a business selling bread, she sells it in the afternoons in the community. She also has a contract with the school in the rural community to make food for the children. In addition to this, María has always had chickens that she raises in the patio of her house. She needs this loan to buy chicken and all the supplies necessary to raise them like food, vitamins, minerals, vaccines etc. She dreams of having a chicken farm in the future to increase her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens, food, vitamins, minerals, and vaccines for the chickens.

loans.name: Claudia Del Rosario

texts.es: Claudia del Rosario, mayor de edad madre soltera de dos hijos independientes, originaria del municipio de chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora con muchos deseos de superación personal, la cual ha tenido que trabajar desde muy temprana edad por falta de recursos económicos ; Por lo tanto lucha día a día para obtener mas ingresos, Gracias a su espíritu de superación y sus ganas de salir adelante invierte en un pequeño negocio que es la venta de comida rápida como: tacos enchiladas, enfrijoladas, maduros con queso, refrescos naturales entre otros producto mas,sus compras las realiza en mercados y distribuidoras de la localidad, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes, uno de sus sueños es poder ver terminada su casa.el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo debido a que tiene demanda de sus clientes nuevos y quiere aprovechas las ventas,Claudia agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Claudia del Rosario, an older single mother of two independent children, is native to the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. She is characterized by being an enterprising woman with a great desire for self-improvement. 

She has had to work from a very young age due to a lack of economic resources. Because of this, she fights each day to earn a better income. Thanks to her spirit of self-improvement and her desire to come out ahead, she invests herself in a small business selling fast food such as: tacos, enchiladas, enfrijoladas (enchiladas with bean sauce), maduros con queso (plantains stuffed with cheese), and natural soft-drinks, among other products. She does her shopping in local markets and through local distributors. She begins her workday very early every day to provide better service to her customers. 

One of her dreams is to be able to finish her home. The objective of this loan is working capital due to demand from her new customers, and she wants to take advantage of the sales. Claudia is very thankful for the support that Kiva investors offer to people of low economic resources.

loans.use: to purchase primary material products for food production such as: tortillas, corn, rice, oil, fruit and vegetables, and cream, among others.

loans.name: Rosa Edith

texts.es: Rosa de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que ella comercializa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Rosa esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: pan, golosinas, granos básicos, refrescos, sopas, etc. y así poder surtir su tienda para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, 34, lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She has had a shop in her house for several years. She has many clients because of the variety of products she sells. Rosa and her husband manage to come out ahead with their household expenses from what she receives from her work and with her husband’s help. 

Rosa is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise such as bread, sweets, staple grain products, soft drinks, soups etc... This way she can stock her store to receive better earnings and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bread, sweets, staple grain products, soft drinks, soups etc...

loans.name: Maikol Jose

texts.es:
Maikol de 24 años de edad, soltero con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera, y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha, para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, y brindarle mejores oportunidades sus hijos  tanto económica como educativa.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta cerdos en pie. Actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación, ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diaria, ofreciendo los cerdos de crianza a clientes fijos y eventuales, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra de un lote de cerdos en pie. Maikol agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Maikol, 24, is single and has a young son. He is from Leon, located in the western part of the country. He is known for being hard working, responsible and with a drive to improve himself. Unfortunately, because of lack of economic resources he couldn’t go to school. He saw the need to work and help with household expenses. Now, he is fighting to provide better living conditions for his family and provide better financial and educational opportunities for his children.

Thanks to his efforts and his drive to get ahead, as a economic activity he sells pigs, an activity he does from his home. He works about eight hours per day selling breeding sows to regular and potential clients so that in the near future he can obtain better income. The aim of the loan is to invest it to purchase pigs. 

Maikol is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified way of earning a living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and supply his business in the purchase of pigs.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 75-year-old gentleman from Kakamega County and married to Flenda, who is also a businesswoman in the same town. They have nine children.

For the last 40 years, Lawrence has sold vegetables as his business, earning an average income of KES 10,000 per month. He is taking his third loan with VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 20,000,  to use to buy supplies in bulk. The profits will be used to repay the loan and create some savings.

Lawrence's dream is to prosper.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Calib

texts.en: Calib, a father of three, operates a retail business to make a living.  Aside from this, his wife earns from employment as a teacher. For many years in running the business, he has earned well to support the needs of the family, and has been able to sustain it.  He borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional imported used shoes to sell. He hopes to improve and expand the business, to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional imported used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Kpangmanga-Nyong Nayili Group

texts.en:
Shawana is married and is 40 years old with five children. She is a member of a shea nut processing association from Nyong-Nayili in the Northern Region of Ghana. The group is called Kpangmanga-Nyong Nayili Women's Association. Shawana has been doing this business with her 21 colleagues in the group for the past 4 years.

A new loan of 8,400 cedis will help Shawana and her colleagues to buy and store 140 bags of shea nuts for processing into shea butter. There are available off-taker organizations and individuals who buy the shea butter Shawana processes. She hopes to expand this business for the first time since she started it and thereby increase her income. With increased income, she will be able to repay the loan and also help her children to have better education and food to eat.

Shawana is the person holding the shea nut roaster in the group picture.

loans.use: To buy 140 bags of shea nuts for processing into premium shea butter

loans.name: Suglo Kongbo-Nyong Nayili Group

texts.en:
Abiba is a 48-year-old married woman living with her husband and 10 children in a community called Nyong-Nayili in northern Ghana. Abiba is the person placing a hand on the shea nuts in the group picture.

All the group members are women who are in the business of processing shea nuts into shea butter. They have been doing this business for the past 4 years. They really are processing high premium shea butter, some of which is sold to aggregators and exported to the European market. She sells the butter to many other customers in Tamale, the regional capital.The group is requesting a loan of 6,900 cedis to help them increase production from 50 bags to 115 bags of shea nuts. Abiba hopes to increase her income to support her family and repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy 115 bags of shea nuts for processing into shea butter

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is a 57-year-old, married woman. She has eight children with ages ranging from 10 years to 22 years. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy and strategic place, and her primary customers are reliable. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of charcoal. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a 63-year-old, pensioned woman from the village of Tskarostavi. She lives with her husband and sister. The family's significant source of income is from monthly assistance. They don't have any other activity, except having some chickens. 

Manana finds it hard to live with the financial difficulties and she has a great desire to generate income from agricultural activity. Most people get income from this activity in this area and Manana thinks it will be lucrative for her, too. 

With the requested money, she will purchase pigs, breed them, and after they grow, she will sell them at a good price. It will somehow improve the family's living conditions and Manana will more easily meet the daily costs. She will be grateful for the help, allowing her to do her own bit for the family's welfare. 

Manana awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Walter Jose

texts.es: Walter es un joven que labora en una institución del estado como obrero, su esposa es ama de  casa, tienen un hijo en edad escolar, ellos habitan en un pequeño cuarto que construyo Walter en casa de su mamá. Ha estado comprando materiales para ir construyendo su propia vivienda   en la actualidad le hace falta una parte para poder continuar con esta obra tan importante para el y su familia,  se ha demorado ya que los precios hoy en día están muy elevados. Requiere del crédito para comprar los materiales que le hace falta.
texts.en: Walter is a young man who works in a state institution as a labourer. His wife is a homemaker and they have a school-aged son. They live in a small room that Walter built in his mother’s house. He has been buying materials to build his own house. Now he is missing a part to be able to continue with this very important work for his family. It’s taking long because the prices now are very high. He is requesting a loan to purchase the materials he doesn’t have.

loans.use: to purchase iron, cement, sand, blocks and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les membres du groupe Djantoyerèla ont en moyenne 29 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Ouenzindougou et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié et de voisinage. La plupart des membres du groupe font la confection du savon. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sitan (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la fabrication et vente des savons. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter   en gros au marché une barrique de pâte d’acide, 50kg de potasse et 50kg de beurre de karité. Pour faire le savon, on malaxe la pâte d’acide avec la potasse et le beurre de karité; baratine ce mélange pendant plusieurs heures jusqu’à avoir une pâte consistante. On laisse cette pâte se coaguler fortement dans les moules conçues pour cette activité puis on les découpe en morceaux prêts à La vente au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Sitan espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The members of Djantoyerèla Group average 29 years of age and three children. Most of them are married in monogamous household. They all live in Ouenzindougou and got to know each other through bonds of kinship, friendship, and community.

Most of the members are making soap. In order to bolster their working capital, the members of the group decided to work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Sitan is the woman sitting on the right in the photograph. She's very renowned as a maker and seller of soaps. She intends to use her loan to buy raw materials wholesale at the market. She will buy one barrel of acid paste, 50 kg of potash, and 50 kg of shea butter.

To make soap, one has to mix the acid paste with the potash and shea butter and churn the mix for several hours, until the paste gets thick. The paste is left to get harder in molds designed for this purpose. Then it is cut into pieces ready to be sold.

The soaps are sold at the market and door-to-door, to a mixed-gender clientele. With this loan, Mrs. Sitan hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 105), to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make soap

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en: Annastacia is a 30-year-old, married woman. She has two children ages four years and six years. She operates a grocery store where she sells onions. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of onions to sell. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock and expand her business.

loans.use: buy more stocks of onions to sell.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en: Jeffrey is single and works for a private company for a living. Jeffrey was happy to say that his two years of employment has helped his parents a lot. He dreams of renovating his parents' house as his way to help them and to provide them with a comfortable living.  He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to cover the cost of the house renovation. In the future, he wants to earn more through work promotions in order to reach his dreams of having a better future.

loans.use: to cover the renovation cost of his parents' house

loans.name: Tebla

texts.en: Tebla is a 52 year old lady from Kakamega county. She is married to Richard who is also a businessman in the same town. They have two children, ages 28 and 24. Tebla operates a cafe, a business she has had for the last three years. She earns an average income of KES15,000 per month. This is her third loan of KES20,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy more equipment for her cafe. The profits will be used to repay the loan as well as add to her savings. Tebla's dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for her cafe.

loans.name: Genaline

texts.en:
This is Genaline, 42, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to David, an employee and they have children. She and her husband manage their household, while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Genaline operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for each item in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Genaline hopes to be a wholesaler and dreams to travel with her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fee

loans.name: Virny Anne

texts.en:
Virny Anne is a hardworking, 18-year-old lady. She is studying in a university taking up a BS in Biology. Virny Anne has four siblings and she is the third child. She is someone who is very dedicated to her studies and love of family. Her father works as a driver and her mother is a teacher.

She is requesting this loan to pay the school tuition fees. Her goal is to find a better career and encourage her siblings to continue studying, so that they both can become professionals and could earn better income for themselves.  In the future, she wants to become successful.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees.

loans.name: Doke Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Dokè est majoritairement composé de femmes  monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, fruits (bananes, oranges, mangues…), habits et du lait crémé. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente des fruits (bananes, oranges, mangues…). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 corbeille d’orange, 400kg  de banane, 5 baignoires de mangues à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail au marché à une clientèle mixte. Madame Fatoumata  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans son activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Dokè Group is made up of women who are predominantly monogamous. They average 30 years of age and two children. They all live in Lafiabougou, one of Bamako's neighborhoods, and got to know each other through community bonds.

The members of the group retail fruits (bananas, oranges, mangoes, etc), clothes, and skimmed milk. In order to increase their working capital, the members of the group decided to work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Fatoumata is the second woman from the right in the photograph. She's renowned as a fruit seller (bananas, oranges, mangoes, etc). She intends to use her loan to buy one basket of oranges, 400 kg of bananas, and 5 basins of mangoes in Bamako.

She resells retail at the market, to a mixed-gender clientele. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 105) to be reinvested in her business.

Her goal is to buy a plot of land to live on, thanks to this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy fruits (oranges, bananas, and mangoes)

loans.name: Vilma Isabel

texts.es: Vilma de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta y elaboración de carteras, bufandas, guantes,etc de hilo y lana, comercializa sus productos en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Vilma esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar hilos y lanas de colores por mayor para seguir elaborando dicho trabajo y poder obtener mejores ganancias ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener junto a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Vilma is 45 years old. She lives in her own house with her daughter. For the past number of years she has been making and selling wallets, scarves, gloves, etc. out of thread and wool. She sells her products in a market close to her house and manages to pay some of the household expenses with what she earns. Vilma is requesting a loan to be able to buy colored thread and wool wholesale to continue doing this work and be able to generate more income as this is her only source of work. She wants to enjoy a higher quality of living together with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy colored thread and wool wholesale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia previously requested a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Virginia is requesting another loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will help her to sustain her daily needs. 

Virginia hoes that her business will continue to flourish and that she will have a peaceful life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman and a mother of three children ages 22, 14 and 9. Marissa is engaged in a fishing business with her husband. This is the source of their income. 

Marissa is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing net and pay for the repair of their fishing boat. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Marissa has hopes of making their fishing business a success and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net and pay for the repair of their fishing boat

loans.name: Joseck

texts.en:
Joseck is a 70-year-old married man. He has seven children. He describes himself to be dedicated. He operates a posho (cornmeal) mill where he grinds maize to produce maize flour to sell. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Joseck describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient stock and capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better and improved life. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of Kes 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate and feed his family.

loans.use: buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta is from Tsaghkaber village, where she lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and little grandchildren.

Mareta is a farmer with 15 years of experience running a farm. Currently the farm includes cows, calves and arable land where wheat and barley are cultivated. Mareta's son is in construction. He also helps his mother with agriculture and the family is able to earn their living.

Now, by applying for this loan, Mareta would like to purchase seeds for land cultivation. As the new cultivation season has started, Mareta will be very thankful to lenders if they support her so she can purchase seeds and start their cultivation activities. Mareta hopes to have a good harvest, ensuring stable repayments of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for land cultivation

loans.name: Sele Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sélé est composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 31ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font toutes le petit commerce de: produits cosmétiques (pommades, parfums,  crèmes à lèvres, colliers, bracelets,……), des pagnes wax et bazins. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kiatou (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits cosmétiques (pommades, parfums, crèmes à lèvres, lotions, déodorants et fars) de meilleures qualités et de plusieurs genres. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 cartons de pommade et 3 cartons de parfums en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Kiatou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Sélé group is made up of married women who live with their husbands and children. They are aged 31 on average and have five children each. They all live in Kanadjiguila and met through family, neighbours and friends. The group's members all work in the sale of: cosmetics (creams, perfumes, lip balms, necklaces, bracelets...), wax cloths and bazins (African cloths). In order to boost their working capital the group's members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity loan.  

Madame Kiatou (the lady standing at the far right of the photo) has a great reputation in selling good quality cosmetics by different brands (creams, perfumes, lip balms, lotions, deodorants and face powders). She aims to use her loan in order to bulk buy two boxes of creams and three boxes of perfumes from the large market. She sells these wares in Kanadjiguila to a customer base primarily made up  of women. Madame Kiatou hopes to generate an average monthly profit of  40 000 FCFA that will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: Jose Francisco mayor de edad casado originario del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se dedica a la compra y venta de mercadería en general como: ropa juvenil y adultos, cosméticos, zapatos, chineria, prendas de oro, plata y bronce, productos plásticos entre otros mas, realiza sus compras al contado en mercados de otra localidad, luego distribuye a comerciantes de esta municipio, y a centros de trabajos tiene clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales da al contado y al crédito recuperando semanal o quincenal. inicia su negocio con fondos propios buscando una forma de vida, debido a que por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, su jornada diaria  empieza desde muy temprano dedicándole a  su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto de forma ambulante.El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa nueva, zapatos, cosméticos, productos plásticos entre otros, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose Francisco is married, and is a native of the city of Chinandega, which is located in the western region of the country.  He works buying and selling general merchandise such as: clothing for children and adults, shoes, knick-knacks, gold, silver and bronze jewelry, and plastic products among other things.  He makes his purchases in cash in a market in another area.  He then distributes his merchandise to business in this city and other commercial centers.  He has fixed and prospective clients that pay in cash and on credit which he collects weekly or biweekly.

He started his business with his own money, searching for a way to make a living because due to a lack of financial resources, he was not able to attend college and had to work from a young age to help with the household expenses.  His day starts very early, and he works in his business about 10 hours a day offering his merchandise as a traveling salesman.

The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business of buying and selling new clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and plastic products among others, so that in the near future he can improve his earnings.

loans.use: purchase general merchandise such as: a variety of clothing styles, shoes, cosmetics, and plastic products among others.

loans.name: Richar Jony

texts.es: Richar de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica al cultivo de yuca y granos básicos desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Richar esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: controles de plagas, semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. y poder mejorar el terreno para hacer su siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía y así obtener un mejor cultivo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Richar is 34 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his family.  He has worked growing yucca and basic grains for many years.  He sells his products in various markets near his home.  With the earnings from his sales, he is able to cover his household expenses.

Richar is seeking a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as: pest control, seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc., and to improve the land (which can be seen in the picture) to plant his crops.  This will allow him to produce a better harvest, as it is his only source of employment, and to provide his family with their needs without any limitations.

loans.use: purchase pest control, seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc.

loans.name: Ildah

texts.en:
Ildah is a 29-year-old, married woman. She has two children, ages five years and eight years. She describes herself as being keen. 

Ildah operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes and onions. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are loyal customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of a storage facility. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of tomatoes and onions. Her business goal is to have a large grocery store within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her standard of living. 

This is Ildah's second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was successfully repaid. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stocks of goods.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Clara Eugenia

texts.es: Doña Clara es una señora de 55 años de edad, es comerciante de ropa y cosméticos, ha sido madre y padre a la vez, siendo soltera ha sacado adelante a sus hijos que hoy en día son independientes pero habitan en casa de doña Clara quien solicita de este crédito para poder invertirle a su pequeño negocio con ropas de la temporada como chores,  camisetas, chinelas, perfumes, crema para el cuerpo entre otros de mayor demanda por sus  clientes, para poder seguir vendiendo en su casa y de manera ambulante, espera en un futuro poder extenderse a otras zonas con mas mercaderías.
texts.en:
Clara is a 55 year old woman who sells clothing and cosmetics.  She has been a mother and a father all at the same time, as she is a single parent who has gotten her children ahead.  Although they are now independent, they live at home with her.  

Clara is seeking this loan to invest in her small business with clothing for the season such as: shorts, shirts, slippers, perfumes, and body lotion among other products that are in high demand among her customers.  This will allow her to continue selling her products from her home as well as door-to-door.  She hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand into other regions with her merchandise.

loans.use: purchase shorts, shirts, slippers, perfumes, body lotion.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 25 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre quien vende pupusas y su hija de 2 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, su negocio lo tiene ubicado afuera de su casa, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa y por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su madre logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, La clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa y zapatos por mayor para surtir su negocio y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejora calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client is 25 years old, and lives in a house that she owns with her mother, who sells pupusas (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans), and her two-year-old daughter.  She works selling clothing and shoes.  Her business is located outside of her home, and she has many customers given the variety of products that she sells and her fair prices.  With her earnings, and the help of her mother, they are able to cover some of their household expenses.

The client is seeking a loan to purchase more clothing and shoes in bulk to stock her business and therefore increase her earnings in order to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase clothing and shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 29 years old and from Nyahururu. He is married to Serah and they are blessed with four children who are 18, 18, 9 and 6 years old. He has been running his business of selling electronics and mobile phone accessories for the last five years. To enable him to install electricity in his home so that he can charge mobile phones for his neighbours for a fee, he has applied for his second loan of KES35,000 from VisionFund Kenya. His monthly income right now is KES20,000. Peter's plan is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children and to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya. In the future, he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to install electricity into his home so that he can offer phone charging services to his neighbours for a fee.

loans.name: Laura Marcela

texts.es:
Les voy a contar la historia de una niña llamada laura marcela que vivía en una casa con la mamá y la hermana, eran solas porque no tenían el apoyo del papá, por eso ella les tocaba trabajar los fines de semana para tratar de colaborar a la mamá a pagar los gastos del estudio, ella quiere en un futuro tener el propio spa con la hermana que también estudia cosmetología en la misma institución  para poder generar trabajo a otras personas que necesiten, pero para que ella pueda cumplir este sueño necesita para este proyecto  un gran apoyo económico ya que como menciono antes no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para pagar la cuota en el valor normal, gracias a información que le dieron ese apoyo económico se lo puede brindar KIVA.

Esta es la historia de una niña con deseos de ser alguien en la vida y no tener necesidades en un futuro y poder brindarle a la mamá una mejor estabilidad.
texts.en:
I am going to tell you a story about a girl named Laura Marcela who lives in a house with her mother and sister.  They were on their own because they did not have the support of their father, which is why they had to work on the weekends to try to help their mother pay for their schooling costs.  She wants to have her own spa with her sister, who is also studying cosmetology in the same school, so that they can provide jobs for other people who need them.  However, in order for her to reach this dream, she needs financial support, because as she has mentioned, she does not have the necessary resources to pay the full cost of her tuition.  Thanks to the information she was provided, she can get this financial help from Kiva.  

This is the story of a young girl with dreams of being someone in life, not being in need in the future, and being able to provide her mother with more stability.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Sikikadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sikikadi est composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent  toutes à Ouenzindougou et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font  le petit commerce d’habits pour enfants, des œufs, des produits cosmétiques, du bois de chauffage et du sable. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sitan (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits pour enfants de tous les âges. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  30 complets d’habits pour enfants de tous les âges en gros au grand marché. La revente s’effectue en détails à Ouenzindougou et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sitan espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Sikikadi group is made up of married women who live with their husbands and children in nuclear families. They are aged 38 on average and have four children each. They all live in the Ouenzindougou quarter and met through family, neighbours and friends. The group sell children's clothes, eggs, cosmetics, firewood and sand. In order to boost their working capital, the group's members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first loan. 

Madame Sitan (the lady sitting in the middle of the photo) has a great reputation in the sale of clothes for children of all ages. She aims to use her loan in order to bulk buy 30 children's sets at the large market. She will sell these in Ouenzindougou and via ambulant sales to a customer base primarily made up of women. Madame Sitan hopes that this loan will enable her to generate an average monthly profit of 40 000 FCFA which will be both reinvested into the business and used to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase children's clothes

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali, who is a 48-year-old divorced woman from Sagarejo district, lives with her daughter. The only source of income for the family is occasional compensation from her ex-husband, who sends the money to her daughter. The family lives under poverty and can't even meet their basic needs. Lali married at an early age and wasn’t able to get education and so she has no university degree, which is one of the main reasons for her unemployment. She looks after her daughter and stays home, but she has a great desire to be involved in a trading business. 

Lali couldn’t request a loan from financial institutions, until the Start Up program began, a joint product of Kiva and Credo. She requested a loan of 400 GEL to begin trading with clothing. She plans to purchase the products at wholesale prices and then resell them in her community.  This will give her a chance to earn income and somehow improve their living conditions. Lali will provide a better future for her daughter and will be thankful for your help.

loans.use: To start selling clothing

loans.name: Claire Ann

texts.en:
Claire Ann is aged 23 and has two children. She owns and operates a variety store for a living.

She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, detergent soap and assorted candies to sell in her store. With this business, she hopes that it can contribute to the improvement of their poor living conditions in order to give their children a better life.

If her loan request will be granted, she will develop her product offerings to further increase her income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, detergent soap and assorted candies to sell in her store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 43 years old, married to Zecharia, and together they are blessed with five children aged between 22 and 7 years old who are in school.

Margaret is in a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru which she has been practicing for twenty years. She has applied for her sixth loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy farm inputs, i.e., fertilizer, seeds and also pay school fees. With anticipated profit, she plans to pay the loan and pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to expand her farming business to enable her to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pay school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, ten boxes of tomatoes, ten nets of onions and five boxes of bananas.

loans.name: Rezaline

texts.en:
Rezaline is married, has 1 child and manages their own farm for a living.

She cultivates bananas and she needs financial assistance to produce more bananas. Without hesitation, Rezaline borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to cover replanting cost of bananas and for fertilization. She hopes and dreams to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to cover replanting cost of bananas and for fertilization

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Benkan ont en moyenne 36 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou un des quartier de Bamako et  se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Lafiabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits de la friperie de tous genres, d’encens, des condiments et des fruits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont  décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aïssata (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande  vendeuse d’habits de la friperie de meilleures qualités et de tous les genres. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une balle de friperie à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Lafiabougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aïssata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkan group are married and generally live in monogamous households. They are aged 36 on average and have two children each. They live in Lafiabougou, a quarter of Bamako, and met through family, neighbours and friends, as well as via their businesses in the Lafiabougou market. The members of the group sell second hand clothing, incense, condiments and fruit. In order to boost their working capital they decided to work with Soro Yoriwaso, and are on their first loan cycle.

Madame Aïssata (the lady standing at the far right of the photo) is a respected vendor of a large variety of good quality, second hand clothes. She aims to use her loan in order to buy a bundle of second hand clothes from Bamako. She will sell these at the Lafiabougou market and through ambulant sales, to a customer base primarily made up of women. Madame Aïssata aims to use this loan in order to drive an average monthly profit of 50 000 FCFA which will be reinvested into the business and used to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase second hand clothes

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of six grown up children.

Remedios has been in the farming business for more than 40 years now. This is the source of her income. Remedios is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

In the future, Remedios hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs and tables

loans.name: Isidro Armando

texts.es:
Isidro es un pequeño productor de café en una comunidad de Jinotega, departamento de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa en su finca de 28 hectáreas de las cuales 6.3 son de café. Sus 4 hijos también se dedican a la caficultura y cada uno cuenta con su propia parcela. En los últimos años, este productor ha logrado una cosecha de aproximadamente 200 quintales de café pergamino, los cuales produce bajo los criterios de certificación Fairtrade. En su comunidad él genera alrededor de 4 empleos durante todo el año, y en época de cosecha también contrata a 15 trabajadores para actividades de corte y cocina (preparación de alimentos).

Como parte de las mejoras que este productor viene implementando en su finca en materia de condiciones laborales y seguridad laboral, actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la construcción de un campamento que permita a sus trabajadores contar con las condiciones necesarias para habitar en su finca durante el período de corte de café. Esta acción contribuirá a un mejor rendimiento por parte de los trabajadores y por ende una mayor productividad, además está alineada a la responsabilidad social empresarial autogestionaria que la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) promueve entre sus afiliados. Para este ciclo de café, este pequeño productor también está solicitando un financiamiento para el mantenimiento de sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Isidro is a small coffee producer in a community in Jinotega, a department in Nicaragua. He lives with his wife on his 28 hectare farm, of which 6.3 hectares are planted in coffee [1 hectare = 2.47 acres]. His four sons are also involved in coffee growing and each one has his own plot. In recent years, this producer has successfully had harvests of approximately 200 quintales [1 quintal = 100 kg] of parchment coffee, which he produces under the criteria of Fair Trade certification. In his community, he generates around 4 full time jobs during the year and during harvest time he contracts an additional 15 workers to help with cutting and cooking (preparation of food). 

This producer is implementing improvements in labor conditions and labor security on his farm. As part of this, he is currently requesting a loan to build a camp on his farm so that his workers will have the necessary living condition during the coffee cutting period. This endeavor will contribute to better worker performance and greater productivity. It is also consistent with the self managed corporate social responsibility promoted by the Peoples Community Action Partnership (PAC) among its members. This small producer is also requesting funding for the maintenance of his plantations during this coffee cycle.

loans.use: to build a camp for his workers.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 42-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last year. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, and so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Abida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Abida is very much thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairs to her husband's auto rickshaw

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 17 y 13 años y su hija de 15 años de edad. Leticia comenzó su negocio de venta de tamales y pupusas desde hace más de 4 años. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en los puntos estratégicos de su localidad. Leticia desea terminar un cuarto el cual por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar. por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro para finalizar el cuarto y así poder contar con mayor comodidad.
texts.en: Leticia is 35 years old and lives in her own house along with her husband, her two sons who are 17 and 13, and her daughter who is 15.  She started her business selling tamales and pupusas [thick corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, meat, or beans] over four years ago.  She is a mobile vendor, selling at strategic locations around her community.  Leticia wants to finish building a room which she has not been able to afford to finish.  She requests this loan from FUSAI to spend on bricks, cement, sand, and iron so she can finish the room and be able to be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron to finish a room

loans.name: Riza Mae

texts.en:
Riza Mae, 18 years old, lives with her parents and six siblings. As second child, she was determined to be followed as a role model by her siblings. Her parents earn from their business while one serves as a barangay (administrative area) official. Riza Mae is a student at the university studying for a  bachelor of science degree in business administration.

She is requesting a loan to pay her tuition so that she can concentrate on her studies without worrying about her fees. If she graduates from the university successfully, it will be great help for the family. Her parents are hard-working individuals who are very caring to their children.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Martha De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Martha de  60 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos, los cuales están estudiando en la universidad. Es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser  trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar sus estudios,  y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los 

gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la distribución de gaseosas de distinto sabores como fanta naranja, coca coca, fresca, fanta rojo, coca chales. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias, ofreciendo su producto, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cajillas de gaseosas, para que un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Martha, 60, is a single mother with two children who are studying at university. She is from Leon located in the western part of the country. She is known for being hard working, responsible, and with a strong drive towards personal development.  Unfortunately, because of lack of economic resources she couldn’t go to school. She saw the need to work from a young age to help with household expenses. Now, she strives daily to provide a better future for her children.

Thanks to her efforts and her drive to get ahead, as an economic activity she sells different flavoured soft drinks such as orange Fanta, Coca Cola, Fresca, Fanta Rojo, imported drinks. She works about ten hours daily, selling her products. The business is located in her house. The aim for the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business in the buying and selling of cases of soft drinks so that in the near future she can gain a better income.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and supply her business in the buying and selling of soft drinks: orange Fanta, Coca Cola, Fresca, Fanta Rojo, and imported drinks.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from this business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Thelma hopes to have more loyal customers and dreams to give her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase hogs and feed needed for his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
He would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for him to buy additional hogs and feeds needed for his business. His profits from the business will definitely help sustain his family's daily needs and his children's educational expenses. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Nelson hopes to expand his business and dreams to have their own house.  He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of his life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional hogs and feeds needed for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine and cloth material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ayar

texts.en:
Ayar is a talented and passionate artist and entrepreneur. She links traditional Iraqi rug weaving with modern fashionable rugs, preserving traditional Iraqi rug weaving techniques and protecting them from extinction.
Traditional Iraqi handmade rugs hold a special place in the hearts of Iraqis, with every family, regardless of income level, having a traditional rug in their home. Ayar’s rugs are woven with love; love for her art, love for her heritage, and love for Iraq’s culture.
Ayar, a 53 year old mother of three, owns a small hand-woven rug workshop. In addition to supporting her own family, she employs four other women, thereby enabling them to support their families. 
To expand her business, Ayar is taking an SME loan in the amount of 10,000 USD. She will use this loan to move production to a larger workshop where she can increase the number of rugs produced and where she can have a showroom to display her rugs, thereby increasing sales. She plans to hire more women to work with her and will provide them with training in this traditional art-form.
Ayar describes her business with her own words in the video: “I’m Ayar, from Iraq, the owner of this handmade rug weaving business, which is one of the most Iraqi traditional works/arts. I received a 10,000 USD loan from Relief International to improve my business; I will rent a larger workshop where I can have a large fixed showroom. Thank you”. 

Note: The disbursal date for this loan is actually January 15, 2014, not January 29, 2014 as listed on this loan profile. Relief International initially tried to upload this loan to Kiva's system on February 14, however given the large file size of the video, it was not successfully completed within the 30 days Kiva typically allows for posting a loan to Kiva after the disbursal date. Because of the limitations of our system, and the technical issue that resulted in this loan not being uploaded as intended, Kiva has allowed Relief International to re-post this loan with another disbursal date. Lenders can still expect to receive repayments according to the noted repayment schedule for this loan.

loans.use: to move production of rugs to a larger workshop, have a showroom to display rugs & increase the number of rugs produced

loans.name: Imam

texts.en:
Imam lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Imam manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit. He is single.

Imam joined Ruma three months ago because he finds it interesting selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Imam is seeing improvements in his shop.  For the last three months, he has earned an average of $12 - 13 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 40-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto-rickshaw for the last five years. Over the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. 

However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. Therefore Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Zahida is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Njeri

texts.en:
Njeri is a lady of thirty-four, married to Kenneth and a mother of three children. She sells cereals and has been in this business for six years now. Njeri gets monthly income of 41,000 Kes. 

This will be Njeri's second loan with VisionFund Kenya, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy more cereals for her business. She wants to educate her children and expand her business in future.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell

loans.name: Delmi Janet

texts.es: Delmi de 40 años de edad se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por que su mercadería es fresca y a buen precio, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos quienes trabajan y le ayudan en los gastos del hogar, Delmi esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así poder tener junto con sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Delmi is 40 years old and dedicates to the sale of fruits and vegetables. Her business is located in a market near her place of residence. Her fresh products and good prices have given her a lot of customers. The earnings from her sales are enough to get by. She lives in her own house with her two children; both of them work and help her with the household expenditure. 

Delmi is requesting this loan to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk. This will allow her to continue with her business, since it is her only source of income, and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 41 years old and married.  She and her spouse are blessed with two children. She owns a private primary school, and she used her previous loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase textbooks for use in the school. She also used it to renovate the classrooms. Lucia plans to use this loan to pay school fees for her child. This will be her fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya, and she has repaid her previous loans successfully. She hopes to expand her school from the primary level to the secondary level.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles, who runs a tailoring business, used his previous loan to buy materials, such as threads, buttons, zippers and an iron box. The business has been profitable, and he now he makes a monthly income of KES 40,000. He will be using this loan to pay school fees his child, who is in high school. He will use the anticipated profits from his business to repay the loan and to pay additional school fees. His future hope and dream is to educate his children and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to pay school fees for hi9s child.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 64-year-old married woman from Kakamega county. She has been operating a grocery business for the last 20 years, earning an average income of KES 15,000 per month. She is taking her first loan of KES 10,000 with VisionFund Kenya to help increase her supply of tomatoes, onions, fruits and vegetables. The profits will be used to repay the loan and go toward savings.

Rose's dream is to prosper in business and life.

loans.use: to increase her supply of tomatoes, onions, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in Gandzaqar village with her son. They run a farm that currently includes two pigs, chickens and turkeys. Near the village where they live, Susanna also cultivates corn, cabbage and some grass as a forage for the livestock. Susanna raised her son alone and has had very difficult times. Now, by running her farm in a sustainable way Susanna is able to ensure a stable monthly income and support her son.
By applying for this loan, Susanna asks for financial support to purchase three pigs and some forage for feeding them. The loan will be a big support for Susanna and her son and they hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for three pigs and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard is a 30-year-old married man with one child. He describes himself to be determined and hopeful. He operates a M-pesa business where he offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be operating his business in a rented building. He will use the KES 50,000 loan as float, that is money for customers to withdraw in another M-pesa business which he will open. His business goal is to excel within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: as float, that is money for customers to withdraw in another M-pesa business which he will open

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a farmer living in the highlands area of Eldoret in the North rift side of Kenya. She is married and has five children between the ages of 1 and 18, three of who, are of school-going age. She enjoys farming very much and has been doing it for six years. She loves dairy farming, but her biggest challenge is fluctuating milk prices. Hellen chose Juhudi Kilimo because they offer low interest rates for their loans. During her training, she learnt how to develop a consistent saving habit. Through the income from this poultry loan, she will have improved housing and give a better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy poultry for her farm.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: María tiene 51 años de edad y reside en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas de 18 años y 15 años de edad. María se gana la vida por medio de la elaboración y venta de pan desde hace dos años. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. María desea construir una pared en su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento y arena para construir la pared.
texts.en: María is 51 and lives in her own house with her husband and her two daughters who are 18 and 15 years old.  She has been earning her living making and selling bread for two years.  This is how she makes a living and provides for her household.  María wants to build a wall in her house so she requests this loan from FUSAI to spend on bricks, cement, and sand to build the wall.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and sand to build a wall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa tiene 39 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hija. Teresa se gana la vid por medio de la venta de productos de belleza como: champo, ganchos, colas, cosméticos, etc. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad y desde hace más de 5 años. Teresa solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento y arena para reparar el techo de la vivienda y para encementar el piso de la misma.
texts.en: Teresa is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and daughters. Teresa makes a living by selling beauty products such as shampoo, hair clips, ponytail holders, cosmetics, etc. She has been selling her products from place to place in the main areas of her town for more than 5 years. Teresa is requesting this loan from Fusai for the purchase of galvanized metal sheets, wood, cement, and sand to repair the roof of her home and to lay down a concrete floor.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, cement, and sand to repair the roof of her home and to lay down a concrete floor.

loans.name: Fahriye

texts.en:
Fahriye is the mother of three adult children.  She sold women’s clothing for many years, and after that, she decided to make and sell manti (Turkish ravioli), pasta and pastries everyone enjoys.  She has been taking orders from her house for four years.  Sometimes she goes to markets. She will buy ingredients with this loan. Her products are popular because they taste like “mom’s cooking.” She wants to increase her sales by opening a small store.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Fahriye  ,yetişkin 3 çocuk annesi.  Uzun yıllar kadın giyim satışları yapmış, daha sonra evinde yaptığı mantı, makarna ,börek  herkes tarafından beğenilince, ticaretini yapmaya karar vermiş.  4 yıldır evden sipariş alıyor . Zaman zaman pazarlara çıkıyor. Aldığı bu kredi ile malzeme alacak.  Yaptığı ürünler anne tadında olduğu için beğeniliyor ve satış yapıyor.  Küçük bir dükkan açarak işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.
