loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a liquefied petroleum gas package because it prepares food quickly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a cooking gas package so that he can prepare his food very fast.

loans.name: Kantigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kantigui est composé uniquement de  femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 34ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce du  bois de chauffages, pâte d’arachide et  d’habits. Dans le but d’augmenter  leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une vendeuse du bois de chauffage. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 chargements de charrettes de bois de chauffage dans les villages environs  de Bamako.  La revente se fait en détail à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle majoritairement  composée de femmes. Madame Awa espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en: The Kantigui group is composed entirely of women living in monogamous families. On the average, they are 34 years old, with five children. They all live in Kanadjiguila. The group members sell firewood, peanut paste and clothing. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan. Mrs. Awa (the one standing on the far left in the photo) is a firewood vendor. She plans to use her loan to buy five truckloads of firewood in the villages around Bamako. She sells retail in Kanadjiguila, to a customer base   consisting mainly of women. With this loan, Mrs. Awa hopes to earn an average monthly income of 40,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es: Gloria tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad. Gloria se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace más de dos años y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Gloria desea construir un cuarto para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, ladrillo, hierro y arena y así dar inicio a la construcción del cuarto lo antes posible.
texts.en: Gloria is 37 and lives in her own house with her two kids, aged 14 and 12.  She provides domestic services and has been in this line of work for over two years.  This is how she provides for her household.  Gloria wants to build a bedroom, so she requests this loan from FUSAI to spend on cement, bricks, iron, and sand in order to begin construction of the room as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, iron, and sand to build a bedroom

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 34 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with one child aged eight years old. He has a quarry business and has been doing this business for five years. Right now his monthly income from his business is KES 40,000.

He will be using the loan to buy quarry tools like size pegs, mattocks and chisels. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay school fees for his child and repay the loan.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to buy a bigger land for a quarry and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy quarry materials to use.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla previously requested a loan for 12,000 PHP, which she used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
Luzvilla is requesting another loan for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will help sustain her daily needs and her children's educational expenses. Luzvilla hopes to have more tricycle units and dreams that her children will finish their studies.

Luzvilla meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and pay for maintenance for her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Milisah

texts.en:
Milisah is a 71-year-old lady from Kakamega county. She is a widow and all her six children are grownups.

She manufactures bricks, a business she has done for 10 years, making a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is taking KES 5,000 as her first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

This amount will be used in expanding her current business with the anticipated profits to be used in feeding her grandchildren while the rest will be ploughed back into the business.

Milisah's dream is to buy her own plot where she can manufacture the bricks with much ease.

loans.use: To pay for a plot where she burns the bricks to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for thermally efficient cooking using Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo es un productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 28 hectáreas de las cuales 12 son de café. En los últimos años ha logrado una cosecha de aproximadamente 500 quintales de café pergamino, los cuales produce bajo procesos de certificación: Fairtrade, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices. En promedio este pequeño productor genera 4 empleos en la comunidad durante el año, y en época de cosecha genera alrededor de 20 empleos. Como parte de las mejoras que este productor viene implementando en su finca en materia de condiciones laborales y seguridad laboral, actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la construcción de un campamento que permita a sus trabajadores contar con las condiciones necesarias para habitar en su finca durante el período de corte de café. Esta acción contribuirá a un mejor rendimiento por parte de los trabajadores y por ende una mayor productividad, además está alineada a la responsabilidad social empresarial autogestionaria que la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) promueve entre sus afiliados. Paralelo a esta solicitud de inversión, este pequeño productor también ha solicitado un financiamiento para el mantenimiento de su producción de café en el ciclo de café actual.
texts.en: Eduardo is a coffee farmer from northern Nicaragua. His plantation is twenty-eight hectares, twelve of which are for growing coffee. In recent years, he has managed a harvest of approximately 50,000 pounds of parchment coffee, which he produces in accordance with several certification processes: Fair Trade, UTZ, and Coffee and Farmer Equity (C.A.F.E.) Practices. On average, this small farmer generates four jobs in the community throughout the year; during the harvest season, he generates around twenty jobs. As part of the improvements that this farmer has been implementing in his plantation in terms of working conditions and occupational safety, Eduardo is currently applying for a loan to build a camp for his workers. This will allow his workers to have the necessary conditions to live at the plantation during the harvest season. This will contribute to a better output on the part of his workers and, therefore, a greater productivity. In addition, it is aligned with the self-regulated corporate social responsibility that the Association for People in Community Action (PAC) promote among its members. Similarly to this investment application, Eduardo also has applied for a loan to maintain his coffee production in its current phase.

loans.use: to build a camp for his workers.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 45-year-old woman. She is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing a transport service by driving a taxi for the last eight years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Safia's husband needs to do maintenance on his vehicle because its current condition is not good. There are maintenance costs to maintain his taxi. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to maintain his vehicle. Therefore, Safia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Safia's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily. In this way, he can provide better transport services and earn a profit. 

Safia also plans to save the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future. Safia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es: Edwin tiene 30 años de edad es comerciante y reside en casa propia junto a su esposa. Edwin se dedica a la venta de quesadillas y hotdogs desde hace más de 7 años. La venta de realiza de forma ambulante y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Edwin desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida por lo que ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de un nuevo carretón equipado (cocina y tambo de gas) y para comprar insumos como: botes de mostaza, mayonesa, salsa dulce, etc. y así poder mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos y por consecuencia su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Edwin is 30 years old. He is a businessman and lives in his own house with his wife. Edwin has been selling quesadillas and hot dogs for more than 7 years. He is a street vendor, which is how he earns a living and provides for his household. Edwin wants to improve his living conditions and has therefore made the decision to invest in his business. Because of this, he is requesting a loan from Fusai for the purchase of a new equipped cart (kitchen and tank of gas) and for the purchase of ingredients such as jars of mustard, mayonnaise, sweet sauce, etc. That way, he can improve his sales and income and therefore improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a new equipped cart (kitchen and tank of gas) and ingredients such as jars of mustard, mayonnaise, sweet sauce, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG)

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is 37 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family, consisting of seven persons. She is well trained in cloth stitching. She provides services in stitching to people at her own house. She needs to purchase a new sewing machine and a variety of stitching material for the shop, including thread, needles, clothing etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money she finds it difficult. So, Abida is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan so that she can buy a new sewing machine. Abida is very thankful to Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jimena Mabel

texts.es: Jimena tiene 22 años de edad  es madre soltera de un hijo de 2 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo y resto de grupo familiar. Jimena es pequeña comerciante, desde hace 3 años logro establecer una pequeña tienda en la cual distribuye variedad de productos como: aceite, pan dulce, huevos, sal, azúcar, macarrones, golosinas, etc. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Jimena solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el negocio en la compra de dos estantes para ordenar la mercadería y para comprar un mayor inventario como: cereales, golosinas, detergentes y de más productos atractivos para los clientes.
texts.en: Jimena is 22 years old. She is a single mother of a two-year-old son and lives in her own house with her son and the rest of her family. Jimena is a small businesswoman. Three years ago she succeeded in establishing a small store in which she distributes a variety of products such as oil, sweet bread, eggs, salt, sugar, macaroni, sweets, etc. This business is her main source of income, and in this way she makes a living and supports her household. Jimena is asking FUSAI for this loan in order to invest in the business by buying two shelves to arrange the merchandise and also to buy a larger inventory, such as cereals, sweets, detergents, and more attractive products for the customers.

loans.use: to buy two shelves to arrange the merchandise and also to buy a larger inventory such as cereals, sweets, detergents, and more attractive products for the customers

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a lady of fifty-five years, married to Harrison and a mother of six children. She is a dairy farmer in Limuru. She has been in this business for fourteen years now, getting a monthly income of 40,000 shillings.

This will be Agnes' fifth loan with VisionFund Kenya. Agnes plans to use the entire amount of money to buy a dairy cow to increase her stock of milk for resale. In future Agnes desires to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motor-vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Asep

texts.en:
Asep lives in West of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Asep manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  Asep is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Asep joined Ruma one month ago because he finds it interesting selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Asep is seeing improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he has earned an average of $30 per day  in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help Getrude purchase $4.00 kits that enable clean births for mothers

loans.name: Bitessi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BITESSI   est constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le village de Meridiela. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt. Le  précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de DIAKAN qui est la 2ème femme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, plusieurs qualités de condiments avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 24.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Bitessi group is made up of 6 married women who are on average 33 years old with 4 children each. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Meridiela. The women came to know each other through neighbors, friends, and business.

In order to improve their ability to better run their businesses, the women have partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their second loan. The previous loan was fully repaid. 

Diakan, the second woman standing in the photo from left to right, is in the business of selling spices. She plans to use her loan to purchase spices in bulk from wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales at the market and from her home, at retail for cash and credit to a customer base made up of both men and women. Diakan hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 24,000 francs CFA which she will reinvest in her business and use to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help Simon purchase $4.00 kits that enable clean births for mothers.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 29-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last few years. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, and because of this he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost. Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to have his rickshaw repaired. This will help him to continue his business. Shazia is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair an auto rickshaw

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 28 years old, married, and together with her spouse, she has been blessed with three children. She has a quarry business and she has been running it for three years now. She supplies building stones to various construction sites and it has been profitable.

She will be using the loan to employ more workers in her business so as to boost the production of building stones. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya Limited and her future hope is to improve the living standard of her family and educate her children.

loans.use: To employ more quarry workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Dieu Avec Nous Group

texts.fr:
Mme AZARA représente le groupe DIEU AVEC NOUS. Mariée, elle est mère de 07enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. 02vont à l’école et elle a 01personne en charge.
Mme vend du combustible (bois) et des jus depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les voisins.
Elle veut s’acheter 30rangée de bois et 01 sac de sucre.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut aider son enfant dans ses études. Elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mrs. AZARA is the representative of the group DIEU AVEC NOUS (God with us). She is married with seven children aged 12 to 30, two of whom go to school. She has one dependent. 

Azara has been selling fuel (firewood) and juices for seven years. She buys her merchandise at the local market and sells it to her neighbors. 

She plans to buy 30 rows of firewood and one bag of sugar. She will use her profits to support her dependent child in his studies. Her long-term goal is to buy some land.

loans.use: to buy 30 rows of firewood and one bag of sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy shark fins (seafood) at wholesale

loans.name: Alvaro Ismael

texts.es: Alvaro de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la reparación de electrodomésticos desde hace varios años, posee mucha clientela por que su trabajo es de muy buena calidad y a precios muy accesibles, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Alvaro esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos, control remotos para televisores y equipos de sonido,  herramientas, etc. para continuar con su trabajo y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Alvaro, who's thirty-four years old, lives in his own home with his wife and child. He has been repairing electrical home appliances for several years. He has many customers because his work is high-quality and his prices are affordable. With his earnings, he manages to cover some household expenses. Alvaro is applying for this loan to buy spare parts, television remote controls, sound equipment, and tools to continue working. In this manner, he will be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, television remote controls, sound equipment, tools, and so forth.

loans.name: Emilio Oswaldo

texts.es: Emilio de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la pesca y comercializa sus productos en los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Emilio esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de un motor nuevo así como el que muestra la fotografía para poder salir a pescar ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: Emilio, 46 years old, lives in his own house with his family. For several years he has been a fisherman. He sells his products in the markets located near his place of residence. With what he obtains from his sales, he is able to move forward with the household expenses. Emilio is asking for a loan to buy a new motor like the one shown in the photograph in order to be able to go out to fish, since that is his only source of work, and to thus be able to give his family a better quality of life with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy a new motor

loans.name: Susana Carolina

texts.es: Susana tiene 20 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Susana no contó con la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera Universitaria por lo que se vio obligada a buscar la forma de ganarse la vida y contribuir con los gastos del hogar. De esta forma es como aprendió el oficio de cosmetología y ahora es lo que le permite ganarse el sustento diario. Desde hace dos años comenzó con un pequeño salón de belleza en su hogar de residencia. Muchas personas confían en su trabajo y cada vez son más las personas interesadas en sus servicios. En vista de incrementar su negocio y convertirse en una de las mejores cosmetólogas de su localidad solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de productos de salón como: secadoras, lavadora de cabello con silla, plancha de cabello, espejos, etc. y así poder mejorar sus servicios con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y por consecuencia sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Susana is 20 years old and lives in her own house with her family. Susana didn't have the opportunity to study a university degree, so she was forced to find a way to make a living and help with the household expenses. Thus, she learned how to be a cosmetologist, which has allowed her to earn a living. 

Two years ago, Susana started a small beauty salon in her home. Many people trust in her work and more and more people are interested in her services. Given the need to increase her business and become one of the best cosmetologists in her town, she is requesting this loan from Fusai for the purchase of beauty salon products such as hair dryers, hair washing chairs, hair straighteners, mirrors, etc. In this way, she can improve her services in order to earn more income and therefore improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hair dryers, hair washing chairs, hair straighteners, mirrors, etc.

loans.name: Wezena Sect 30 Group

texts.fr:
KOUBAPIRIBOULMONA est responsable du groupe WEZENA SECT 30. Mariée, elle est mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 24ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 04personnes en charge. 
Mme vend des fruits et légumes depuis 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les  jeunes gens de la place.
Mme veut s’acheter 03cartons d’orange et 03cartons de bananes.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour faire un hangar. Elle ambitionne assurer l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
KOUBAPIRIBOULMONA is the head of the group WEZENA SECT 30. She is married with seven children aged 2 to 24, three of whom go to school. She has four dependents.

She has been selling fruits and vegetables for 12 years. She buys her stock at the local market and sells to the young crowd of the area. 

She plans to buy three cartons of oranges and 3 cartons of bananas. She will use her profits to build a shed. Her long-term goal is to provide for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy three cartons of oranges and 3 cartons of bananas.

loans.name: María Norely

texts.es:
María, a sus 62 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una señora servicial, carismática y luchadora, casada y madre de un hijo al que ha sacado adelante con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo.
Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, pues tiene una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en un espacio de su vivienda, allí ofrece mecato, productos de la canasta familiar, cerveza, gaseosas y licor, trabaja sola todos los días de 8 am a 7 pm y su clientela está conformada principalmente por vecinos, conocidos y viajeros que pasan por la carretera.
Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, galletería, carnes frías, gaseosas, granos y otros productos), esto le permitirá tener más variedad de artículos para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades, obteniendo como resultado un incremento en las ventas y en los ingresos.
María manifiesta que su edad no le impide soñar y mucho menos seguir luchando para alcanzar sus objetivos, es por ello que se proyecta teniendo un negocio mucho más grande y con más variedad de productos para ofrecer e incluir en su inventario alimentos preparados y almuerzos; así generará una mayor rentabilidad y estará en la capacidad económica de disfrutar una vejez tranquila en compañía de su esposo.
texts.en:
María, 62 years old, is characterized as being a woman who is helpful, charismatic, and a fighter. She is married and is the mother of a son whom she has moved forward with much dedication and effort.

For more than 20 years, she has worked as an independent merchant, since she has a grocery store located in a space in her house. There she offers pastries, staple goods, beer, soft drinks, and liquor. She works alone every day from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. and her customers are made up principally of neighbors, people she knows, and travelers on the highway.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to buy wholesale supplies (pastries, cookies, cold meats, soft drinks, grains, and other products). This will allow her to have a greater variety of items to offer her customers and to satisfy different tastes and needs, obtaining an increase in sales and income as a result.

María states that her age does not stop her from dreaming and much less from continuing to fight to meet her goals. That is why she plans to have a much larger business with a greater variety of products to offer and to include prepared food and lunches in her inventory; in this way she will generate more profit and she will have the financial capacity to enjoy a quiet old age in the company of her husband.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies (pastries, cookies, cold meats, soft drinks, grains, and other products)

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José es un hombre muy trabajador, trabaja como tractorista en un fundo de su distrito, lo cual le permite poder tener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo, sobre todo porque es padre de 2 hijos.

Jose está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Dar una mejor calidad de vida de su familia”.
texts.en:
José is a hard working man. He works operating a tractor on a farm in his district which allows him, with a lot of effort, to cover the household expenses, as above all he is the father of two children.

Jose is grateful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to the help offered to him he can make home improvements and thus be able to improve the quality of life of his family and continue fighting in order to reach his big dream: “to give his family a better quality of life.”

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Eloisa Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Eloisa se dedica al trabajo de costura desde hace mas de 35 años es madre de 5 hijos los que ha criado con mucho esfuerzo dando una profesion y estudios dignos, actualmente esta realizando reparaciones menores en su casa de habitacion como es la reactivacion de un dormitorio con la compra de materiales de construccion tales como ladrillos, cemento y otros
texts.en: Eloisa has been a dressmaker for more than 35 years. She is the mother of 5 children whom she has raised with much effort, giving them a profession and a decent education. Currently, she is making minor repairs to her house, such as renovating a room with the purchase of construction materials such as bricks, cement, and other items.

loans.use: to buy materials such as bricks, cement, and labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to preserve food

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida is 34 years old, and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to do hard work to feed her family; she is the mother of three children. To manage her household expenses, she owns a small tailoring business, with the help of her sister at home. Her sister has been helping and learning tailoring work with her, and now she has a lot of experience. She wants to buy a new Juki machine for her sister, so that she can contribute to her income by sewing clothes. Therefore, Zubaida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy a new Juki machine for her younger sister. She wants to make some savings, so that she can arrange the marriage ceremony of her sister. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a Juki machine for sewing clothing.

loans.name: Basmillah

texts.en:
Basmillah is a 33-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children.

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her tailoring business. She is a tailor by profession and very expert in sewing fine dresses. She has been sewing clothes for many years. This is the reason she has a lot of experience in her profession. Her sewing machine has become out of order and needs to be replaced with a new one but she does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy a new sewing machine.

Therefore, Basmillah has requested a loan, so that she can buy a new professional sewing machine.

Her family has to do hard work to get income for their huge family, and her husband also participates in her monthly income. Basmillah is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a professional sewing machine for her tailoring business at home.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 35 years old and living with her five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a motorcycle mechanic by profession; he repairs and troubleshoots motorbikes. He has been doing this business for many years. He provides these services near his hometown. Many people who have bikes like to have him repair them.

He has been running this business for many years and using very expensive tools for repairing which have depreciated. He wants to replace these tools with new ones, but he does not have the money to buy new tools. 

Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy new repairing tools and some spare parts for repairing motorcycles. Shazia thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy repairing tools and spare parts for her husband's motorcycle workshop.

loans.name: Sanemkoom Group

texts.fr:
Mr OUMAROU représente le groupe SANEMKOM. Marié, il est père d’un enfant âgé de 02ans. Il a 01personne en charge.
Il gère un cafétéria  depuis 06ans. Mr s’approvisionne dans les boutiques pour le café et le lait et à la boulangerie pour le pain. Ses clients viennent de partout.
Mr veut s’acheter un carton de sucre et  01 paquet de nescafé.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut renforcer son activité. Il ambitionne acheter un terrain afin de construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mr. OUMAROU represents the group SANEMKOOM. He is married with a 2-year-old child. He has one dependent. 

Oumarou has been running a cafe for 6 years. He buys his coffee and milk supplies at local shops, and he buys the baked goods at the bakery. His customer-base is quite diverse. Oumara plans to buy one carton of sugar and one pack of Nescafé. 

He will use his profits to bolster his activity. His goal is to buy some land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy one carton of sugar and one pack of Nescafé.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 26 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración quesadillas, posee mucha clientela por su amabilidad a la hora de vender y los precios muy accesibles. la clienta es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre esta en busca de darle lo mejor a su familia, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, latas, levaduras, manteca, etc. y mejorar el horno que es el que muestra la fotografía para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos, ella tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The borrower is 26 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She works making and selling quesadillas. She has many customers because of her friendliness as she makes her sales and the very affordable prices. She is a hard working woman who always is searching to provide the best for her family.

This is why she is asking Integral for a loan to permit her to buy wholesale flour, canned items, yeast, butter, etc., and also to make improvements to the oven that is shown in the photograph so she can continue in her work as this is her only source of income. She has the hope that this will provide her a way to offer her family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale flour, canned items, yeast, butter, etc., and to pay to make improvements to her oven

loans.name: Sanem

texts.en:
Sanem is a married, young entrepreneur.  She studied glass art at Turkey’s top-notch Anatolia University’s Fine Arts School.  She opened a small studio before opening a business.  She has had her small business for five years now.  She wants to buy a machine and a kiln for her studio. While she was studying, she exhibited three different works in Japan.  Through connections, she has sold her products to some customers in the Netherlands and the US.  She hopes to expand abroad. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Sanem Hanım, evli genç girişimci.  Türkiye çapında ilk olan Anadolu Üniversitesi Güzel sanatlar Fakültesi Cam bölümünden cam eğitimi alan sayılı kişiler arasında.  İşyerini açmadan önce küçük bir atölye kurmuş daha sonra işyerini açmış.  5 yıldır bu işi yapıyor.  Küçük bir işyeri var.  Bir atölye kurmak makine ve fırın almak.  Üniversitede okurken üç ayrı işi japonyada sergilendi.  Bağlantı kurduğu birkaç müşteri aracılığıyla Hollanda ve Amerika’ya ürünlerini satmış.  Yurtdışına açılmayı hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy a machine and a kiln for her studio.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta, who is 38 years old and married, lives in the village of Darcheli in the Zugdidi district.  She lives with her husband, daughter and son.  

Her husband works at a workshop and earns 250 GEL a month. The additional income the family earns comes from agricultural activity.  But this is an insignificant amount, as they have only nut trees and some chickens.  This income is hardly enough to meet all of their basic needs and daily costs, so Julieta wants to start other activity in order to more effectively deal with their financial difficulties. 

With the requested money Julieta will start a trading business.  In particular, she will purchase clothing and home products at wholesale prices in the capital and will sell among her villagers for an increased price. The loan will greatly assist Julieta and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better life.

loans.use: To buy wholesale clothing and home products

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José tiene 19 años, vive en el distrito de los Aquijes y cada día se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante, es por ello que trabaja como obrero, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder  salir adelante y sobre todo poder solventar el pago de sus estudios ya que actualmente cursa l carrera técnica de computación e informática.

José está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le brindan podrá comprar un CPU para poder realizar sus prácticas y trabajos, también poder comprar los materiales que necesita, así podrá seguir estudiando y luchando por hacer realidad sueño:” Ser un profesional importante”.
texts.en:
José is 19 years old, lives in the district of Alquijes, and everyday he makes a great effort to get ahead. That’s why he works as a laborer and uses his incomes to pay for his studies. He is currently studying to get a technical degree in computer science.

José is grateful for all the help that Kiva lenders have given him. Thanks to that help he will be able to buy a CPU, which will facilitate his work at school. He will also buy materials that he needs. With all of this, he’ll be able to continue with his studies and keep fighting for making his dream come true: become an important professional.

loans.use: to buy a CPU and materials.

loans.name: José Héctor

texts.es:
Don Héctor estudio 6° grado, esta casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tiene 7 hijos: tres de ellos estudian educación básica, los otros le ayudan en el trabajo de la tejera.
Su actividad productiva es elaborar teja y la distancia al trabajo es de dos cuadras a su casa, ahí se desarrollan entre él (Héctor) y sus hijos, en ocasiones le ayudan peones. Tiene 20 años de experiencia y se las transmite a sus hijos. Se levantan a las tres de la mañana para comenzar la jornada y descansan a las 10:00 am. Y luego a las 3:00pm de la tarde retoman el trabajo, recogen y ordenan la teja elaborada en la jornada de la mañana  terminando a las 6:00pm. 
Utilizara el préstamo para la compra de materiales como: leña, zacate, tierra blanca, barro y pagar el alquiler  del terreno donde elabora la teja. Si tiene este financiamiento podrá aprovechar la oportunidad de cubrir con los pedidos de los clientes que tiene, teniendo así  mayores ingresos para su familia.

Sus sueños son mejorar su casa, que sigan estudiando sus hijos, que tengan una buena alimentación, sacarlos adelante cada día mejorando siempre, que puedan seguir practicando, ya que él esta convencido que la tejera es buen negocio y que lleguen a se alguien en la vida honradamente.
texts.en:
Hector has a 6th grade education.  He is married and his wife works in the home.  They have seven children, three attend elementary school and the others help make tiles.

He makes tiles and works two blocks from his home and Hector and his sons develop themselves there.  At times he hires laborers.  He has been doing this for 20 years and teaches his sons what he knows.  They get up at 3:00am to begin the shift and work until 10:00 am.  At 3:00 pm they return to work and organize the tiles made during the morning shift, finishing up at 6:00 pm.

He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as firewood, soil, clay, and pay for rent on the land where he makes the tiles.  If he gets this loan he will be able to take advantage of the opportunity to cover his customer orders and improve his family income. 

His dreams are to make improvements to his home and for his children to be well fed and to get them ahead each day so that they can continue practicing, now that he is convinced that tiles are a good business so that each one can become someone in life through honest means.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for rent.

loans.name: Mobeena

texts.en:
Mobeena is a 22-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. He also assists his younger brother by purchasing a stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years.

Mobeena wants to grow the business of her husband so she has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 45-year-old married woman.  She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food.

She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house.  She has two years of experience in this field.  Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan to buy more stock such as packs of salt, biscuits, rice, flour, wheat and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store.  She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.  She is in her fifth loan cycle, but it will be the first loan with Kiva, and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: To buy more stock such as packs of salt, biscuits, rice, flour, wheat and beverages

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BENKOLA est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le village de Meridiela. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 9ème prêt. Les 8 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  viandes cuites à l’image de AWA qui est la 1ère femme debout  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 66kg de viande  avec les grossistes  de Meridiela. Elle effectue ses ventes, après cuisson, au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 33.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The BENKOLA group consists of five married women who average 28 years of age and four children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Meridiela. They know one another as neighbors and friends, and through their commercial activities. 

To bolster their working capital and improve their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organization. This is their 9th group loan, and all past 8 loans were correctly repaid. 

AWA sells cooked meats; she is the member standing first from the right in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy 66 kg of meat from local wholesalers. She cooks the meat and retails it to a mixed clientele, at the market and from her home, cash or credit.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 33,000FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan and to reinvest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Daguele Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DAGUELE est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le village de Meridiela. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à l’image de AWA qui est la 1ère femme debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 600kg de riz avec les producteurs des villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The group DAGUELE is composed of four married women who are, on average, 25 years old and have two children. They live in traditional families within the village of Meridiela. They met by connecting as neighbors, friends and through their commercial activities. In order to reinforce their financial capacity and improve their commercial activities, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now asking for their second loan. The first loan was satisfactorily reimbursed. This group of women have been involved in the sale of grains, including Awa, who is seen in the photo as the first woman on the left. She plans to use this loan to purchase 600 kilos of rice from farmers in neighboring villages. She sells these products at the market as well as from her own home, on credit, to a mixed customer base. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 32 000 FCFA that she will reinvest in her business as well as use to reimburse the loan.

loans.use: purchase grains

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 27 años de edad desde hace 2 años posee una venta de pupusas ubicada en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la atención que tiene con sus clientes, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gatos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su madre, su hermana y su esposo, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes necesarios como: frijoles, chicharrón, quesillo, maíz, tomates, repollo, etc. para continuar con su negocio que le genera buenas ganancias y poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en:
The borrower is 27 years old. She has had a business selling stuffed tortillas from her home for two years. She has many clients because of the good prices and because of her courtesy as she serves her customers. She is able to cover some of the household expenses with her earnings.

She lives in her own home with her mother, her sister and her husband. The customer is asking for a loan to buy necessary ingredients such as beans, pork rinds, cheese, corn, tomatoes, cabbage, etc., in order to continue in her business that generates good income so she can have a better financial stability along with her family.

loans.use: to buy beans, pork rinds, cheese, corn, tomatoes, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Nora Isabel

texts.es:
Nora es una mujer activa y emprendedora, a sus 31 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 4 años y vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental.
Desde hace 3 años comenzó a trabajar en el campo de la confección, oficio que aprendió de manera empírica y que hoy en día se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. Su taller se encuentra ubicado en la casa donde reside y sólo cuenta con dos máquinas que alquila, aumentando así los costos de producción.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio y acreditarlo, solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará una máquina plana y una recubridora, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y disminuir los costos de producción, pues ahorrará el dinero que paga por el alquiler de las máquinas actuales y esto repercutirá en el aumento notable de los ingresos que obtiene por su labor.
Nora manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener la capacidad económica para brindarle a su hijo una mejor educación y disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de sus seres amados.
texts.en:
Nora is an active and enterprising woman. At 31 years old, she is the mother of a four year old son, and she is living with her life partner.

Three years ago Nora started to work in dressmaking, which she learned through experience. Today, it is her main source of income. Nora's workshop is located in her home, and she has two machines that she rents, which increases the cost of production. 

With the aim of strengthening and establishing her business, she is requesting the support of a loan to buy a stationary sewing machine and a cover stitch machine, which will allow her to continue working and diminish the cost of production. Now Nora will save the money that pays for renting the current machines, and this will lead to a notable increase in income she gets for her work. 

Nora says her greatest desire is to have the economic capacity to offer her son a better education and to enjoy a better quality of life in the company of her loved ones.

loans.use: buy a stationary sewing machine and cover stitch machine.

loans.name: Nurten

texts.en:
Nurten is married and the mother of three children.  She sells underwear for children and adults.  She previously sold only children's underwear.  Now she sells a variety of quality products, which has led to a change in her client base.  She now caters to more customers.  She will use the loan from Maya to buy underwear wholesale and increase her variety of products.  Nurten has a courageous, go-getting, hardworking, and enterprising spirit. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Nurten Hanım,evli ve 3 çocuk annesi.  Çocuk ve büyükler için çamaşır satıyor.  Önceleri sadece çocuk çamaşırı satıyordu.  Şimdi karışık ve kaliteli ürünler satmaya başladı.  Dolayısıyla müşteri kimliği değişti.  Daha çok insana hitap ediyor.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile toptan çamaşır alacak.  Böylece ürün çeşidini arttırmış olacak.
Nurten Hanım,cesaretli,girişken,çalışkan ve girişimci ruhu taşıyor.

loans.use: to buy underwear wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, charcoal, etc., to grow her sales.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 35-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children.  Her husband earns a very low income. 

She owns a small business selling ladies ready-made garments out of her home. She purchases cloth from the market at a low price and sells it at a higher price in her community. The ladies of her town like her clothing collection and selection a lot. The demand for cloths has increased because the summer weather is about start and people are wanting summer clothing. 

She has requested a loan so that she can buy more variety of summer garments to fulfill the demand.  Rukhsana hopes for a bright future for her children and her dream is to provide a better education to her children. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and her field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy summer garments for resale.

loans.name: Beatriz De Lourdes

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 9 y 3 años y su hija de 7 años de edad. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y lociones de forma ambulante. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que desea mantenerlo activo por mucho tiempo dado que es lo que le permite llevar el sustento diario. Beatriz solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio con el fin de poder contar con mayor capacidad de venta y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Con el monto solicitado comparará variedad de ropa, zapatos y lociones.
texts.en: Beatriz is 25 years old, and she lives in her own house with her 9-year old and 3-year old sons along with her 7-year old daughter. She has been selling clothes, shoes and lotions for five years as a street vendor. This business is her main source of income, which is why she wants to keep it active for a long time, given that it allows her to provide for the daily household needs. Beatriz is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in her business with the aim of being able to have greater sales capacity, and in this way be able to improve her earnings and living conditions. With the requested amount, Beatriz will buy a variety of clothes, shoes, and lotions.

loans.use: buy clothes, shoes, and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is seeking a loan to pay for the costs associated with a Masters in Business Administration. This is his story: 
“My name is Benjamin and am currently the Chief Operations Officer of Juhudi Kilimo, an Agricultural Microfinance Institution in Kenya. I am requesting a Kiva loan to enable me pursue my MBA studies. This course will equip me with the knowledge and practical managerial approach that I can put into action and positively impact the organization. This will allow me to  have a greater impact on our farmers and transform their livelihoods and that of the communities we work in. This promise I hope to deliver.
I grew through the ranks to where I am now through hard work and by being passionate about small scale farmers and serving them diligently. I started as a Credit officer, then senior officer and Regional manager before getting the opportunity to head the operations at Juhudi. 
Juhudi Kilimo gives me great satisfaction, and I have never been as happy as now because every day I get to see the impact our loans have in transforming our farmers lives. 
After high school I engaged in small businesses like selling vegetables, mending shoes and other menial jobs to raise enough capital to start a barbers shop. My parents didn't have the means to send me to college so I used the income from my barbers shop to join my Diploma course. This certificate helped me get my first Job in Microfinance. I have since completed my Bachelors Degree in business administration, albeit with struggle as I still support my other siblings and aging parents.
Being the head of operations I am charged with the greater responsibility of ensuring business growth quality service to our farmers.There is need for me to upgrade my skills in leadership, operations and strategic management so as to be more effective in driving Juhudi strategy to reach 160,000 farmers with life transforming loans by 2016. This promise I will deliver to our farmers , and continue to transform their lives with your support.”

loans.use: to pay for the costs associated with a Masters in Business Administration

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena belongs to a poor family, and lives with her spouse and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a blacksmith.  He manufactures iron parts such as doors and windows which are used in houses. He has been providing door to door services to weld broken iron parts as well.
A few days ago his welding equipment become overheated and needs to be replaced with new one.  He wants to buy new welding equipment but he does not have money due to lot of household expenses. 

Therefore, Zareena has requested a loan from BRAC, who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy welding equipment for manufacturing.  

Zareena thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy welding eqiupment for manufacturing iron goods

loans.name: Irma Angelica

texts.es: Irma tiene 65 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de  fruta como: sandía, guineos, naranjas, pinas, y frutas de temporada. La venta la realiza desde hace más de 10 años y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Irma desea mejorar sus ingresos por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio con el fin de contar con mayor capacidad de ventas para lograr su objetivo de aumentar las ventas y sus ingresos. Con el monto solicitado comprará variedad de frutas como: sandías, naranjas, guineos, piñas, papayas, etc.
texts.en: Irma is 65 years old, and she lives in her own home with her life partner. Irma sells fruit like watermelon, bananas, oranges pineapples, and seasonal fruits. She has been doing this for more than ten years, and this is how she provides for the daily household needs. Together with her partner, they maintain their household's economy. Irma wishes to improve her income, which is why she made the decision of requesting a loan from FUSAI, which she will invest in her business with the aim of having a greater sales capacity to achieve her goal of increasing her sales and earnings. With the requested amount, Irma will buy a variety of fruits, including watermelons, oranges, bananas, pineapples, and papayas among others.

loans.use: purchase a variety of fruits like watermelons, oranges, bananas, and papayas among others to sell.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en: Nina lives with her husband, parents-in-law, and four children (ages 12, 11, 9 and 2 years old). The whole family is involved in agribusiness. The farm that they keep includes two cows, calves, chickens and six colonies of bees. The family also owns a plot of agricultural land where they cultivate corn, potatoes, and grass. Nina's husband owns a truck, and provides transportation service for his co-villagers. The family's main income is from agribusiness. The farming business is highly important for them. Nina has now applied for this loan to be able to increase her livestock by five more calves. The loan will be a huge support for this hardworking family's farm, and they really hope for lenders' support. As this is Nina's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase five calves.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DANAYA est constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le village de Meridiela. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3ème prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de YIRITIO qui est la 1ère femme assise  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, d’énormes qualités de condiments avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The group DANAYA is composed of six married woman, with an average age of 35 years and three children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Meridiela. They know each other through village connections, friendship and commercial activity. In order to reinforce their financial capacity in order to increase their level of commercial activity, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and are now asking for their third loan. The previous two loans were successfully reimbursed. This group of women sell condiments, including Yiritio, who can be seen in the photo as being the first woman seated from left to right. She plans on using her loan to to purchase large quantities of condiments from wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells these products at the market and from her home, in individual quantities for cash and credit to a mixed clientele. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 20 000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and reimburse her loan.

loans.use: purchase condiments

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en: Sakeena is 30 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last five years. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost. Therefore, Sakeena has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Sakeena is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw

loans.name: Rahat

texts.en:
Rahat is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing it for the past four years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. She sews garments of the nearest factories; her husband brings cloth from the factory. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operating her business, Rahat has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, because her previous sewing machine has become out of order due to continuously working. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of her revenue to deal with personal expenses. Rahat thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora teresa de Jesús es una madre soltera con dos hijos uno de ellos independiente y el otro en estudios universitarios a quien le asume los gastos de estudios que reside en la ciudad de condega desde hace unos 35 años de manera cantina y vive en su propia casa de habitación, es una persona muy conocida por los vecinos.
Teresa se desempeña como maestra impartiendo clases en un colegio de secundaria desde hace más de 24 años donde trabaja de lunes a viernes de las 7 am a la 1 pm, cabe mencionar que esta es su principal fuente de ingreso para sustentar sus gasto familiares.
Ella se presentó a las oficinas de ceprodel con el fin de solicitar una vez más un financiamiento que ella necesita para poder realizarse unos exámenes médicos y la compra del tratamiento que necesite ya que ella tiene problemas en la columna y esto le impide trabajar de una buena manera y le impide rendir a cómo debería en su trabajo. ella espera que le sea aprobado el préstamo y poder tratarse los problemas de salud que tiene y así seguir trabajando ya que ella es el sostén de su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús is a single mother of two. One of them lives by himself and the other one is still attending to college, and is the reason why she has to take care of the educational expenses. She has lived in Condega for 35 years, and has her own house. She is well-known by her neighbors. 

Teresa has worked as a teacher in a middle school for over 24 years. She works Monday to Friday, from 7 am to 1 pm. This is her main source of income to pay for the household expenses. 

She went to CEPRODEL with the purpose of asking for another loan. She needs it to undergo a medical test and pay for a treatment. She has back problems and isn’t able to perform correctly. She hopes to solve her health issues with this loan. This would allow her to continue working and keep supporting her family.

loans.use: to undergo a medical test and buy medicines.

loans.name: Eliap

texts.en:
Eliap is a 42-year-old man from Kakamega. He is married to Gaudensia, who is a small scale farmer in the same county. They have 5 children aged 20, 18, 17, 16, and 3, respectively.

Eliap sells plumbing tools, a business he has been in for the last 22 years. He earns an income of KES 25,000 monthly. This is his 9th loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 70,000, which he wants to use to buy more pipes, bolts, screws and taps to resell to the plumbers in the region. The profits will be used to pay fees and repay the loan. His dream is to open a mega store.

loans.use: To purchase plumbing tools for resale

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 32-year-old lady, living with her four sons and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a general store at home; she has allotted a portion of her house for the general store. One of her drawing rooms opens through the front side in the street; she is utilizing that room for the general store. She offers many items such as rice, flour, pulses, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She has been running this business for many years, and this is the major source of income for her family, because her husband’s earnings are very poor. Now she wants to grow her business by increments with the needs of her family. Because she decided to grow her business, she contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will buy rice, flour, pulses, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits, and she hopes that her general store will improve.  She praises this cooperation, and gives thanks to Kiva and field Partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, pulses, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is married and from Khashtarak village. The couple runs a farm which includes cows, calves, and chickens. Astghik also cultivates potatoes for family use only. Astghik milk cows and uses the milk in cheese production, which her husband sells in nearby markets. 

Astghik requested a loan, which she will use to purchase three more calves and forage for feeding them. As this is Astghik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. She will be very grateful if lenders support her farm and give her an opportunity to enlarge agricultural turnover.

loans.use: to purchase three calves and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seed, manure, fertilizer, herbicide, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric, fertilizer, and animal feed

loans.name: Barrio La Cañada Group

texts.es: El grupo “Barrio La Cañada” está integrado por ocho mujeres todas muy trabajadoras con muchas ganas de poder sobresalir en sus negocios y sacar adelante a su familia, se conocen desde hace ya varios años con el tiempo han llegado a construir una gran y sincera amistad. Ellas viven en una comunidad mazahua algunas personas aun se comunican en su lengua indígena, ya son muy pocas las mujeres que aun lucen sus trajes típicos caracterizados por sus colores muy llamativos. Algo muy característico de la comunidad donde se ubica el grupo es su pastizal muy verde y los hermosos paisajes de cerros muy frondosos. Adriana quien es integrante del grupo tiene 27 años de edad, solo estudio hasta la secundaria, se caracteriza por ser muy alegre siempre está de muy buen humor, vive en unión libre con su esposo Ángel quien trabaja como albañil, juntos han formado una familia con cinco niños de los cuales dos se encuentran estudiando. Adriana tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace ya cinco años. Esta vez está solicitando el crédito para comprar más productos de abarrotes como pan, huevo, leche, refrescos, productos enlatados, etc. Adriana platica que inició la tienda de abarrotes porque donde vive no había tienda para adquirir algún producto. Ella platica que gracias al crédito ha podido mantener su tienda de abarrotes, procura tener siempre un poco de todo para así tener a sus clientes contentos con su servicio. El negocio de Adriana marcha muy bien, tiene buenas ganancias todos los días tiene ventas, su único inconveniente es la competencia de las demás tiendas cercanas a las suyas pero esta situación no la desanima sino todo lo contrario todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para iniciar a trabajar .Adriana espera no bajar sus ganancias porque su única ambición en la vida es llegar a tener una tienda más grande y a convertirla en una miscelánea. Adriana comento: “Mi más grande deseo es ayudar a mis niños con sus estudios ya que yo no pude seguir estudiando". Los integrantes del grupo están agradecidos porque el crédito lo emplearán en sus actividades económicas lo que quizás les ayudara a aumentar sus ganancias y ampliar su negocio. Doña Irma y María Elsa, Verónica y María Juana invertirán en sus tiendas de abarrotes; Rosario y Ma Rosario invertirán en ropa y Marcelina en pollos.
texts.en:
The group “Barrio La Cañada” consists of eight women. All of them are hardworking and possess the drive to succeed in their businesses and to help their families get ahead. They have known each other for several years and over time they have established a great and sincere friendship.

These women live in a Mazahua community where some of the people communicate in their indigenous language. A few of the women still wear traditional garments that stand out because of their bright colors. Other things that their community is known for are the green pastures and lush vegetation that exist against a backdrop of beautiful rolling hills.

Adriana, age 27, is a member of this group. She only has a high school education and is always known for being cheerful and in very good humor. Adriana and her husband Ángel are in a common-law relationship. He works as a bricklayer and the two of them have formed a family that has five children, two of whom are in school.

Adriana has managed a grocery store for the past five years. This time she is requesting a loan in order to buy more grocery products such as bread, eggs, milk, soft drinks, canned goods, and other items. She says that she opened her grocery store because there were no other places to buy products in the area where she lives. Thanks to the loans, Adriana says that she has been able to maintain her grocery store and acquire a little bit of everything so that she can keep her customers happy with her service.

Adriana’s business is doing very well. Every day she is able to generate a good amount of revenue from her sales. Her only challenge she faces now is the competition from other stores nearby. However, she is not discouraged by this situation. On the contrary, she wakes up early every day so that she can begin working. Adriana hopes that her revenues don’t decline because her only ambition in life is to have a larger shop and convert it into a variety store.

Adriana says, “My greatest wish is to help my children with their studies since I was not able to continue my education.” The members of this group are grateful because the loan will keep their businesses going and allow them to expand, as well as increase their profits. Doña Irma, María Elsa, Verónica, and María Juana will invest in their grocery stores. Rosario and Ma Rosario will invest in clothing. Marcelina will buy chickens.

loans.use: to buy bread, eggs, milk, soft drinks, canned goods, and other items.

location.town: San Jeronimo de los Dolores, San Felipe del Progre

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dishes (plates, bowls, cups, etc.) and clothes.

loans.name: Joash

texts.en:
Meet Joash, a farmer living in the Kisii area of Nyanza, Kenya. He is married and has three children, all of school-going age. He has been doing farming for the past 14 years, with his major focus being on cash crops which he sells in the local market. What he enjoys most about farming is tea planting. His biggest challenges are transporting his cash crops and changes in climate.

Joash chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer better services to their clients and the loans have low interest rates. This loan will enable him to buy a dairy cow and sell the milk it produces, which will add more income and, thus, he will be able to comfortably cater to his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Paula Emilia

texts.es:
La Señora Paula Emilia, es madre soltera de 5 hijos y  posee un negocio de venta de  alimentos preparado, desde hace veinte años, se dedica a esta actividad  para  el sustento de su familia. 

Doña Paula inicia sus labores a la 9 am para preparar los  riquísimos platillos que sus clientes le solicitan,  finalizando a las 10 pm de lunes a domingo.
  
El  crédito que  solicito a Ceprodel fue  utilizado para compra de  arena, cemento y mano de obra los que serán utilizados para  mejora en su vivienda y así  tener mejor comodidad junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Paula Emilia is a single mother of 5 children and has a business selling prepared food. She has done this work for twenty years in order to support her family.

Paula starts her work at 9 a.m. in order to prepare the delicious dishes that her customers ask her for. She finishes at 10 p.m. Monday through Sunday.

The loan she requested from Ceprodel was used to buy sand, cement, and labor, which will be used to improve her house. In this way, she and her family will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and labor

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana es una persona que se esfuerza mucho por sus objetivos, es estudiante y también trabaja. Comenta que la única forma de poder salir adelante es estudiando y trabajando.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, ya que ella quiere poder ser una abogada prestigiosa que pueda ayudar a las demás personas.
Diana pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus cuotas de la universidad, para que así siga luchando por cumplir con sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Diana is a person who strives very hard to achieve her goals. She is a student, but she also works. Diana says that the only way for her to get ahead is to study and work.

She is studying for a law degree. Diana says that she wants to become a well-respected attorney so that she can help other people. She is requesting a loan in order to invest in her university fees. As a result, she can continue down the path to fulfilling her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Yeison Camilo

texts.es:
El se llama Yeison Camilo, nació en Bogotá el 09 de septiembre, es hijo de una hermosa familia que comprende a padres y hermanos, hijo responsable, honesto pero sobre todo con ganas de salir adelante, termino los estudios básicos a los 16 años, desde muy joven empezó a trabajar, lo primero que hizo fue ser empacador de mercados, en donde duro un par de meses, durante el mismo tiempo hizo un corto curso mecánica diesel. 
Al cumplir los 18 años Yeison empezó a trabajar en varios lugares como: agente de Contact center en una Aseguradora, agente de servicio al cliente en ETB y biselador en el laboratorio óptico del hermano mayor, luego y después de 4 años trabaja como biselador en otro laboratorio. A los 22 años y luego de mucho sacrificio logro matricularse a la escuela colombiana de carreras industriales en donde curso I semestre de Ing. Industrial, pero tuvo que aplazar pues para esa misma fecha, la esposa y novia por más de 6 años queda en embarazo, lo cual para Yeison fue una hermosa noticia, pues iba a ser papa por primera vez. 
Hoy hace dos años llego a la vida de Yeison esa persona que cambiaría la vida por completo, es quien da fuerza a cada una de las cosas y proyectos que se propone, el hijo y la esposa son quienes guían la vida, son el motor, le ha gustado desde siempre los carros y el mundo que gira alrededor de los mismos, porque lo apasionan y lo llenan de gratitud, el poder servir a las demás personas es la misión y el porqué de lo que le gusta.
Por eso tiene como meta y proyecto de vida terminar de estudiar y ser una mejor persona para la familia  de esta manera darles un mejor futuro cada día, la meta es ser Mecánico Automotriz profesional independiente que luche día a día por un mañana mejor, siendo un ejemplo de superación, responsabilidad y persistencia, demostrando que siempre vale la pena luchar por  los sueños sobre todo cuando tiene una hermosa familia para la cual es un HEROE. 
Hoy tiene 25 años, una hermosa familia, un trabajo estable, mil y un sueño, metas por cumplir y una de ellas es terminar la carrera que ha empezado en campo alto, la cual le sirve para tener un futuro laboral mas estable, pero  para eso quiere contar con el apoyo del convenio de kiva ya que es una buena manera para el poder economizar algún dinero y poder invertirlo en los gastos que le genera el estudio y el hijo que tiene.
texts.en:
Yeison Camilo was born in Bogota on the 9th of September. He is the son of a beautiful family that includes parents and siblings. He is responsible, honest but above all eager to get ahead. 

He finished his basic studies when he was 16 years old and began to work when he was very young. First he worked as a packer in a market where he worked hard for a couple of months, while at the same time he took a short diesel mechanics course.

At 18 years of age Yeison began to work in various places such as an agent in a contact center for an insurance company, as a service agent for ETB (telephone company) and as a beveler in his brother’s  optical lab, and later working as a beveler in another laboratory.

When he was 22 years old, and after a lot of sacrifice, he enrolled in a Colombian school of industrial studies where he took one semester of industrial engineering, but had to postpone it as his sweetheart and wife of more than six years became pregnant, which for Yeison was beautiful news, since he would be a first-time father.

Now it has been two years since this person arrived in his life, changing his life completely, who gives strength to each of the things and projects that he comes up with. The son and the wife guides his life, they are the motor. He has always liked cars, and since the world revolves around them, and because he is passionate about them and full of gratitude, serving others is the mission and because of that he likes it.

This is why he has the goal and life project of finishing his studies and being a better person for his family so that he can give them a better future every day. The goal is to be a professional independent automotive mechanic that fights day by day for a better tomorrow, being an example of overcoming, responsibility and persistence, demonstrating that it is always worth fighting for dreams especially when you have a beautiful family for which you are a hero.

Today he is 25 years old, has a beautiful family, a steady job, a thousand and one dreams, goals to accomplish and one of them is to finish his studies that he began at CampoAlto, which will provide more stable work in the future. But, in order to do this he hopes to have the support of a Kiva loan as it is a good way for him to be able to save some money and be able to invest it in the cost of his studies and childhood expenses for his son.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition

loans.name: Blanca Nubia
